story:
NATIVO at a glance

NATIVO has been conceived by 3 young creative minds. Here is who they are and what they think about the project:

  • Lupo Cordero, a Panamanian photographer and visual artist: "For me the NATIVO project is an introspective journey, one in the search for a shift in the current parameters of society."
  • Alberto Rossini, an Italian photographer specialised in nature and documentary photography: "The NATIVO project is in my opinion a unique attempt to open a positive discussion on diversity and social integration."
  • Harvey Wilson, an English designer and videographer specialised in creative story-telling: "The NATIVO project is an incredible and unique opportunity to capture film, photos and stories that have never been collated in this way before."

The NATIVO project is an 100% self-funded ethnological visual study about Panama’s 7 indigenous nationalities. It's a visual companion to the memory of these populations, a photographic archive that recounts the processes and problematic transformations that they face in relation to their environment and the rest of the mainstream society in Panama.

With this campaign we are looking for funds that can help us enable a future positive impact on those communities. We are going to collect all the images and stories that we find along the way and make a book that will be hopefully spread across the globe. We also plan to gather a series of video interviews as a snapshot of day-to-day life and personal stories all of which will be combined into a video documentary.

 

How can you help & What you get

In order for us to make the NATIVO project possible we need your help. We are looking for funding to help cover the costs of gathering all of the content but more importantly the capital to produce the first batch of photo books.

We aim to raise € 7.000, of which 15% will be used to cover the expenses while shooting in Panama and the rest 85% will be entirely used to print the book in as many copies as possible.

We are incredibly passionate about this project so it’s going to happen regardless of how much funding we receive. We hope others can see the value in what we’re trying to achieve and feel inspired to help us in our vision. So far we have covered part of the expenses ourselves, and have only been using the equipment and resources we already have in hand, yet to reach the next level, we reach out to you to help us make NATIVO a reality. The amount of funds that we receive thanks to your support will directly affect the scale and impact that this project has.

We invite you to step in as a contributor, and by doing so we are offering you a wide set of perks from a simple “Thank you!” message to premium prints and limited edition books. Please check them out!

 

Other ways you can help

There are many other ways you can help us, mainly by increasing our reach on social media. What else could you do to help NATIVO?

  • Following and subscribing to our channels on social media. We are on Facebook (/thenativoproject) and on Instagram (@thenativoproject) as well as on Youtube (Nativo Project).
  • Share our posts and videos with your friends and connections.
  • Invite your friends and connections to follow us on social media.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools so that other friends and connections of yours can help us too.

We will post live photos and videos while making the documentary on our social media, so stay tuned for live updates!

Thank you very much.

Lupo, Alberto & Harvey

story:
May 23: I have raised most of the money to cover the trip through hard work!  I am now going to focus on the equipment I need to start my career.  This will only work with complete transparency.  See the details below about trip finances and my forecasted equipment costs!

May 18: Wow! 3 funders on my first day!! Thank you all so much!






About Me:
Hello!  My name is Tristan Shearer.  I live in Eagan, Minnesota and will soon be a Senior in high school.   Going to Italy is a rare opportunity at any age, and I am excited to say I am going this July.  During the 12-day trip, I will get to experience in real life, what most students can only learn about through text books!  This opportunity is far more than just a student trip for me since I have an extreme passion and talent in the field of fine art photography.  I hope to come home with many awesome photos that I can use to start my own website, business, and presence in the fine art community.  It is a dream opportunity to practice my skills at such historical places with so much art, architecture, culture, and beauty … and to do it with proper camera equipment would make this more possible for me – no more lenses from thrift stores!

Photography has helped me break out of my shell and uncertain future giving me my new found confidence.  I enjoy experimenting with various ideas and techniques to photograph simple objects, as well as experiment with uncommon portraiture, macro, and landscape shots.  My studio is in my bedroom with a little black table and desk lamps from thrift stores.  I use whatever resources I have and combine that with whatever lighting effects I can create to capture the unique way I see things.  Surprisingly, most of my popular photos have been of thrift store junk taken in my bedroom.  The photos in my gallery are taken with the low quality equipment I currently have, and keep in mind that as a student photographer I explore various genres and techniques.  Recently, one of my more unusual photos was featured on DeviantArt’s front page that has been bringing attention to my work.  I was also surprised when the Minnesota Zoo requested permission to add some of my photos to their DeviantArt gallery. 





I’ve earned a portion of my trip, but have a ways to go.  Your support will help not only make sure my trip is covered, but also will allow me to obtain needed photography equipment which can cost thousands of dollars.   As you can see, this trip is not only a fun and educational opportunity of a lifetime, but I am hoping it will help me get a start on a career specializing in fine art photography.  It is comforting to know I have found my passion.  I truly don’t know of anything else I could do as a career that would be as fulfilling.  Please know your contribution will help me for my entire life and I will forever remember all the generosity as I earn my way to become one of the most famous fine art photographers of this century.  




I will forever be grateful for anything you can do, and will pay it forward in the future when I’m able.

You are welcome to see my work at www.tristanshearer.com 

For those who might be concerned about my age, my parents helped me setup this campaign.  They have invested in my website, trip and laid out the foundation for me to get started in a photography career.  My parents will manage the use of funds as defined in this campaign and full disclosure on use of funds will be provided to all funders.  I have sold my beloved Bass Guitar and am working for my parents' printer block business.

Equipment I need:
It is amazing how expensive photography equipment can be!  Here is my wish list of items that will maximize my abilities.  My goal on this site is far below what the equipment will cost as it all totals nearly $8,000, not to mention about $4,000 for the trip and the fees involved in using this forum.  I am hoping between your help and my hard work I can obtain a majority of what I need by the time I travel abroad in July.  If my support goes above and beyond, then I can start building a better studio with proper lighting.  This equipment will be useful for the entire start-up of my career and in the years to come. 

Italy Trip - Cost: $3893 - $3413 paid - I still owe $480
Passport - $160 - I covered this cost by selling some electronics on eBay

Nikon Nikkor 24-70 f2.8 ED lens: $2050.00
Nikon Nikkor 14-24 f2.8 ED lens: $1850.00 (used)
Nikon D600: $2150.00
Extended Warranties for above: $625
Nikon Mb-D14 Battery Grip: $274.00
2 Nikon Batteries: $70.00
2 64 GB CF cards and 2 64 GB SD cards: $650.00
Photography backpack: $125.00
Lightweight carbon fiber tripod: $125.00
Lightweight carbon fiber monopod: $110.00
Off-camera strobe flashes and flash modifiers: $500.00

Other Ways You Can Help:
If you have read my story to this point, you no doubt have a kind heart and I greatly appreciate that.  Whether you can contribute or not, please share my campaign by using the share tools.  The activity from sharing will help my exposure and keep my campaign alive.  Thank you all so very much!

May 18: Wow! 3 funders on my first day!! Thank you all so much!About Me:Hello!  My name is Tristan Shearer.  I live in Eagan, Minnesota and will soon be a Senior in high school.   Going to Italy is a rare opportunity at any age, and I am excited to say I am going this July.  During the 12-day trip, I will get to experience in real life, what most students can only learn about through text books!  This opportunity is far more than just a student trip for me since I have an extreme passion and talent in the field of fine art photography.  I hope to come home with many awesome photos that I can use to start my own website, business, and presence in the fine art community.  It is a dream opportunity to practice my skills at such historical places with so much art, architecture, culture, and beauty … and to do it with proper camera equipment would make this more possible for me – no more lenses from thrift stores!
Photography has helped me break out of my shell and uncertain future giving me my new found confidence.  I enjoy experimenting with various ideas and techniques to photograph simple objects, as well as experiment with uncommon portraiture, macro, and landscape shots.  My studio is in my bedroom with a little black table and desk lamps from thrift stores.  I use whatever resources I have and combine that with whatever lighting effects I can create to capture the unique way I see things.  Surprisingly, most of my popular photos have been of thrift store junk taken in my bedroom.  The photos in my gallery are taken with the low quality equipment I currently have, and keep in mind that as a student photographer I explore various genres and techniques.  Recently, one of my more unusual photos was featured on DeviantArt’s front page that has been bringing attention to my work.  I was also surprised when the Minnesota Zoo requested permission to add some of my photos to their DeviantArt gallery. 
I’ve earned a portion of my trip, but have a ways to go.  Your support will help not only make sure my trip is covered, but also will allow me to obtain needed photography equipment which can cost thousands of dollars.   As you can see, this trip is not only a fun and educational opportunity of a lifetime, but I am hoping it will help me get a start on a career specializing in fine art photography.  It is comforting to know I have found my passion.  I truly don’t know of anything else I could do as a career that would be as fulfilling.  Please know your contribution will help me for my entire life and I will forever remember all the generosity as I earn my way to become one of the most famous fine art photographers of this century.  
I will forever be grateful for anything you can do, and will pay it forward in the future when I’m able.
You are welcome to see my work at www.tristanshearer.com 
For those who might be concerned about my age, my parents helped me setup this campaign.  They have invested in my website, trip and laid out the foundation for me to get started in a photography career.  My parents will manage the use of funds as defined in this campaign and full disclosure on use of funds will be provided to all funders.  I have sold my beloved Bass Guitar and am working for my parents' printer block business.
Equipment I need:It is amazing how expensive photography equipment can be!  Here is my wish list of items that will maximize my abilities.  My goal on this site is far below what the equipment will cost as it all totals nearly $8,000, not to mention about $4,000 for the trip and the fees involved in using this forum.  I am hoping between your help and my hard work I can obtain a majority of what I need by the time I travel abroad in July.  If my support goes above and beyond, then I can start building a better studio with proper lighting.  This equipment will be useful for the entire start-up of my career and in the years to come. 
Italy Trip - Cost: $3893 - $3413 paid - I still owe $480Passport - $160 - I covered this cost by selling some electronics on eBay
Nikon Nikkor 24-70 f2.8 ED lens: $2050.00 Nikon Nikkor 14-24 f2.8 ED lens: $1850.00 (used) Nikon D600: $2150.00Extended Warranties for above: $625Nikon Mb-D14 Battery Grip: $274.002 Nikon Batteries: $70.00 2 64 GB CF cards and 2 64 GB SD cards: $650.00Photography backpack: $125.00Lightweight carbon fiber tripod: $125.00Lightweight carbon fiber monopod: $110.00Off-camera strobe flashes and flash modifiers: $500.00
Other Ways You Can Help: If you have read my story to this point, you no doubt have a kind heart and I greatly appreciate that.  Whether you can contribute or not, please share my campaign by using the share tools.  The activity from sharing will help my exposure and keep my campaign alive.  Thank you all so very much!

story:
** version franÃ§aise en-dessous **

Our story

At the end of April this year, I will be travelling to Dharamsala in Northern India to photograph Tibetans in exile. During a 4 months stay I am planning on documenting who are the Tibetan refugee more than 50 years after the invasion of Tibet.

What We Need & What You Get

What is needed is :

  • 1800 $ for Black and whites negatives
  • 350 $ to have both my camera`s check out
  • 290 $ for a waterproof case
Total 2440 $ rounded up at 2500 $

What you get depending on your donations is detailed here on the right. Keep in Mind that everything is made in limited edition and with love. I will update pictures of some of the perks as soon as available. Just remember, you can give whatever amount you see fit and if you think you can give in some other way just contact MAc.

Why this project ?

1959 marks the Triumph of the Cuban revolution (see my work on Cuba here) but also the flight of the Dalai Lama to India following the invasion of Tibet by the Chinese People Liberation Army (PLA). As with the Cuban revolution, many thought that the occupation of Tibet would not last and that sooner than later "things would go back to Normal". More than 50 years later, the third generation of Tibetans born in exile still has not set foot in a country now only remembered by refugees in their eighties. Can an exile last more than 50 years ? How long before the new generation start to define themselves as Indian, Nepalis, Swiss or Canadians? What effect has the continuous flow of refugee on the community living "outside" Tibet for half a century ?
Those are some of the questions behind the "Tibetans in Exile" project and Dharamsala and its surrounding. (the second biggest concentration of Tibetan refugees in the world and the location of the government in exile)
This is the first step of a long term project that will expand in the year to come.

What else ?

Check out my web site maclupus.net, tumblr, facebook, and@maclupusdotnet
Pass on the word and don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions
Thanks for being here !

story:
Top hats and tails guaranteed!

Mr August and Miss January

Hi! I’m Awon Golding, a London-based milliner and proud dog-mum to a rescue mutt called Stevie. This is Haute Dogs, a beautiful full-colour 12" x 12" calendar for 2019. Each month features an ex-All Dogs Matter rescue dog wearing a one-of-kind hat by an all-star milliner. We're raising money for UK dog charity, All Dogs Matter. My love for animals and passion to help less fortunate pups inspired me to make this unique project.

Awon and Stevie

4 years ago I adopted Stevie from All Dogs Matter and she’s been my sidekick ever since. She's provided me with companionship during long lonely days at the studio, a familiar story to a lot of milliners. Haute Dogs was born of a desire to show dogs like Stevie in a new light. 

Together with pet photographer, Rachel Oates, and 11 other dog-loving milliners including superstar hat maker, Philip Treacy, and the Queen's milliner, Rachel Trevor-Morgan, we set about creating a fun and meaningful calendar. 

Our cover girl, Liza, and sample calendar spread

Our dream is that others will also benefit from the loving companionship of a rescue dog and that perceptions of so-called ‘less desirable’ dogs are changed. 

Behind the scenes of the shoot

All photos by Rachel Oates, pet photographer extraordinaire. Check out 'The Perks' section to nab yourself a shoot with her.  You'd be barking mad not to get a perk! 

 

The Perks

Your pledges will help to get the Haute Dogs Calendar into production and help hundreds of needy pups. Help us hit our £5000 target! We've sweetened the deal with these awesome goodies. 

  • Haute Dogs Calendar: Full-colour, 12" x 12", 28 printed pages of pure doggy goodness. Each month features an ex-All Dogs Matter rescue dog wearing a one-of-kind hat by an all-star milliner, all photographed by Rachel Oates. You'll get the gorgeous photo, the inspiration behind the hat, and the adoption story of the doggie model. 
  • Haute t-shirt: 100% cotton t-shirt rocking the slogan "Adopt don't shop!". 
  • Haute tote bag: "Adopt don't shop" heavy canvas tote bag. Useful, durable and sustainable.  
  • Photo session with Rachel Oates: 2-3 hour shoot with you and your pooch. Will travel any where in the UK with a max travel cost of £50. Anything over this will need to be covered. 
  • Awon Golding Millinery hat: Commission your very own hat by this award-winning milliner. Choose any piece from the website. Shipping included. 

 

The Impact

Ira, the founder of All Dogs Matter

All Dogs Matter is a registered dog rescue charity based in North London, established in 2009.  Last year, All Dogs Matter rescued and re-homed over 350 dogs! The team rescues unwanted/abandoned dogs from all over the UK and uses a mix of foster homes and kennel spaces to protect the dogs in their care. 

All the profits from this campaign will be donated to the charity to help towards vet fees and the upkeep and provision of rescue dogs in kennels and foster homes.

£3 is one day’s meal

£10 is a night in a warm kennel

£15 pays for a microchip

£25 is one vaccinations to keep a dog healthy

£85 neuters a dog so they can’t be exploited for breeding

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Get the word out! Tell everyone you know. Howl at the moon. It's for a good cause :-)
  2. Pass on the campaign link to your dog-loving friends and family. Just click share #sharethelove
  3. Repost this campaign on social media. You can also follow us on Instagram for updates - @hautedogscalendar
  4. Help us reach our goal and support the important work behind the scenes by buying a perk. #AdoptDontShop!

If you're looking for a little more bark for your buck we've put together some great quality t-shirts and tote bags. Be the toast of the town whilst supporting an amazing cause #Adoptdontshop

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges will be getting everyone's *correct* shipping information in a timely fashion. Please make sure your information is up to date here on Indiegogo, and if you have any questions or issues, don't hesitate to get in touch info@awongolding.com.

We'll be shipping the calendars and merch in November in time for Christmas. 

For T-shirts please make sure you've specified which size you'd like.

story:
Hi! My name is Amber-Rose and I am a Fine Art Photography student at the University of Derby. I am looking to raise funds in order to be able to make more analogue photographs for an E-Book, which I am excited to be making on urban decay and abandonment.

I am extremely enthusiastic about this project and really need to raise some money in order to make it a success! As I am a student, you can imagine that it is hard for me to have the money that I need in order to make this project the best it can possibly be, so that’s where you come in!

The funds raised by you will mainly be put towards the costs of the 35mm black and white film that I am making the photographs with, however, some money will also be needed to provide me with petrol so that I can travel about and find the most interesting locations to shoot!

By contributing to this project, you would be helping me achieve my goal of making a beautiful e-book, which I could then make available online so that you can see what your generous donations helped me to create! If I do not reach my target through your donations, you will receive your money back and I will have a half-completed project, so please, contribute what you can and spread the word on Twitter and Facebook or wherever you like by posting the link and fingers crossed we can make this project a success!

 

Don't forget to check out the gallery for 6 more photographs from the project too!

story:
Who we are & Why we need your help!

We are the Senior Photography class at The University of the Arts in Philadelphia, PA who have been working on our individual senior thesis'. To celebrate our creative efforts we are having two shows to exhibit our work for everyone to see.

Our show is entitled Four Over Four, sponsored by The University of the Arts Alumni Association. Opening reception for our Off-Campus show will take place at the IceBox in the Crane Arts Building at 1400 N American St, Philadelphia, PA 19122 on Thursday May 1, 2014 from 6-9pm.

Opening reception will take place at Hamilton Hall at 320 S Broad St, Philadelphia, PA 19102 on Friday May 2, 2014 from 5-7pm.

Our goal is to raise $$$$ so we can have two amazing show openings to display our work and celebrate the end of our undergraduate career here at UArts. The money you donate will go towards...

  • Food & Drink at both opening receptions
  • Promo cards to help get the word out there
  • Paying for the rental space at the Icebox

We thank you for your generosity and hope you will be able to attend our opening receptions! Also, feel free to check out our shows during the following days, open to the public:

April 28- May 10th, 2014 - Hamilton Hall at The University of the Arts - 320 S Broad St, Philadelphia, PA 19102

April 29- May 3rd, 2014 -Icebox at the Crane Arts Building -1400 N American St, Philadelphia, PA 19122

For more images please check out our tumblr of senior photo work:

Thank you to all those who have donated! We truly appreciate it!

To celebrate our creative efforts we are having two shows to exhibit our work for everyone to see.Our show is entitled Four Over Four, sponsored by The University of the Arts Alumni Association. story:
​THE COCKETTES PHOTO BOOK PROJECT

The Scandalous History of THE COCKETTES in Pictures​

The Cockettes story:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cockettes

The Cockettes Photo Book will be a 288 page book, printed in Italy, that will be an abundant collection of the best photos from twenty different photographers spanning the entire arch of the group's career, along with essays by contributing artists, anecdotes of our escapades, profiles of the members, flyer and poster art and choice media quotes from the era. The book will come in two versions.

The first will be a First Edition Hardcover Book of 288 pages.  First Edition printing will be limited to 1500 copies so it's an instant collector's item.

The second will be a Deluxe Limited Edition Hardcover, 288 page book in a Slipcase. Only 500 will be printed so this is a primo collector's item. The Deluxe edition will be numbered and come with a signed Silver Gelatin Archival Print of The Cockettes, 8 x 10, 11 x 14 or 16 x 20, depending on donation.

The Cockettes Book Project is an important part of the history of American Culture as The Cockettes could not have happened in any other social climate than in the democracy of our great USA, especially in the 60's and 70's, when we peaked, democratically.   You can only imagine what it was like, the pictures really do tell the story.  

The era in which we grew was one of complete personal freedom which I now feel is at risk. There needs to be this evidence of that different time, to be reminded of what we are all capable of; individuality, equality in race and gender, authenticity in artistic expression and the ability to be experimental without caring what others may think. 

Our group consciousness was very powerful and produced a lasting contribution to Pop Culture. We came from a place of Communal Love and Support. Future generations need to see the trajectory of this American aesthetic, from the Beats to the Punks, and The Cockettes are a vital link within that strong chain.

The Cockettes live shows were wild and filled with the intense creative energy that pervaded San Francisco in 1969-1970.  We wanted to crash through the barriers of conventional theater and produce the kind of sheer Magic that had never been seen before.  We were experimental in every way, every show was different.  We challenged each other to be as far out as possible both on and off the stage.  We lived at the end of our imaginations every day and put it all onto the stage.

Have you seen our 2002 documentary THE COCKETTES?  You can screen it here: http://www.cockettes.com/

Some reviews of the film:

“The Cockettes” is an engaging tribute to a theatrical troupe that was the sensation of the late 1960s and early 1970s hippie movement in San Francisco. They were, as John Waters describes them, “hippie acid freak drag queens,” and this sympathetic, straight-ahead look at “people who were allowed to live at the end of their imagination” is a charming and nostalgic revisiting of a lost corner of recent cultural history… This comprehensive and charming film not only recalls those days exactly, it also manages the wonderful trick of taking us back there along with it. –Kenneth Turan, The Los Angeles Times

A flamboyant piece of hippie history gets its due in Bill Weber and David Weissman’s loving look at the San Francisco drugs-and-drag theatre troupe. The filmmakers capture the spirit of life in a late-sixties commune as well as the Cockettes’ hallucinogenic romps—performances foisted on audiences who were in the mood for wigged-out frivolity. With its archival footage and hilariously frank interviews, the movie makes for a ragtag portrait of a cultural moment when free expression reigned supreme. — Bruce Diones, The New Yorker

A fascinatingly detailed snapshot of the flamboyant outer reaches of countercultural San Francisco in the hippie years and an emotional celebration of diversity, liberation, sexual anarchy and fabulousness, “The Cockettes” joyously re-creates the brief but resplendent reign of the legendary freakadelic drag troupe… . The climate of all-embracing acceptance, blurred sexual lines, joyful transgression, rebellion and freedom comes through with warmth, humor and nostalgia. — David Rooney, Daily Variety


STAIRWAY TO PARADISE

I came to San Francisco in the fall of 1968 with my camera in hand. After my initial reincarnation through psychedelics, I, along with my commune of artists, founded our group The Cockettes.  Our Shaman was the great Hibiscus.
We ascribed to The Diggers Philosophy of Free, therefore we shared everything, especially our ideas. Nothing was sacred and we aimed to dissolve all sexual and societal boundaries, along with the theatrical fourth wall. 
Our common ground was the desire to reveal our inner fantasy life on our bodies, to live as we dreamed and to put it all onto the stage. 
From the moment we flung ourselves onto the stage, our lives became entirely about our shows. We performed from New Year's Eve 1969 until the Spring of 1972, primarily at the Palace theatre in North Beach but we also did street performances and other venues as well. 
The San Francisco Chronicle was reluctant to put the word Cockettes in the paper, just as the theatre owner couldn't bring himself to put our name on his marquee but when the celebrated columnist Herb Caen put us in his column, that did it and we became the Talk of the Town. The theater was always packed for our shows which we did once a month. 
Soon we were featured in all the underground rags as well as Rolling Stone. There is a tremendous wealth of photography from photo journalists to fashion photographers and artists of the underground, including my work as well. 
The challenge will be in the editing as I want to include as many fabulous images as possible. 
I have a brilliant book designer who lives in Paris and is himself an independent book publisher: http://www.firstthirdbooks.com/
With your help, I will be able to publish a gorgeous book.

The Cockettes at The Walker Art Center!  Hippie Modernism; The Struggle For Utopia

http://www.walkerart.org/calendar/2015/hippie-modernism-struggle-utopia

So thrilled and proud to have our theatre troupe The Cockettes included in this magnificent show.

I spent an incredible week at the Walker Art Center, attending opening weekend and culminating in my Cockettes Evening, talk and slide show!

http://www.walkerart.org/calendar/2015/cockettes-evening

AND an interview that I did for City Pages, Minneapolis, MN.

https://soundcloud.com/am950s-best-interviews/the-morning-grind-fayette-hauser-october-26-2015



Back in Seattle for the Seattle International Film Festival showing of The Cockettes 2002 cult classic documentary, concluding with a lively discussion about the era with Michael Cepress, curator of Counter Couture: Fashioning Identity in the American Counter Culture.  My Cockettes ensemble is featured in the Performance section of the exhibition!

Along with Scrumbly's infamous Doily Suit from Native Funk & Flash!


AND Hibiscus' Magical Scrapbook, our original source of inspiration for the early Cockette shows.
To see the complete show, view here:
http://www.bellevuearts.org/exhibitions/counter_couture.html

 Have you seen the beautiful poster reproduction of the Cockette poster for Pearls Over Shanghai, by Pristine Condition?  Offered as one of the perks in the campaign Package.  Get yours now!!


UPDATE!!!

Greetings to all supporters of The Cockettes Photo Book Project

Lots of fantastic events have transpired recently in the World of The Cockettes! 

 Both museum shows that have featured installations of our group, the exhibition Hippie Modernism: The Struggle for Utopia which originated at the Walker Art Center last November, 2015 will be traveling to the Cranbrook Museum in Detroit, June 2016 and then to the Berkeley Museum and Pacific Film Archive, Berkeley, CA in Feb. 2017. http://www.walkerart.org/calendar/2015/hippie-modernism-struggle-utopia 

Also the wonderful exhibition Counter Couture: Fashioning Identity in the American Counter Culture will be traveling to the Museum of Arts and Design in New York City in Feb. 2017. http://www.bellevuearts.org/exhibitions/counter_couture.html 

And I will be traveling to London on April 24th, 2016 to appear at the acclaimed performance venue The Horse Hospital in Bloomsbury, London to host a Cockettes Film Night.  

http://www.thehorsehospital.com/now/the-cockettes-on-film-with-fayette-hauser/

I also recently contributed an interview for the latest edition of the beautiful UK fashion magazine ODDA, their 10th edition called Tributes.  We have a double page spread as well as a featured fashion layout.  Check it out!

http://oddamagazine.com/


And when I'm in Europe in May I will be traveling to France to work with my European book designer on the layout for The Cockettes Photo Book.  I'm working towards having the book available for all these fabulous events in the coming year of 2017.

So much attention is being paid to the Zeitgeist of the Counter-Culture all over the world and The Cockettes are right in the thick of it!  So if you haven't already ordered your first edition copy, you can do so here:

https://www.gofundme.com/8z4v8d9mk

story:
Hey! I’m Mike. Here's my story

For a decade I’ve molded my life around travel and photography. How? I’ve embodied frugalism to save money; moved abroad to explore new continents; and bargained hard to pry extra vacation time (without pay) from employers.  Earlier this year I launched my travel/photography website and took a plunge: I quit my job and sold all my things to pursue writing and photography projects full-time.

One of my dreams has always been to publish a photography book. And since I began travelling, I've been fascinated by people whose livelihoods are difficult, dangerous, rare, strange, or just different.   So with your help I hope to publish this book showcasing these interesting people and professions.   

The world, at work.

 

________________________________________________________

 

** Update: We did it! The book is shipping now. 

If you haven't ordered yours yet, please do now before this limited edition book sells out. 

** Update Sept 2017: IGG has decided to charge exorbitant fees for non-US citizens (I don't exaggerate; last payout I lost 70% to fees. It's criminal) so please order from my Amazon store -----> 

https://www.amazon.com/World-Work-People-traditional-surprisingly/dp/0995016402 

Don't forget to tell your friends, too :) Thanks again to everyone who has contributed or purchased a book! 
If you're new here, please keep reading my original campaign story below!

 

________________________________________________________

(Zambian Mining Surveyor)

(Lao Bar Wrangler)

 

(Chinese Snack Vendor)

________________________________________________________


The Book

It will be hardcover and case-bound, printed on quality paper (105#) with a gloss finish. A beautiful book containing the very best photos and interesting backstories from these journeys and encounters.

If we just reach the $3000 target, it will be 8x10" and 50 to 55 pages long. But wait! There's more.. you all get an upgrade, if we hit the stretch target.  More on that below.

 

 

(Now that the book has been printed, the actual cover!)

 

 

 

(Now that the book has been printed, a sample photo)

 

(Actual mock-up of two page spread)

 

 

 

 

________________________________________________________
 

Perks (aka rewards) for contributors

To give something back, I'm creating a mix of items to match at various Perk levels. Of course the shining star (queue: angels singing) will be The Book – but I've organised a great printing company to make high quality art prints; I'll create postcards from images which won't be featured in the book; and have photography lessons I've used to teach dozens of others. 
 
If you're eyeing the 'Saint' perk, I assure you that I've got lots of entertaining stories to share from my travels! (just check my website's Experiences, if you want a preview). 
 
The last, but not least perk for everyone is: warm fuzzies!! For helping me realise something I have worked very hard for already – and I know there's lots more hard work to come!
 
In summary, your rewards will include some of:

 

(note: I might not wear a tie.)

 

________________________________________________________
 
How will the funds be used?
Self publishing is expensive. The cost per book for small volumes is ridonkulous, so without enough pre-order funding this project cannot happen.  Even if we hit the funding target I might still be paying nearly a thousand dollars out of pocket to print the extra copies required to reach the minimum order size. 
Here's what the budget breakdown looks like (an estimate; it depends on exact mix of rewards chosen, and funds raised):
 
         

 

My experience with a previously successful crowdfunding project – and, as an engineer, project manager, and frugalist – should evidence my abilities to deliver you this book and rewards.

I consider this project as interesting as it is valuable: Helping educate us about other people's very different daily grinds; inspiring us to pursue life's opportunities; and humbling us to be grateful at work the next time we want to complain about the slow coffee machine.
 

(Indonesian Contractor)

 

 

 

 

 

(Chinese Hat Vendor)

 

 


________________________________________________________
 
 

What if we surpass the target? Overfunding and my 'stretch' goals

The target is $3000. If we can't achieve this: No book :(  and everyone's funds are reimbursed. If we reach this of course it's high-fives all around! The book will be made! 

If we can raise $3700, everyone wins a bonus! I will add more content and larger photographs on extra pages (70+ in total). 

If we go beyond $4500, I'll share the book well beyond this campaign, making it available in libraries, cafes, schools and bookstores. With additional funds I might even be able to hold a photography exhibition (another dream of mine!).

________________________________________________________

 

Other ways you can help

Some of you undoubtedly would not like to, or are not able to contribute financially. That's fine! If you like what I'm doing here, perhaps you can help in other ways?

  1. Email people you think would find this (limited edition) book interesting!
  2. Share this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share buttons!
  3. Join my mailing list to follow future adventures and projects.

 

 

 

Since this project is fulfilling a dream, I want to thank everyone who contributes, for helping to really realise a reality. For real.

story:
WHO IS DURGA?

Is she just the goddess who we have celebrated for ages as the embodiment of feminine power? Is she not present in every woman, rich, poor, young and old? Then why do we love one and humiliate the other?
DURGA is a study on gender bias and extreme discrimination against widows in India. It lays bare the hypocrisy of a society that chooses to shower adulation on one woman and extreme humiliation on another, depending on who suits its selfish needs.


HOW DID I START TO WORK ON THIS?

A couple of years back, I happened to visit Vrindavan, a holy city in Uttar Pradesh, in India. A chance visit to a shelter home opened my eyes to the world of a widow. What I saw affected me deeply and will remain with me for the rest of my life. I saw a dark room with more than a dozen beds lined up against both the walls. There on the beds sat old and ailing women, in tattered white saris, with blank look in their eyes.

Who were these women, where did they come from, where was their family…

many questions crowded my head. I tried talking to them. A few of them poured their hearts out, a few didn't remember. But what started out as a one-to-one talk that day, urged me to go back to Vrindavan again and again.



ABOUT THE PROJECT: 

It’s been three years since I embarked on the journey of taking photos in many shelter homes across Vrindavan and Varanasi. Over the months I compiled this into a photo essay, which was able to generate a lot of curiosity and awareness on the subject. Friends, acquaintances, complete strangers wrote back to me, overwhelmed by the story. The project found much love and appreciation and was part of the prestigious Goa International Photo Festival in 2015. The story has since been published in various magazines and newspapers. 

I STRONGLY FELT THE NEED TO COMPILE THIS INTO A PHOTO BOOK.

Even though I had made progress with the work, the need to compile this into a book kept me pushing further. And then during a shoot in Vrindavan, a woman asked me sharply ‘why do you keep asking us for our stories, what good will this be, will it really help us?’

The question really made me determined to know more. Why were the widows meted out such harsh treatment? Was it simply because the society was superstitious about widows bringing bad luck or was there a bigger conspiracy behind all this? What is their current situation and what is being done to improve their condition? I decided to dig deeper and what came tumbling out were unbelievable facts and a deeper conspiracy behind their abandonment, tracing back to more than 200 years, with its root in Bengal. 

There is a huge need to create more awareness on the subject. Even today, hundreds of widows are forced to leave home and end up in shelter homes and the streets of Varanasi and Vrindavan. Denied of dignity, they lead lives of utter penury and humiliation, till death decides to claim them.


WHO WE ARE AND HOW WE TOOK THIS AHEAD.
Last year I finished photographing and began working on the photo book with a team of writers, editors and documentary film makers. We are a small group of people from different professional backgrounds, but with the common love to do challenging visual and communication projects. 

Rakhi Biswas, a fashion stylist by profession, plays the role of Durga and the protagonist in the story. Madhurpriya Choudhry Sinha, co-author of the book has written award winning advertising campaigns and scripts shows for television. She brought out the book The Chowfins of Garwhal, on Chinese tea experts in the mid 19th Century. Ayan nandi, a documentary filmmaker and photographer, helped me with documenting many an interview at the shelter homes. Subinoy Das is a passionate photographer and a documentary filmmaker. With his help I was able to produce a small documentary film about the entire project. Raghav Panda is a graphic designer and an expert on image editing.

I am hugely indebted to Dr. Bindeshwar Pathak, the founder and Director of Sulabh International Social Service Organisation, for his continuous support. He and his team are a source of huge inspiration with the kind of work they have been doing for the welfare of the widows. Needless to say, without his help it would have been impossible to even have access to the innumerable shelter homes that I have had the good fortune of visiting and documenting. 

I am also very thankful to Dr. V. Mohini Giri, the founder and director of Guild of service and the ex- chairperson of the National Commission for Women. She has been doing groundbreaking work for the wefare of young widows and her thorough research has helped me compile this book. I am also very thankful to Ms. Meera Khanna of the Guild of Service for her inputs on the book.

SPECIFICATIONS OF THE PHOTO BOOK

The work now is in its final stages and its launch, scheduled for July 2016 will be accompanied by an exhibition in India. But like many photographers, I have decided to opt for self-publishing. Which basically means, the onus to print, publish, distribute and market the book lies completely with my humble team and me. The book will be printed in 4 colours, will be hardbound, with roughly 90 pages. It will have approximately 120 black and white and colour photographs.



DURGA NEEDS YOUR SUPPORT. AND EVERY BIT COUNTS.

In order to launch the book in an appropriate way with the desired editions of 100 copies to begin with, we will need funds. This is where we need your support. By making a contribution, large or small, you will not only help to bring the book out, but in a way will be involved in spreading awareness on the subject. Your contributions will also be used for various other important jobs like editing, proofreading, designing, website hosting, launch and marketing of the book. This is not just a photo book but a thoroughly researched book on the widows and shelter homes in Vrindavan and Varanasi.

In return for your support, we would like to give back Prints from the series and hard copies of the book as tokens of our appreciation. There are e-books available too, for the overseas donors. Everything depends on what you opt for. (Please check the right hand side for details on the perks available.)

THIS IS HOW WE SHOW OUR LOVE.

With every 100 USD, a portion of the money gets donated in your name to the widows in Vrindavan. Indian donors get a copy of the Durga Photo Book, plus a set of 2 prints of 21cm X 30cm on fine art paper. Your name gets featured on our website. Donors outside India get an e-book and a set of 5 images of their choice. 

With every pledge of 70 USD you can get a Copy of the Durga Photo Book, plus a set of 2 prints of 21cm X 30cm on fine art paper. Your your name gets featured on our website. Donors outside India get an e-book and a set of 5 images. 

With every pledge of 55 USD, you can get a Copy of the Durga Photo Book. Plus your name gets featured on our website. Donors outside India get an e-book and a set of 3 digital images. 



With every pledge of 35 USD, you can get 2 prints of 21cm X 30cm on fine art paper. Plus your name gets featured on our website. Donors outside India stand to get 3 digital images of their choice.
DELIVERY OF PERKS
Publication and delivery of the book will start after the campaign deadline. All contributors will get the perks promised, irrespective of the funds raised during this campaign. 
If you choose to support by opting for the perks with the digital content ( e-books, digital images) then these will be delivered within a month, through email, during the campaign period itself.  Mail me at sharmistha.dtt@gmail.com
We will be happy to list every contributor's name on our website as a token of our appreciation. After pledging your support, please help to spread the word about this project by sharing this page with your friends and contacts. 
Thank you!
story_txt:
WHO IS DURGA?
Is she just the goddess who we have celebrated for ages as the
embodiment of feminine power? Is she not
present in every woman, rich, poor, young and old? Then why do we love one and humiliate the other?DURGA is a study on gender bias and extreme discrimination
against widows in India. It lays bare the hypocrisy of a society that chooses to shower adulation on one
woman and extreme humiliation on another, depending on who suits its selfish needs.


HOW DID I START TO WORK ON THIS?
A couple of years back, I
happened to visit Vrindavan, a holy city in Uttar Pradesh, in India. A chance visit to a shelter home opened my eyes to the world of
a widow. What I saw affected me deeply and will remain with me
for the rest of my life. I saw a dark room with more than a dozen beds
lined up against both the walls. There on the beds sat old and ailing women, in tattered white saris, with blank look in their eyes.
Who were these women, where did they come
from, where was their family…many questions crowded my head. I tried talking to them. A few of them poured their hearts out, a few didn't remember. But what started out as a one-to-one talk that day, urged me to
go back to Vrindavan again and again.



ABOUT THE PROJECT: 
It’s been three years since I embarked on the journey of taking photos in many shelter homes across Vrindavan and
Varanasi. Over the months I compiled this into a photo essay, which was able to generate a lot of curiosity and awareness on the subject. Friends, acquaintances, complete strangers wrote back to me, overwhelmed by the story. The project found much love and appreciation and was part of the prestigious Goa International Photo Festival in 2015. The story has since been published in various magazines and newspapers. 


I STRONGLY FELT THE NEED TO COMPILE THIS INTO A PHOTO BOOK.
Even though I had made progress with the work, the need to compile this into a book kept me pushing further. And then during a shoot in Vrindavan, a woman asked me sharply ‘why do you keep asking us for our
stories, what good will this be, will it really help us?’
The question really made me determined to know more. Why were the widows meted out such harsh treatment? story:
Names Thai and I’m a london based photographer. 

As some of you may already know I’ve been working on this project named "Always" for just over a year now, refining, pulling my hair out and reconstructing again, I'm sure you can imagine a lot of time and passion has gone into this my very first printed works and I’m excited to share with you all but first i require your help to bring it to fruition. 

Always is a collection of candid moods and moments captured on my travels.

To make Always a reality i will need raise £3000 toward printing of the zine as well as creative experience like film, travel.

If for what ever reason i am unable to reach the targeted amount i will use the money raised toward a small exhibition show casing some extracts from the zine itself in hopes of raising even more awareness (but i have faith you’ll all hold me down)

 

Depending on how much of a contribution you make you maybe eligible for a range of perks like 

free prints, postcards and a well as signed copies of the zine. 

 

Contributions of 

£2 -  will receive LOVE (the best kind)

£5 -  will receive set of postcards

£10 - will receive 2 sets of postcards

£25 Plus - will receive a copy of the zine

£28 Plus : will receive a copy of the zine + postcards

£50 Plus  : will receive a copy of the zine + postcards + art print 

£100 Plus : will receive a copy of the zine + postcards +  2 art print 

 

(All contributor will receive their perks regardless if the target is reached of not) 

 

lastly If you are unable to contribute this doest mean you can’t help, please share with all your friends.

story:
About Me

I'm Jennifer Brunjes, a New Orleans photographer. I use traditional film techniques and processes to create the nuances  of the world inside my head.  You can view some of my work at Jenniferbrunjesphotography.tumblr.com



About the Project

Ragnarok is a project I have been working on since 2012. It began as a small little idea that came to me as I was sitting on the stoop singing to the moon in the wee hours of the night. It grew from that small idea into an in depth photographic journey through the wild lands of Norse Mythology. 


Norse mythology lives in a realm of power and noble strength. The tree Yggdrasil giving stability to the nine worlds in which this mythology habitates. Ragnarok is a series of predicted future events, it is the end of things as they are. The Gods, Goddesses, and creatures of the nine worlds deserve to be remembered before the future forgets them.  My goal is to interpret and illustrate the subtle beauty of this not so subtle mythology.



The Funding

Some people say film is dying. I say screw that. Film is a medium unlike any other, an organic matter that captures particles of light. Light that moves across worlds created by the artist. This incredible medium is a rather expensive one. Most of the funding for this project will go toward film and processing. The rest will go to lighting equipment, costumes and locations. 


If I don't reach my goal, Ragnarok will remain the unfinished project it is now. Help me to give these Gods and Goddesses of old voices once more. Their stories are ones that can teach many things often forgotten in the hustle and bustle of modern life. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    This story is one that I feel I must interpret. It is one I have to share. Please help me create this by sharing it with others.

story:
Short Summary

The purpose of this project is to show off all of the great parts of Birmingham, AL and its rise to becoming a great city. This photo book includes high resolution images of beautiful landmarks that are distinct to Birmingham. From the iconic Alabama theater, to the brand new Birmingham Barons stadium, to downtown's beloved Railroad Park, Birmingham is bursting with hundreds of attractions that keep the city thriving. Birmingham is proving each year why it is definitely a "comeback town." Whether you're a local, a one-time visitor, or you used to call Birmingham home, this is the perfect book to reminisce on your love for the Magic City and all it has to offer.

“Birmingham is coming alive—it’s flexing its muscles.”-National Geographic Traveler

“The burgeoning culinary scene in this city isn't about getting fancy; it's about making things accessible.”-Zagat

“One of the ten great places for a fabulous film festival”-USA Today

“Birmingham, Al–One of top 15 cities with emerging downtown”-Forbes

“UAB in top 10 best medical schools”-U.S. News & World Report

We deviate in our specific interests yet we see ourselves as a complimentary team, and Birmingham, AL is a unique and appropriate location for this collaborative project.

The book will be a place for our voices to speak together, intermingle, and communicate the potential of photography. Our images aim to show the feelings and memories associated with the best parts of Birmingham.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help with travel costs, book design, and publishing costs. As an invested audience, you have no idea how much your interest excites us!

Here is the album company we are using. They have a proven track record with our team, and they have high quality products at low costs.

 https://pinholepress.com/products/4-90099/?c=3eb00831-1ef9-4193-8bba-2826d2551d0d

story:
Hi, Friends!

This Year, Jessica Manning of Focus on Felicity Photography would like to spread felicity by focusing on others, not through a lens, as usual, but through kindness and compassion! 

To do this, she needs your help!

She has picked out five fantastic charities she feels passionate about and hopes you will help her reach her goal of $500, which will be divided equally between:

St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital to give kids a fighting chance!

The Wounded Warrior Project to help a soldier!

The American Cancer Society to join the fight for more birthdays!

Feeding America to give a meal to a hungry child!

and

The Humane Society of the United States to help those who cannot speak for themselves!

100% of the proceeds will be divided equally between these five superb organizations, down to the last red cent! I will be posting the donation confirmations on my Facebook page once the money is divided and given to the charities!

Thank you in advance for helping Focus on Felicity Photography bring smiles in a different way this year!

story:
Introduction

I’m starting this campaign to gain more experience photographing, raise some money in order to learn more about photography and to provide interesting stock photos with backer input. The goal is to shoot at least 150 photos of Architecture, Roads and Nature in and around Etten-Leur, Holland, Europe.

If this project is a success, I will eventually start other such project for different cities here in Holland.

If you have a question or a specific subject request you can always send me a comment via my profile.

 

What I will do for you

I plan on shooting a minimum of 150 photos (named “base” from this point onwards) in the town that I live in (Etten-Leur, Holland, Europe).
These photos will include a varied amount of subjects including:

  • Architecture (buildings, windmills)
  • Roads & Paths
  • Nature (Fields, trees)

Besides this base set I will take extra photos of specific subjects for anyone according to the perks.

For the $75 perk: The amount of photos received in the end increases each time someone adds another subject while selecting the $30 perk.

 

What your contributions will be used for

The money raised by this project will be used for various materials that I need to get the photos to you in a good state.

Around €50,- ($66) will be used to purchase a better tripod than the one I have right now.
The remaining amount will be used to cover other costs such as research, transportation, study materials and editing software.
Anything that is left afterwards is kept in a jar to be saved up for a more professional camera.
 
Of course, a percentage also goes to indiegogo and other partners.

 

What happens to your money when the goal isn't met

When the goal isn't met I will still continue to take photos and give them to everyone who has shown interest in this project by picking a perk.

story:
What are Peregrine Optics Talons?  

The Talons are a microfiber cloth with 2 sheaths that fit over the user's fingers.  Our design dramatically improves control of the cloth, allowing the user to remove dirt and debris from a lens or filter effectively but gently (which is critical when cleaning delicate, expensive lenses). Finally, the Talons Kit also includes an ultra-portable, organic, anti-static, non-toxic cleaning spray, in a spray bottle that is only as wide and tall a credit card and a half-inch thick!  That way, you can take them everywhere you go and have crystal clear vision no matter where you are.  


What else are Talons good for?  

Our testers overwhelmingly agreed that Talons are great for camera lenses, but also for glasses, sunglasses, smartphones, and tablets, and any other personal gadget that gets grimy throughout the course of the day.  Gone are the days of balancing a square cloth between your fingers while removing grime from these items, or smudging them even more when the edge of your finger goes over the edge of the cloth!


What are people saying about Peregrine Optics Talons?  

Professional photographers who tested or purchased the Talons kit have loved it without exception.  For example:
  • British documentary journalist Giovanni Tait actually purchased one of our test kits, took it during a shoot out in the rain, and wrote on his blog that the rain is "never the easiest environment to clean a lens filter, but the talons managed to remove all residue, without leaving any of the usual lint traces or smears."
  • Baltimore Photographer John Kardys remarked on his Facebook page that the Talons Kit "is a terrific product for cleaning your lenses and filters.  It works great on glasses too."
  • Many of the people who purchased our test units have come back to our website to leave great feedback!

Talons will help change the world through photography, and here's how:

This is the story of the quest of Jon and Rob (that's us, two guys from Baltimore) who, in late 2011, decided it was time to pursue something we've always been passionate about: using photography to inspire positive change in the world.  Motivated in part by a belief in human creativity, faith in the power of a moment in time captured in a still image, and a generous touch of total insanity, we created the platform to inspire change through photography (a blog called The Focused Perspective) and an entrepreneurial mechanism to support the blog's initiatives (the photography equipment company Peregrine Optics).


Our Blog

Photography is not just art; it is a unique way of educating and inspiring people because it can speak directly to the soul.  We envisioned an interactive photography community that could discuss and highlight how photography has changed, and continues to change, the world.  (Check out the gallery tab on this campaign for some great examples.)


Our Company

We created Peregrine Optics to support the activities and outreach of our blog (including directly sponsoring photography projects that inspire change). Peregrine Optics is the "business side" of the operating, and will manufacture and sell unique, very useful, and very accessible photography gear to help photographers focus on capturing the best images they can.  We don't want Peregrine Optics to be just another peddler of photography products though.  We want to create products that photographers love (and they have loved our first one in market tests so far!), and want to make sure the company grows slowly and responsibly, producing environmentally-friendly items only, and always using a larger and larger part of the proceeds to help empower others to make the world better.  Thus, our mission is:


1.  To manufacturing innovative, high-quality gadgetry for professional and amateur photographers and photography lovers of all ages;

2.  To practice responsible corporate citizenship (manufacturing only environmentally-friendly products and giving back to the community in the most substantial way possible);

3.  To design reasonably-priced products based on quality, not quantity, that are not currently in the market but that photographers could really use (our answer to the phrase "someone should really make a product that does ______________________!").


We looked at a wishlist we created over some time, of ideal photography products, and decided to start by making one that seemed manageable as we learned the ropes, but that still had a great "workflow improvement" factor for photographers.  This was the Peregrine Optics Talons Lens Care Kit.  (We already know which would be our next two products, and they are exceedingly cool, if we may say so ourselves!)

Our First Product - The Peregrine Optics Talons Kit

As every photographer knows, smudges and debris are a foolproof way to ruin an otherwise perfect print (particularly when the prints are large).  If shooting outdoors, the problem is exacerbated by moisture in the air which, in conjunction with a camera's static electricity, can lead to the accumulation of particles and streaks on a lens.


The best way to wipe lenses clean without rubbing off their delicate coatings is to gently blot it with a microfiber cloth, and there are many such cloths out on the market.  But anyone who has ever actually used a microfiber cloth to clean a lens probably knows, balancing a square cloth while holding the equipment one intends to gently blot is a tedious and not so efficient task.  Your fingers can slip onto the lens, causing additional smudges, it is difficult to get the cloth to every angle while using just the right pressure.


And so, we designed a simple but remarkably practical solution we have called the Talons Lens Care Kit.  Our kit contains a unique, specially-designed, high-quality microfiber cloth that fits over two fingers and the thumb, like a partial glove, ensuring your finger never accidentally slips onto the lens.  It is designed not to leave a lint trail or any residue.  Finally, it also includes 20 mL of our organic, anti-static, solvent-free, non-toxic lens spray, which comes in a biodegradable bottle that is only as tall and wide as a credit card for easy portability.


By the way, our kit also turned out to be great for cell phones, tablet pc's, sunglasses, reading glasses, and every other delicate optical device you can imagine!

Help us secure our first full manufacturing run

We need your help to make magical things happen in the world through photography.  Based on a positive response to our market microtesting we're using our remaining savings to order our first real production run of Peregrine Optics Talons, but are $11,500 short.  Your help will allow us to get Peregrine Optics off the ground, keep providing great products to photographers the world over at reasonable prices, and keep inspiring people to change the world with photography.


After extensive research, we have settled on a manufacturer that met our quality and production criteria while offering us a very competitive price per unit, and the minimum we can order is 6,000 Talons kits.  We need $11,500, which, together with our remaining savings, we will use to pay for the first full-scale manufacturing run.


By selling these units on the Peregrine Optics website (after sending out the ones given out as perks through Indiegogo), we will have enough capital to continue to expand our brand and also to expand our social outreach efforts.  In short, we will be able to invest in creating a first rate, collegial, innovative, and change-inspiring online photography community!    


Help us make the magic happen by pledging some of the seed money we need, and we'll return the love by way of the perks described below!

Other ways you can help

Above all, please help us spread the word!  Please tweet this page to the world, "like" our facebook site, and tell all your friends.  Together, let's infuse the world of photography with the innovative perspective of the Peregrine!

Thank you for checking out our campaign!


For more great images that have changed the world, check out our Pinterest board, Changing the World through Photography.
story_txt:
What are Peregrine Optics Talons?  

The Talons are a microfiber cloth with 2 sheaths that fit over the user's fingers.  Our design dramatically improves control of the cloth, allowing the user to remove dirt and debris from a lens or filter effectively but gently (which is critical when cleaning delicate, expensive lenses). Finally, the Talons Kit also includes an ultra-portable, organic, anti-static, non-toxic cleaning spray, in a spray bottle that is only as wide and tall a credit card and a half-inch thick!  That way, you can take them everywhere you go and have crystal clear vision no matter where you are.  

What else are Talons good for?  
Our testers overwhelmingly agreed that Talons are great for camera lenses, but also for glasses, sunglasses, smartphones, and tablets, and any other personal gadget that gets grimy throughout the course of the day.  Gone are the days of balancing a square cloth between your fingers while removing grime from these items, or smudging them even more when the edge of your finger goes over the edge of the cloth!

What are people saying about Peregrine Optics Talons?  

Professional photographers who tested or purchased the Talons kit have loved it without exception.  For example:

British documentary journalist Giovanni Tait actually purchased one of our test kits, took it during a shoot out in the rain, and wrote on his blog that the rain is "never the easiest environment to clean a lens filter, but the talons managed to remove all residue, without leaving any of the usual lint traces or smears."

Baltimore Photographer John Kardys remarked on his Facebook page that the Talons Kit "is a terrific product for cleaning your lenses and filters.  It works great on glasses too."

Many of the people who purchased our test units have come back to our website to leave great feedback!



Talons will help change the world through photography, and here's how:
This is the story of the quest of Jon and Rob (that's us, two guys from Baltimore) who, in late 2011, decided it was time to pursue something we've always been passionate about: using photography to inspire positive change in the world.  Motivated in part by a belief in human creativity, faith in the power of a moment in time captured in a still image, and a generous touch of total insanity, we created the platform to inspire change through photography (a blog called The Focused Perspective) and an entrepreneurial mechanism to support the blog's initiatives (the photography equipment company Peregrine Optics).

Our Blog
Photography is not just art; it is a unique way of educating and inspiring people because it can speak directly to the soul.  We envisioned an interactive photography community that could discuss and highlight how photography has changed, and continues to change, the world.  (Check out the gallery tab on this campaign for some great examples.)

Our Company




We created Peregrine Optics to support the activities and outreach of our blog (including directly sponsoring photography projects that inspire change). By selling these units on the Peregrine Optics website (after sending out the ones given out as perks through Indiegogo), we will have enough capital to continue to expand our brand and also to expand our social outreach efforts.  In short, we will be able to invest in creating a first rate, collegial, innovative, and change-inspiring online photography community!    

Help us make the magic happen by pledging some of the seed money we need, and we'll return the love by way of the perks described below!

Other ways you can help
Above all, please help us spread the word!  Please tweet this page to the world, "like" our facebook site, and tell all your friends.  Together, let's infuse the world of photography with the innovative perspective of the Peregrine!

Thank you for checking out our campaign!


For more great images that have changed the world, check out our Pinterest board, Changing the World through Photography.

story:
(texte en français en bas de cette page)

Ki volt az a magyar fotográfus, aki Edith Piaffal hamis igazolványokat csempészett be a német táborokban fogvatartott francia hadifoglyoknak a II. világháború alatt?

 

Melyik két magyar fotográfus volt évtizedeken át az előkelő nizzai Negresco szálloda fényképésze?

 

Ki volt az a magyar fotográfus, aki barátja, Robert Capa fotóit laborálta Párizsban, és Mexikóban egy híres szürrealista festőművészt vett feleségül?

 

Egyebek mellett mindezekre kérdésekre is választ ad kiadásra váró könyvünk, a Magyar származású fotográfusok Franciaországban az 1920-as évektől napjainkig. A kötetben több mint nyolcvan fotográfus szerepel, és közülük ötvenötnek külön fejezetet szentel. Ezek a leírások, a felkutatott személyes dokumentumoknak, visszaemlékezéseknek és korabeli újságcikkeknek köszönhetően, a lexikonszerű bemutatásnál bővebben tárgyalják az egyes alkotók életútját és szakmai karrierjét.

A közel 300 oldalas kiadvàny ùj felfedezéseket, ismereteket, több, mint 250 reprodukciót, alkotói publikàciós listàt, bibliogràfiai forràsokat tartalmaz, mely egyarànt izgalmas kalauz az érdeklődő olvasó és kutatók szàmàra.

A könyv teljes költsége messze meghaladja mind a kiadói, mind a szerzői anyagi keretet:

  • Szerzők honoráriuma: 0 euro
  • Nyomdaköltség: 10 000 euro
  • Megjelentetett képek jogdíjai: 2 000 euro

Ebből szeretnénk összegyűjteni legalább a jodíjakra elegendő összeget és a nyomdai költség valamennyi részét a téma iránt érdeklődők segítségével, így biztosítva a megfelelő szívonalú kiadvány 2018 második felében való megjelenését.

  • A könyvet  10-24,99 euro közötti összeggel támogatóknak elismerően megköszönjük a jótékony segítségét;
  • 25 euros támogatás esetén egy megjelent példánnyal mondunk köszönetet;
  • 600 euros adományozásnál a könyvben szereplő kortárs alkotóktól, egy-egy dedikált művet kapnak a könyv mellé támogatóink.

 

“Fehér a legfranciább magyar fotós.” Natacha Wolinski (Connaissance des Arts, 2015.Dec.)

"Ne fotózz olyan témát, ami iránt nem érzel szevedélyt!"  Rogi André

"Farkas Aladárral rajzakadémiát alapítottunk, de belebuktunk. Maradt tehát a fényképezés, fél szívemet ennek a hálásabb művészetnek adtam.” Marton Ervin

 

 

(alább a szöveg francia nyelven)

Quel photographe hongrois a fait passer avec Edith Piaf des fausses cartes d'identité pour les prisonniers français dans les camps allemands durant la Seconde Guerre mondiale?


Quels sont les deux photographes hongrois qui ont été pendant des décennies les photographes officiels du prestigieux hôtel Negresco de Nice?


Quel photographe hongrois développait les photographies de son ami Robert Capa à Paris et épousa une peintre surréaliste célèbre au Mexique?

 

Vous trouverez les réponses à ces questions ainsi qu’à bien d’autres encore dans notre livre prêt à être publié en hongrois, intitulé « Les photographes d'origine hongroise en France des années 1920 à nos jours ». Le livre référence plus de 80 photographes et consacre un chapitre à part à 55 d’entre eux. Grâce aux documents personnels et souvenirs recueillis, ainsi qu’aux journaux contemporains dénichés, ces descriptions dépassent la simple présentation encyclopédique et donnent des détails plus complets sur la vie et la carrière professionnelle des artistes concernés

Les textes contenant des révélations et de nouvelles informations enrichis de plus de 250 photographies, le livre - qui apparaitra en premier temps en hongrois - référencie également les publications les plus importantes des photographes et les sources bibliographiques.

Etant donné que les coûts totaux de l’édition de haute qualité dépassent les ressources financières de l'éditeur et l’auteur(s) :

  • Honoraire des auteurs : 0 euro
  • Impression de haute qualité : 10 000 euros
  • Les coûts des droits d’auteur (photographies): 2 000 euros

Nous sommes donc ici pour demander de l’aide aux personnes intéressées par le sujet afin que le livre puisse paraître dans la seconde moitié de 2018.

Pour vous remercier de votre aide et de votre participation,

  • Entre 10 et 24,99 nous sommes très reconnaissants de votre participation à ce projet
  • 25 euros : un exemplaire du livre
  • 600 euros et plus : un livre offert et une oeuvre contemporaine signée d'un des artistes présent dans le livre.

 

« Fehér est le plus français des photographes hongrois ». Natacha Wolinski (Connaissance des Arts, 2015. Décembre)

 « Dans l’écriture, la photographie, le cinéma, dans l’art en général je suis intéressé par la dimension de l'expérimentation, de la découverte, du  risque et de l’aventure. » Alain Fleischer

 « Ne prends jamais ce qui ne te passionne pas! » Rogi André
