story:
Lovely Ladies
for
Men's Issues
2020 Calendar

 

Two years ago we launched a campaign for $500 to make a calendar to feature women who care about men's issues. This was in style of a pin-up calendar, where we took women of all shapes and sizes and let them define what sexy meant to them. They ranged from overt to classy. Within one day, we reached our goal, and by the end of the campaign, we reached over $2000. Months following, we gained over $3000.

The 2018 calendar was released and it had made an impact. We got lot of attention, including the press covering it's release, and many people who really loved what we had done and a few people angry at us. All in all, we consider the calendar a success, and we are doing the same for 2020.

It's important we do this, as we see every day how much the world cares more about women and their issues, claiming they have nothing and men have everything. When men try to bring up anything in conversation of what is obviously overlooked by Feminists and SJW's, they are silence by being called a bigot or a woman-hater. We're not here to debate what women do or do not have. We are here to address how the world is leaving men and boys behind. Unfortunately, most don't hear about this, and are shocked with the information we have. They're even more shocked to learn that we are not misogynists and that there are women who are part of this movement.

What it comes down to is that we believe in equality for everyone. Many attack us saying, that in fighting for men means we want to turn back the hands of time to a point in history where women were chattel to men. This is not what we want. Helping men doesn't mean we must take away from women, and helping both can be achieved where both are treated fairly, both socially and legally.

Our message is that men are the greatest victims today, as they are forced not to speak up about their issues, and when they try, they're attacked. Men are required to keep quiet, deny their masculinity, and do as they're told. Males are told quite often, especially as young boys, that they are the gatekeepers for all things evil in the world and they must feel shame for how they were born.

Just like 2018, this calendar will bring to light many of the issues men face. mad_cat and Modern Medusa continue to work to bring awareness to men and give a voice to their problems. We see every day the challenges they face. While many have done great things in the name of giving men a voice, we are making a calendar full of women who want to express their passion in helping men.

We are asking for $1000 to get this project off the ground. If you're curious why we have raised the amount, please look in our FAQ further down.

This year a portion of proceeds from the sale of our merchandise will go to Movember Foundation. The Movember Foundation is the leading global charity changing the face of men’s health. The Movember Foundation encourages men to raise vital funds and awareness for men’s health by growing a mustache during the month of November. Movember is addressing some of the biggest health issues faced by men: prostate cancer, testicular cancer, and mental health and suicide prevention.

We are looking this year to do a 16 month calendar, so we can have more models and have more facts about men's issues. Additionally, we are looking to do a digital Men's Calendar. 

 

Confirmed Models
 

Women's Calendar

Babbling Brooke
Candi
Elizabeth Hobson
Elly Prizeman
JustLaurenB
Modern Medusa
Prim Reaper
Stuttering Soliloquy
Unvarnished Void
Miiowskii 

 

Men's Calendar

mad_cat
Andrew Pollard
Your Boy Pat
Mr. Misanthropic
Ichabod

 

If you're interested in participating as a model, fill out the form here.

 

Tiered Items

$1 - We want to remember each and every one of you who donate to us. Your name will be printed at the end of our 2020 digital calendar, citing you as being part of our success in putting it all together. When you donate, we ask that you inform us if you want to be mentioned, and in what way (real name, pseudo name, etc). We will respect your privacy.

 

$3 - To further remember you, we want to do a video shout-out on Modern Medusa's YouTube channel. This will be done after the first month on her channel with co-creator mad_cat. When you donate, we ask that you inform us if you want to be mentioned, and in what way (username, pseudo name, etc). We will respect your privacy. This will be done at the end of the campaign. Any additional donations after the end of the campaign will be mentioned on our live shows.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$5 - This is a special calendar for 2020, featuring some of our models and facts about men's issues. This calendar will be in PDF format sent via email. This will be dedicated to the Macho Men or to Modern Medusa.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$6 - In case you missed it, we are offering our 2018 Calendar. We still have a few calendars left, and will be useful again in 2029. Like 2020, this features Lovely Ladies and facts concerning men.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$8 - Low-Tier Bundle. $25 value.

You will get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.
You will get our $3 tiered item with your name mentioned in a video.
You will get our $5 tiered item, the 2020 digital calendar.
You will get our $6 tiered item, or 2018 calendar.

 

$10 - This is the Men's Issues Quick Reference Guide. Often time you debate with others whether or not men really need their own movement, and you know that you saw a stat somewhere that relates to your conversation, but you don't remember where you saw it. This Quick Reference Guide will feature many facts and their sources that you can keep on our desk for quick use when it's needed. Often times, the best way to win an argument, is to have your facts readily available. This will also be available as a pdf along with a book.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$15 - The Lovely Ladies for Men's Issues 2020 Calendar, featuring 12/16 ladies with key facts about Men's Issues. When the calendar goes live, it will sell for $20.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$20 - Mid-Tier Bundle. $30 value.

You will get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.
You will get our $10 tiered item, Men's Rights Quick Reference Guide.
You will get our $15 tiered item, 2020 Calendar.

 

$30 - Modern Medusa Autograph Photo. In our first campaign, many of you purchased this autograph photo, and this year we are bringing it back. Modern Medusa will personally sign each photograph before sending it out to you.

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

 

$40 - High-Tier Bundle. $80 value.

You will get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.
You will get our $3 tiered item with your name mentioned in a video.
You will get our $5 tiered item, the 2020 digital calendar.
You will get our $6 tiered item, or 2018 calendar.
You will get our $10 tiered item, Men's Rights Quick Reference Guide.
You will get our $15 tiered item, 2020 Calendar.
You will get our $30 tiered item, Modern Medusa Autographed Photo.

 

$75 - Modern Medusa has offered to do private one-on-one call on Skype! You are free to discuss whatever you wish, within reason. She will be very delighted to speak with you! Total time: 30 minutes. Limit 10.

 

You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.

**WARNING**

This is not a solicitation of sex. This is a conversation between you and Modern Medusa. She's very open-minded to the experience of speaking with someone, but if a request is made of her that she is uncomfortable with, she'll give you a simple warning and kindly tell you no. If the offensive behavior continues, Modern Medusa is free to end the stream at any time. There will be no refunds.

 

$100 - Ultimate Tier. $160 value. Limit 20.

You will get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar.
You will get our $3 tiered item with your name mentioned in a video.
You will get our $5 tiered item, the 2020 digital calendar.
You will get our $6 tiered item, or 2018 calendar.
You will get our $10 tiered item, Men's Rights Quick Reference Guide.
You will get our $15 tiered item, 2020 Calendar.
You will get our $30 tiered item, Modern Medusa Autographed Photo.
You get get our $75 tiered item, One-on-One Call with Modern Medusa.

**WARNING**

This is not a solicitation of sex. This is a conversation between you and Modern Medusa. She's very open-minded to the experience of speaking with someone, but if a request is made of her that she is uncomfortable with, she'll give you a simple warning and kindly tell you no. If the offensive behavior continues, Modern Medusa is free to end the stream at any time. There will be no refunds.

 

Milestones

If we make...

$1500 - Lovely Ladies Support Movember Foundation Meetup
We will do a 2019 meetup to coincide with our Calendar release and Movember. This will be done on the weekend of November 2nd, to raise awareness of men's issues and to invite people to sport a mustache (possible mustache stickers of our own design). This will be held in North Carolina. Details to follow.

 

$2500 - Making the Lovely Ladies Calendar Documentary.
Planned release in November 2020, we want to do a documentary that covers us making the calendar and all the challenges we face in doing so. Additionally, we want include the Release Party to be part of our documentary. This will be released on YouTube

 

$3000 - Documentary Release and Screening.
While we will be releasing the Documentary on YouTube, we want to hold a special event for the release of our Documentary, potentially in a theatre or other private screening, and making a Movember Foundation event. Details to follow.

 

$4000 - 2020 Conference Meetup
Undecided which Conference we will go to, we want to go to a conference as the Lovely Ladies. This will include setting up a booth at the conference and selling merchandise. We have our eyes set on ICMI or Vidcon, but open to other conferences as well. This will be included in our Documentary.

 

FAQ

How big will the calendar be?

The calendar, when open, will be 8.5 x 11.

 

I'm outside the US, why am I being charged more?

This is an extra charge for shipping. Since we are based in the United States, shipping overseas requires additional fees. This is only for the tiers that have physical items.

 

How are you supporting Men's Issues with pictures of women?

First off, there are many women within the Men's Movement that want to see men given a voice. They have fathers, brothers, sons, lovers, and friends who are men, and are tired of them getting a raw deal in society and being punished simply for being born male.

Secondly, whether it's men or women, straight or gay, we know people love the look of a beautiful woman. We know that this will be one of the main reasons someone buys our calendar, which is why we want to include facts about men's issues with each picture. Thus, when someone hangs this calendar up; others will see it, and be exposed to facts that are otherwise silenced in our society today.

 

Do these women know you're using their images?

Yes, they know. We asked each one personally if they want to appear in this calendar. They are also aware that this is for Men's Issues, and all of them wanted to be part of this for that reason.

 

You are for Men's Rights and have a calendar full of women wearing almost nothing, do you hate women?

No, we don't hate women. We in fact love women... that's why we are doing this. Being for Men's Rights doesn't mean we are against women having rights. This isn't a zero-sum game for us, and we believe both can be treated equally under the law and within society itself. That is our ultimate goal.

Furthermore, sexuality is very beautiful and what makes us human. Many of us are quite sexual, and enjoy the display of beautiful women in sexy poses. Whether one's sexuality is masculine or feminine, no one should feel ashamed for what they desire.

Additionally, a few women in the 2018 calendar chose to go for classy rather than overt. We support both and were happy that all the women went with their own interpretation, that allow people to have a little of everything.

 

Why are you asking for more money this year?

It's fair to say that in 2017, there was a lot we didn't know going into this; we simply asked for enough money to do a very small run for the calendar with the ability to ship the product. Additional products came as we reached received more money, such as a wall calendar and photobook. We didn't quite expect the turnout we had received.

This year, having done this once before, we have a clearer idea of how to go about this. We are reducing the number of products we'll have, but also have the Calendar and Quick Reference Guide right from the start. Starting with a bigger pool will allow us to get both products and have the overhead to ensure it gets shipped out.

 

Why can't I just give my money to a Men's charity?

You are welcome and encouraged to do so. There are many charities out there that does great things for men who need help. One such charity that we will give a portion of sales to is the Movember Foundation. Movember raises vital funds and awareness for men’s health and funds projects in prostate cancer, testicular cancer, and mental health and suicide prevention.

One advantage to helping us, is our products are aimed at educating the world about Men's Issues and the more we can get this out there, the more awareness we can raise, and potentially more people will want to help support men. Our calendars not only have the Lovely Ladies, but key facts that many are unaware of and are surprised to learn is an actual issue.

So in supporting this campaign, we can raise awareness of Men's Issues and help out a great cause... all at the same time!

 

Why are you taking advantage of Men's Issues for profit?

Doing a calendar takes quite a bit of resources. It's not as easy as it seems. Additionally, doing other products and a meetup also takes resources. The money earned in 2017 might seem like a lot, but in truth, the creators of the project earned no profit from it. All money from the campaign went into products, overhead, and the meetup. Sales from our products went to charity and the overhead.

Understand that our goal in doing this is not to make money. If that were the case, we'd be doing as little as we could to keep as much for ourselves as possible. The work that we do is it's own reward, because we get the message out there. And believe me when I say, there is a lot of work involved.

 

I saw in 2018 calendar that you featured that one person, who is now a controversial person...

As diligent as we are in interviewing and researching our models for our calendar, there is no way we can know who will be a controversial figure after we produce our calendar. If we tried to anticipate who would be controversial in the future, we probably wouldn't make a calendar as it would be safer to assume everyone is bad than to focus on who people are right now.

 

Is the calendar going 12 months or 16 months? What if I get the 12 months now, will I have to spend more money to get the 16 months?

We aim to make a 16 month calendar. This will depend entirely on how many models we can get. We want to get 16 models so we can have a bigger product with more facts concerning men, plus the calendar is useful during our development period.

Right now we are set on a 12 month calendar. When you get the $15 tier, you are getting the 12 month calendar. If we get the chance to do 16 months, you will automatically be upgraded to the 16 month calendar, as that will be the only product available, for not additional charge.

 

Is the digital calendar a Macho Men calendar or a Modern Medusa calendar? When will it be released?

One of the biggest criticisms we received was that we didn't do a men's calendar for Men's Issues. Last year we tried to do a 2019 calendar featuring men. Unfortunately, we didn't find enough men. We are hoping this year to find enough men to do a 6 - 12 month calendar. If, however, we are unable to do so once again, we will instead do a Modern Medusa digital calendar.

Given the challenge we had in putting this together, we want to try to make this happen. Ideally we'd like to release the digital calendar at the same time as we release the physical calendar in November, but we may need to push it back to give us more time to find men to be in the calendar. Unless stated otherwise later, we'll push back to May 2020 for the digital calendar release.

If you are a man and want to be featured in the Macho Men calendar, please reach out to us.

 

I'm interested in appearing in the calendar, what do I need to do?

If you would like to be in our 2020 calendar, we are accepting submissions from women (and men) willing to get involved. It is best to find us on social media and contact us from there. We will take a look at all the submissions given and pick from those to be featured in our 2020 calendar. Find us on twitter, or message us here:

mad_cat
Modern Medusa

You can also find us on our website: https://www.llofmm.com

 

I don't have any money, but still want to help. What can I do?

Beyond donations, the best thing that anyone can do is to go on social media everyday and share our campaign. All of us on this project are doing what we can to spread the word, but we need all the help we can get. The more people share it, the more attention we will gain. The more attention we gain, the more donations we'll obtain!

It's important with social media to create your own post. Whether on Twitter or Facebook, hitting the Like button or retweeting something doesn't gain as much attention as making your own post and linking others or using a hashtag (#LLMM, #GenderEquality, and #HumanRights are a few popular ones!).

 

A BIG THANK YOU!

Whatever you're able to do to support our campaign, we appreciate each and every click, share, and donation. With your contribution, we'll be able to make this happen. Thank you to all the Lovely Ladies, and Lads, who supports us in making this calendar for Men's Issues!
story_txt:
Lovely LadiesforMen's Issues2020 Calendar Two years ago we launched a campaign for $500 to make a calendar to feature women who care about men's issues. This was in style of a pin-up calendar, where we took women of all shapes and sizes and let them define what sexy meant to them. They ranged from overt to classy. Within one day, we reached our goal, and by the end of the campaign, we reached over $2000. Months following, we gained over $3000.The 2018 calendar was released and it had made an impact. We got lot of attention, including the press covering it's release, and many people who really loved what we had done and a few people angry at us. All in all, we consider the calendar a success, and we are doing the same for 2020.It's important we do this, as we see every day how much the world cares more about women and their issues, claiming they have nothing and men have everything. When men try to bring up anything in conversation of what is obviously overlooked by Feminists and SJW's, they are silence by being called a bigot or a woman-hater. We're not here to debate what women do or do not have. We are here to address how the world is leaving men and boys behind. Unfortunately, most don't hear about this, and are shocked with the information we have. They're even more shocked to learn that we are not misogynists and that there are women who are part of this movement.What it comes down to is that we believe in equality for everyone. Many attack us saying, that in fighting for men means we want to turn back the hands of time to a point in history where women were chattel to men. This is not what we want. Helping men doesn't mean we must take away from women, and helping both can be achieved where both are treated fairly, both socially and legally.Our message is that men are the greatest victims today, as they are forced not to speak up about their issues, and when they try, they're attacked. Men are required to keep quiet, deny their masculinity, and do as they're told. Males are told quite often, especially as young boys, that they are the gatekeepers for all things evil in the world and they must feel shame for how they were born.Just like 2018, this calendar will bring to light many of the issues men face. mad_cat and Modern Medusa continue to work to bring awareness to men and give a voice to their problems. We see every day the challenges they face. While many have done great things in the name of giving men a voice, we are making a calendar full of women who want to express their passion in helping men.We are asking for $1000 to get this project off the ground. If you're curious why we have raised the amount, please look in our FAQ further down.This year a portion of proceeds from the sale of our merchandise will go to Movember Foundation. The Movember Foundation is the leading global charity changing the face of men’s health. The Movember Foundation encourages men to raise vital funds and awareness for men’s health by growing a mustache during the month of November. Movember is addressing some of the biggest health issues faced by men: prostate cancer, testicular cancer, and mental health and suicide prevention.We are looking this year to do a 16 month calendar, so we can have more models and have more facts about men's issues. Additionally, we are looking to do a digital Men's Calendar.

Your name will be printed at the end of our 2020 digital calendar, citing you as being part of our success in putting it all together. When you donate, we ask that you inform us if you want to be mentioned, and in what way (real name, pseudo name, etc). We will respect your privacy. $3 - To further remember you, we want to do a video shout-out on Modern Medusa's YouTube channel. This will be done after the first month on her channel with co-creator mad_cat. When you donate, we ask that you inform us if you want to be mentioned, and in what way (username, pseudo name, etc). We will respect your privacy. This will be done at the end of the campaign. Any additional donations after the end of the campaign will be mentioned on our live shows.You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar. $5 - This is a special calendar for 2020, featuring some of our models and facts about men's issues. This calendar will be in PDF format sent via email. This will be dedicated to the Macho Men or to Modern Medusa.You will also get our $1 tiered item with your name listed in our digital calendar. $6 - In case you missed it, we are offering our 2018 Calendar. story:
¡Hola, mi nombre es LaNé Leal!

Soy venezolana, fotógrafa desde hace 7 años y vivo en Madrid desde el 2011. A principios de 2016 me involucré más afondo con los problemas del colectivo LGTBIQ, sobre todo con los de la comunidad transexual, por lo que, comencé a desarrollar un Proyecto Fotográfico, el cual lleva por nombre "Transito". Su intención es visualizar el coletivo transexual.  Adriana y Alejandra, las protagonistas de esta historia, dos jóvenes latinas, transexuales, radicadas en Madrid que llegan a España en busca de inclusión, encontrándose con una realidad diferente a la que se habían planteado. Me veo reflejada en ellas, mujeres luchadoras, con ganas de vivir la vida que merecen y que se han enfrentado a toda clase de eventualidades.  

El mes de Octubre, La Galería 7star, a través del sr. Thorsten, me ha cedido sus espacios de manera gratuita para mostrar "Transito". Como venezolana, emigrante, mis recursos son limitados. Mi país está en vías a una guerra civil, por lo que, no puedo contar con el apoyo de amigos ni familiares en Venezuela.  

Para poder cubrir los gastos del billete de avión, hospedaje, comidas, impresiones de las obras, ticket de metro...

¡NECESITO: 1580€!   
¡¡¡¡Solo tengo hasta hasta el 20 de septiembre para poder conseguirlos... con tu ayuda podré lograrlo!!!! 

Por ahora cuento con el espacio, las obras digitales, las ganas de hacer visible aquellas personas que están en el anonimato 

¿Qué me falta? 

¡¡¡TU APOYO!!! 

Cada aporte, por más pequeño que sea, será agradecido infinitamente y recompensado.  

¿De qué manera?  

No importa el tamaño de tu contribución, te incluiré en la lista de agradecimientos del catálogo de la exposición. También: 

1.- Por tu ayuda de 5 EUR, te haré llegar una postal digital. 

2.- Si tu aporte es de 15 EUR, te enviaré un set de 2 postales, impresas y autografiadas, a tu dirección postal, no importa en que parte del mundo te encuentres. 

3.- Si tu aporte es de 50 EUR. Puedes optar a: 

.-Si estás dentro de la Comunidad de Madrid tendrás una sesión de fotos GRATIS, que constará de 5 retratos en formato digital para que puedas imprimirlos en alta resolución. 

.-Si te encuentras fuera de la Comunidad de Madrid, te haré llegar por una fotografía impresa, tamaño Poster (50cmX60cm), autografiadas. 

4.-  Si tu ayuda sobrepasa los 100 EUR. Puedes optar a: 

.-Si estás dentro de la Comunidad de Madrid tendrás una sesión de fotos GRATIS, que constará de 10 fotos en formato digital para que puedas imprimirlos en alta resolución. 

.-Si te encuentras fuera de la Comunidad de Madrid, te haré llegar por 2 fotografías impresas, tamaño Poster (50cmX60cm), autografiadas. 
 
¡HAGAMOS DE ESTO UNA REALIDAD!
story_txt:
¡Hola, mi nombre es LaNé Leal!
Soy venezolana, fotógrafa desde hace 7 años y vivo en Madrid desde el 2011. A principios de 2016 me involucré más afondo con los problemas del colectivo LGTBIQ, sobre todo con los de la comunidad transexual, por lo que, comencé a desarrollar un Proyecto Fotográfico, el cual lleva por nombre "Transito". Su intención es visualizar el coletivo transexual.  Adriana y Alejandra, las protagonistas de esta historia, dos jóvenes latinas, transexuales, radicadas en Madrid que llegan a España en busca de inclusión, encontrándose con una realidad diferente a la que se habían planteado. Me veo reflejada en ellas, mujeres luchadoras, con ganas de vivir la vida que merecen y que se han enfrentado a toda clase de eventualidades.  
El mes de Octubre, La Galería 7star, a través del sr. Thorsten, me ha cedido sus espacios de manera gratuita para mostrar "Transito". Como venezolana, emigrante, mis recursos son limitados. Mi país está en vías a una guerra civil, por lo que, no puedo contar con el apoyo de amigos ni familiares en Venezuela.  
Para poder cubrir los gastos del billete de avión, hospedaje, comidas, impresiones de las obras, ticket de metro...
¡NECESITO: 1580€!   ¡¡¡¡Solo tengo hasta hasta el 20 de septiembre para poder conseguirlos... con tu ayuda podré lograrlo!!!! 
Por ahora cuento con el espacio, las obras digitales, las ganas de hacer visible aquellas personas que están en el anonimato 
¿Qué me falta? 
¡¡¡TU APOYO!!! 
Cada aporte, por más pequeño que sea, será agradecido infinitamente y recompensado.  
¿De qué manera?  
No importa el tamaño de tu contribución, te incluiré en la lista de agradecimientos del catálogo de la exposición. También: 
1.- Por tu ayuda de 5 EUR, te haré llegar una postal digital. 
2.- Si tu aporte es de 15 EUR, te enviaré un set de 2 postales, impresas y autografiadas, a tu dirección postal, no importa en que parte del mundo te encuentres. 
3.- Si tu aporte es de 50 EUR. Puedes optar a: 
.-Si estás dentro de la Comunidad de Madrid tendrás una sesión de fotos GRATIS, que constará de 5 retratos en formato digital para que puedas imprimirlos en alta resolución. 
.-Si te encuentras fuera de la Comunidad de Madrid, te haré llegar por una fotografía impresa, tamaño Poster (50cmX60cm), autografiadas. 
4.-  Si tu ayuda sobrepasa los 100 EUR. Puedes optar a: 
.-Si estás dentro de la Comunidad de Madrid tendrás una sesión de fotos GRATIS, que constará de 10 fotos en formato digital para que puedas imprimirlos en alta resolución. 
.-Si te encuentras fuera de la Comunidad de Madrid, te haré llegar por 2 fotografías impresas, tamaño Poster (50cmX60cm), autografiadas.  ¡HAGAMOS DE ESTO UNA REALIDAD!

story:
Worum geht es in diesem Projekt?
What is this project all about?

Der LUZIFER-Verlag Steffen Janssen: innovativ - transparent - fair 
Detailverliebte Publikationen in bester Optik und Haptik.

Als kleiner Verlag, der alle seine Publikationen in Top-Qualität von einer deutschen Druckerei herstellen lässt, hat man für jedes Buchprojekt eine sehr hohe Vorfinanzierung zu leisten. Dies trifft den LUZIFER-Verlag Steffen Janssen insbesondere, da er sich der Förderung talentierter, doch bisher unbekannter Jungautoren verschrieben hat, die entsprechend aufwändig beworben werden, um für deren Publikationen ein hohes Maß an Aufmerksamkeit zu erreichen.
Das dieses Konzept Beachtung findet, beweisen beispielsweise die Nominierungen dieser Publikationen:
In 2013 wurden 3 Neuerscheinungen des Verlages in die Endauswahl (5 Bücher gesamt) des Vincent-Preises (dt. Phantastik-Preis) in der Kategorie "Roman national" gewählt. Unter diesen 3 Büchern befinden sich 2 Debüts.

Luzifer-Publishing (Germany): innovative - transparent - fair
Detailed publications in the best look and feel.
Promoting talented, but previously unknown young writers. Translation of English Indie-authors into German language.

2012 nominations: Vincent-Price - 3. "GRAUES LAND"
2013 nominations: Vincent-Price - (3 nominations: "172,3", "KALTGESCHMINKT", "GL - DIE SCHREIE DER TOTEN")

Was sind die Ziele?
What are the aims?

Ein ehemaliges Hobby-Projekt hat sich in kürzester Zeit zu einer festen Größe in der deutschen Phantastik-Buch-Szene etabliert. Eine Vielzahl spannender Manuskripte wartet auf Bearbeitung und Veröffentlichung. 
Dieser Verantwortung möchten wir mit Ihrer Unterstützung zu 100% gerecht werden. Dieses Crowdfunding-Projekt wird der Sicherung künftiger Buchprojekte hoffnungsvoller junger Autoren dienen, deren spezielle Ideen und Konzepte bei größeren Mainstream-Verlagen keine Beachtung fänden.

A former hobby project has established itself in a short time become a fixture in the German fantasy book scene. A vast number of books are waiting to be edited and published.
This crowdfunding project will serve to hedge future book projects promising young authors whose specific ideas and concepts at larger mainstream publishers would find no attention.

Warum sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?
Why should you support this project?

Der Verlag arbeitet transparent und fair (z.Bsp. kann man den Mustervertrag auf der Verlags-Homepage einsehen).
Förderung junger Autoren im Genre phantastischer Belletristik.
Eine Großzahl der Bücher wird aufwendig illustriert.
Veröffentlichung von Publikationen, die bei Mainstream-Verlagen keine Beachtung finden würden.
Unterstützung karitativer Kindereinrichtungen (10 €ent von jedem verkauften Buch werden gespendet).
Ausschließliche Zusammenarbeit mit deutschen Druckereien.

The publisher operates fair and transparent.
Promotion of young writers in the genre of fantastic fiction.
A large number of books is lavishly illustrated.
Publication of publications that would find no attention at mainstream publishers.
Support to charitable children's institutions.

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?
What happens to the fundings?

Das Geld wird ausschließlich zur nachweisbaren Finanzierung neuer Buchprojekte verwendet. Dies beinhaltet Druck, Cover und Illustrationen, Lizenzen.
Die Verwendung wird auf der Verlags-Homepage in Form einer Projekt-Auflistung in Zahlen nachgewiesen.

The money will be used exclusively to fund new book projects (printing, Covers and Illustrations, licenses)
The usage will be demonstrated on the publisher's website in the form of a project collection (in numbers).

Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?
Who is behind the project?

Der LUZIFER-Verlag Steffen Janssen wurde im Januar 2011 gegründet. Die erste Publikation »STYX - Fluss der Toten« - eine Anthologie - erschien im Oktober 2011; dieser folgten bisher 13 Bücher, 18 weitere sind fest geplant. 
In 2013 werden 3 Hörbücher produziert. Desweiteren wird der erste Band der in England viel beachteten »Pax Britannia«-Serie (Steampunk) als deutsche Erstveröffentlichung erscheinen.
Der Verlag arbeitet intensiv mit Social-Media-Plattformen, beispielsweise gibt es eine facebook-Seite, auf welcher von potentiellen Autoren Manuskriptauszüge einer breiten Leserschaft vorgestellt werden können, die diese kommentieren kann. Das gibt den Autoren Kritiken zur Hand, mit denen sie arbeiten können, statt einer standardisierten Verlagsabsage ohne verwertbare Mängelhinweise. 3 der dort vorgestellten Manuskripte wurden bereits ins Verlagsprogramm übernommen.

The Luzifer-Publishing was founded in January 2011. So far 13 books have been published. 18 more projects are planned fixed.
In 2013, three audiobooks are produced. 
The publisher is working closely with social media platforms.

story:
About the Project:

In our travels we often come across places that mean more to us than others. Places we find our selves drawn to. I fell in love with my Elizabeth street apartment immediately. To me there is nothing like natural light and usually that means I shoot in nature. But when I moved in to my apartment just outside downtown Denver in 2016 I was blessed with a beautiful old building built in the 1890s, with old radiators and big windows. And great neighbors. In this book there are over 10 sets, over 50 images, all taken in this apartment building. All with vintage radiators, including the upstairs and downstairs neighbors'. 

Despite the repetition of theme, by capturing different moods and different people in these same locations, I was able to put together a raw display of the human form and its beautiful relationship with light. I'm leaving Denver now. And in celebration of the 4 years spent in these walls I'm making this book and sharing it with you. It's more than just pictures. It's a memoir and a journal of the people that have come in to my life for moments or years and trusted me with their most vulnerable selves. I need your help to make this a reality. I know art books aren't a life necessity and times are hard right now for a lot of people, but a little art can make our lives warmer and brighter. Especially when you have big windows and the warmth of a vintage radiator.

What I Need & What You Get

To make this quality hard cover book more affordable to my friends, family, and art lovers I need to buy in bulk and have enough interest to make it worth it.  A lot of these images have never been posted anywhere due to censorship so this is your chance to own and see my art like never before.

  • $600 is not the goal but the lowest initial amount I need to fund buying in bulk.
  • I'll be offering smaller items to those who want to contribute but can't afford a book
  • Funds will be used for printing and shipping of post cards, small prints and fine art books
  • I am also in the process of moving so your contribution will help me get myself back to New England and creating again.

$600 is not the goal but the lowest initial amount I need to fund buying in bulk.
I'll be offering smaller items to those who want to contribute but can't afford a book
Funds will be used for printing and shipping of post cards, small prints and fine art books
I am also in the process of moving so your contribution will help me get myself back to New England and creating again.

story:
Short Summary

Forbidden Memory brings a group of rare, historically important photographs of the Cultural Revolution in Tibet to an American audience.  The photographer, Tsering Dorje, was a native Tibetan and an officer in the Peoples’ Liberation Army stationed in Lhasa.  As a PLA official photographer, he was permitted to photograph many key events:  marches and parades, “struggle sessions,” the destruction of the Jokhang Temple, and much else. He died in 1991.  His daughter, the writer and poet Tsering Woeser, assembled over 300 of his photographs into a book, first published in Taiwan in 2006 and scheduled to appear in the U.S. in 2020 in a translation by Susan Chen.   This is the only known body of photographs of Tibet during the Cultural Revolution. 

The exhibit is scheduled for October 2019 at City Gallery in New Haven.

What We Need & What You Get

My budget for the project is this:

$3,000 for materials, framing, preparation of captions and hanging the show.

$1,500 for publicity (I want people to know about it!)

$500 for a public reception and to defray travel expenses for guest speakers.

Each donor will be thanked by name in the exhibit program.  In addition:

$75 gets you an 11" x 17" archival inkjet print on the same paper used in the exhibit.

$150 gets you a 17" x 22" archival inkjet print on the same paper used in the exhibit.

$500 gets you three 17" x 22" archival inkjet prints on the same paper used in the exhibit.

The Impact

These are extraordinary, compelling images of a time and place the Chinese government has tried very hard to erase from history.  They might not have survived at all if not for a long chain of improbable events.  But however unlikely, they're here, and I want people to know about them and see them.

story:
Unsere Indiegogo-Kampagne ist vorüber - jetzt geht es auf http://worldindistress.com weiter!

Liebe Unterstützer,

unsere "A World in Distress“ Crowdfunding Kampagne auf Indiegogo ist nun vorüber.

Alle Unterstützer sollten zu diesem Zeitpunkt bereits eine Dankeschön-Postkarte erhalten haben und auch unser Fotokalender wurde bereits ausgeliefert.* Der Bildband wird weiterhin, wie versprochen, pünktlich zum Mai 2015 verschickt, obwohl wir unser Wunsch-Ziel von 25.000€ nicht erreicht haben. Um dies zu ermöglichen, werden wir weitere eigene finanzielle Mittel einbringen und unsere Kampagne ab dem 25. Dezember auf http://worldindistress.com fortführen.

Die letzten zwei Monate des Fundraisings haben uns gezeigt, dass durchaus reges Interesse an unserem Projekt besteht, wir aber mehr Zeit benötigen, um eine größere Zahl an Unterstützern zu finden und mehr Medienpräsenz zu akquirieren.

Dank eurer Hilfe haben wir es bisher geschafft, mehr als 8.000€ zu sammeln und somit einen guten Anfang zu machen, um den Druck und Vertrieb unseres Buches zu finanzieren und drei ausgewählte Hilfsorganisationen zu unterstützen. Wir wollen euch für euer Vertrauen danken und uns erkenntlich zeigen, indem wir euch Unterstützer der ersten Stunde namentlich in unserem Buch und auf unserer Website aufführen wollen.** Zusätzlich werden alle „Unterstützer+“ natürlich ein signiertes Exemplar unseres Bildbandes erhalten.

Damit wir möglichst viele Menschen mit unserer Arbeit erreichen können, führen wir unsere Kampagne ab dem 25. Dezember auf http://worldindistress.com fort. Dort wird es möglich sein, unser Projekt weiterhin zu unterstützen und unseren Bildband als Print- oder als Digital-PDF-Version bis zum Erscheinen im Mai 2015 vorzubestellen. Dabei wollen wir ein neues Gesamt-Fundingziel von 15.000€ anpeilen, um somit auf eine Auflage von mindestens 300 gedruckten Exemplaren zu kommen.

Wie versprochen werden wir alle Bestellungen ausliefern und auch den Hilfsorganisationen ihren Anteil von 20% der Erlöse zukommen lassen. Die Auszahlungen werden wir so transparent wie möglich gestalten und in unserem Netzwerk, beispielsweise auch auf Facebook, entsprechende Beweise liefern, dass die Gelder auch tatsächlich bei den Organisationen angekommen sind. Zusätzlich wird sich in den nächsten Wochen auch entscheiden, ob wir die Spenden sogar persönlich bei den Hilfsprojekten abliefern können.

Wir danken euch herzlichst für eure Unterstützung und wünschen euch ein frohes Fest und einen guten Rutsch ins neue Jahr.

Beste Grüße

Dennis und Patrick Weinert

*Deine Postkarte oder dein Kalender ist nicht angekommen? Melde dich kurz unter sales@weinertbrothers.com um das Problem zu melden.

**Falls ihr nicht namentlich in unserem Buch und/oder der Website aufgeführt werden wollt, so lasst uns bitte eine Email unter sales@weinertbrothers.com zukommen. Falls eure Unterstützung auf Indiegogo als „anonym“ angezeigt wird, werden wir auf unserer Website aus Datenschutzgründen lediglich eure Initialen verwenden.




Don't speak German? Scroll down to see the English version of this campaign!


Das "A World in Distress" Projekt

Wir sind Dennis und Patrick Weinert, selbständige Filmschaffende und Fotografen, und seit Januar 2014 arbeiten wir an unserem ersten sozialdokumentarischen Foto- und Spendenprojekt, das sich mit dem Thema Armut im globalen Kontext beschäftigt. 

Den entscheidenden Impuls für die Entstehung von „A World in Distress“ gab uns unsere Arbeit in den Slums von Manila im Jahr zuvor.

Anhand exemplarischer Anekdoten und Bilderserien aus Burkina Faso, Nepal und Haiti, wollen wir die verschiedenen Facetten extremer Armut beleuchten und über die praktischen Auswirkungen von Entwicklungshilfe und fortschreitender Globalisierung berichten.

Ziel unseres Vorhabens ist es, mithilfe einer Crowdfunding-Kampagne den Druck und Vertrieb unseres Bildbandes zu finanzieren und Spenden für lokale und nachhaltige Hilfsprojekte zu sammeln. Wir wollen Menschen, mittels Fotografie, für die Umstände sensibilisieren, die Fortschritt und Entwicklung in den ärmsten Ländern der Welt hemmen oder gar verhindern.

Neben dem Fotobuch im Vorverkauf sind ab dem 25. Oktober zusätzlich auch hochwertige Kunstdrucke aus unserem "Randnotizen"-Portfolio über das Online-Unternehmen arrangio.de verfügbar.

Sämtliche Gewinne aus dem Buch- und Kunstdruckverkauf kommen zu gleichen Anteilen den Hilfsprojekten Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom und der Katrin Rohde-Stiftung zugute.


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Wir möchten 25.000€ sammeln, damit wir den Druck und Vertrieb des Bildbandes finanzieren, einen Teil unserer Produktionskosten decken, und gleichzeitig drei nachhaltige Hilfsprojekte unterstützen können.

Alle Gewinne, die auf kurz oder lang mit diesem Projekt erwirtschaftet werden, wollen wir spenden. Unsere privaten Aufwendungen von 20.000€, die wir vorab in die Produktion der Inhalte dieses Buches investiert haben, werden wir dabei maximal zur Hälfte zurückgewinnen können.

Nichtsdestotrotz, wollen wir auch bei Verlust unseres Einsatzes die von uns ausgewählten Projekte unterstützen. Deshalb haben wir uns dazu entschieden, schon ab dem ersten verkauften Buch einen Anteil von 20% des Verkaufspreises zu spenden.

Im Falle eines Erfolges unserer Kampagne, würden wir nicht nur die Chance bekommen, unser erstes Buch zu veröffentlichen, sondern könnten auch 5.000€ an die von uns unterstützten gemeinnützigen Projekte senden.

Falls unsere Kampagne über ihr Finanzierungsziel hinausschießt, steigt natürlich auch die Spendensumme.


Neben unserem zweisprachigen Bildband mit mehr als 160 Seiten und 80 Fotografien, bieten wir dir auch eine Reihe von anderen Produkten an, sogenannte Perks, mit denen du uns und die gemeinnützigen Projekte unterstützen kannst.

Angefangen bei einem Fotokalender und einer Ebook-Version des Bildbandes, bis hin zu höherpreisigeren Perks, bei denen du (oder dein Unternehmen) als Partner unseres Projekts fungieren kannst, gibt es zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, unser Vorhaben zu unterstützen.

Als Unterstützer+ oder Partner nennen wir dich bzw. dein Unternehmen in unserem Buch und auf all unseren Kanälen und Websites, und bringen somit deine Marke mit unserem künstlerisch-gemeinnützigen Projekt in Verbindung.

Sollte unsere Kampagne das Finanzierungsziel nicht erreichen, werden wir alle Mehrkosten, die durch die geringeren Druckauflagen entstehen, selbst übernehmen. Somit kann jeder sein bestelltes Produkt erhalten und auch die von uns unterstützten Projekte bekommen ihren versprochenen Anteil.

Wir halten dies für fair, da es uns bei diesem Projekt nicht um einen finanziellen Gewinn geht, wir die Chance bekommen, mit unserer Arbeit Gutes zu bewirken und gleichzeitig auf lange Sicht sicher auch beruflich von diesem Projekt profitieren können. Die Erfahrungen, die wir im Rahmen von „A World in Distress“ machen durften, sind ohnehin schon unbezahlbar.


Als Zahlungsmöglichkeit steht dir, neben der PayPal Funktion auf Indiegogo, auch Barzahlung (bspw. wenn du aus Rheda-Wiedenbrück kommst) und Banküberweisung zur Verfügung. Kommt PayPal für dich nicht in Frage, möchten wir dich bitten, uns per Email zu kontaktieren:

sales@weinertbrothers.com 

Im Falle einer Barzahlung oder Banküberweisung, übernehmen wir in deinem Namen den Weitertransfer auf die Indiegogo-Kampagne, damit deine Unterstützung hier dokumentiert und sichtbar wird.

Nachdem deine Zahlung bei uns eingegangen ist, erhältst du von uns innerhalb weniger Tage einen Beleg in Form einer „A World in Distress“ Postkarte. Eine detaillierte Quittung liegt dann später beim Versand deines Produktes bei. Leider können wir keine rechtsgültige Spendenbescheinigung ausstellen, da wir selbst nicht im Rahmen eines gemeinnützigen Vereins organisiert sind.


Die Spendenprojekte

Maiti Nepal – Nepal | www.maitinepal.org

Die Organisation Maiti Nepal bietet den Opfern von Menschenhandel und Zwangsprostitution einen Ort der Zuflucht und ermöglicht ihnen durch schulische und berufliche Ausbildung eine Zukunft. Menschenhandel ist ein massives Problem in Nepal, das zehntausende junge Mädchen, vor allem aus den ärmsten, ländlichen Regionen des Landes, betrifft. Oft werden sie unter falschen Versprechungen in die Städte gelockt und von dort in die Untergrundbordelle Kathmandus und Indiens geschleust. Maiti Nepal hilft diesen Menschen, aus ihrer Lage zu entfliehen und einen Neuanfang zu starten. 


Restavek Freedom – Haiti | www.restavekfreedom.org

Die Organisation Restavek Freedom hat sich die Abschaffung der in Haiti weitverbreiteten Kindersklaverei zur Aufgabe gemacht. Tausende Kinder werden jährlich von ihren Eltern an wohlhabendere Haitianer abgegeben, um dort im Gegenzug für häusliche Arbeiten eine ausreichende Ernährung und Schulbildung zu bekommen. Viele dieser sogenannten „Restaveks“ sind nicht nur stundenlanger körperlicher Arbeit ausgesetzt, sondern müssen auch Gewalt und sexuelle Übergriffe erdulden. Die den leiblichen Eltern versprochene Schulbildung für ihre Kinder wird oft nicht gewährleistet. Restavek Freedom versucht diesen Zuständen durch die Bereitstellung von Auffangheimen und durch Aufklärungskampagnen entgegenzuwirken.


Katrin Rohde-Stiftung – Burkina Faso | www.katrin-rohde-stiftung.de

Die Katrin Rohde-Stiftung kümmert sich mit einer Vielzahl von Einrichtungen um die Unterbringung von bedürftigen Kindern und Jugendlichen und bietet ihnen soziale und medizinische Betreuung. Die Einwohner Burkina Fasos haben nicht nur unter extrem schweren wirtschaftlichen und klimatischen Bedingungen zu leiden, sondern sind auch durch den Konflikt im benachbarten Staat Mali schwer beeinträchtigt. Wo früher beispielsweise auch der Tourismus ein Zubrot für so manchen Burkinabé einbrachte, verhindert heute die zunehmende Terrorgefahr und die grassierende Ebola-Epidemie ein vermehrtes Aufkommen an Urlaubern. Die Katrin Rohde-Stiftung kämpft an vielen Fronten, um die Not der Menschen Burkina Fasos zu lindern und ihnen eine Zukunftsperspektive zu bieten. Auch Behindertenprojekte, der Betrieb einer Landwirtschaftsschule und eines Mehrgenerationenhofes gehören zu den Betätigungsfeldern der Stiftung.


Die "Randnotizen"-Fotokunstdrucke

Thematisch beschäftigt sich „Randnotizen“ mit der Ambivalenz in unserem sozialdokumentarischen Schaffensprozess. Wo normalerweise Not und Elend, Krankheit und Tod, Gewalt und Kriminalität im Fokus unserer Arbeit stehen, wollen wir in dieser Reihe die Schönheit würdigen, die wir auf unseren Reisen nur 'am Rande' wahrnehmen und dokumentieren können. Die Werke dieser Reihe sollen zugleich Wohnzimmer-tauglich und sozial relevant sein. Wir verstehen 'Randnotizen' als verlängerten Arm unseres Werkes "A World in Distress", denn auch hier gilt: Alle Gewinne aus dem Kunstdruckverkauf gehen an Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom und die Katrin Rohde-Stiftung.

Bitte beachte, dass der Verkauf der "Randnotizen"-Fotokunstdrucke über arrangio.de abgewickelt wird und die damit erwirtschafteten Erlöse nicht als Teil der Crowdfunding-Kampagne angezeigt werden. Jedoch gilt auch dort, dass 20% des Verkaufspreises direkt den von uns unterstützten Projekten zugutekommen.


Andere Wege, wie du uns helfen kannst

Selbst wenn du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, hilfst du uns enorm, wenn du deinen Freunden und Verwandten von dieser Kampagne erzählst, und sie in den sozialen Netzwerken mit deinen Kontakten teilst.

Indiegogo stellt dir dafür die passenden Social Icons  zur Verfügung. Bitte hilf uns, dieses Projekt bekannt zu machen, damit wir die Chance bekommen, unseren ersten Bildband "A World in Distress" zu realisieren und unsere ausgewählten Hilfsprojekte zu unterstützen!


Find uns auf:
worldindistress.com
facebook.com
youtube.com

------------------------ENGLISH VERSION | ENGLISCHE VERSION----------------------------

The “A World in Distress” Project


We are Dennis and Patrick Weinert, freelance filmmakers and photographers and since January 2014 we are working on our first documentary photography and charity project, which deals with the issue of poverty in a global context.

Our previous work in the slums of Manila has motivated the creation of the “A World in Distress” campaign.

With exemplary anecdotes and photo essays from Burkina Faso, Nepal and Haiti, we want to show the various facets of extreme poverty and shed light on the practical implications of the development aid system and advancing globalization.

The goal of our project is to raise awareness of the circumstances that inhibit progress and development in the poorest countries in the world, by using a crowdfunding campaign to finance the distribution of our photo book and to collect donations for local and sustainable aid organizations.

In addition to the pre-sale launch of our photo book, the German startup company arrangio.de will commence distributing our fine art print portfolio „Marginal Notes“ on 25th October 2014.

All profits generated by book and art print sales will be donated to the aid organizations Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom and the Katrin Rohde Foundation.


What we need & what you get

We want to collect 25,000€ in order to be able to fund the print and distribution of the photo book, to cover a fraction of our production costs and to simultaneously support three sustainable aid projects.

All profits that will be earned with our photo book, now or after the campaign, will be donated. Our private expenses of 20,000€, which we have previously invested in the production of the content of this book, will not be recovered by this campaign. Our financial plan dictates that we can only regain a maximum of 50% of our expenses with this project.

Nevertheless, we want to support our selected organizations, even though we will lose a big portion of our investment. Therefore, we have decided to donate a share of 20% of the sales price of every book or perk sold, which  represents our profit margin.

In case our campaign is successful, we would not only get the chance to publish our first book, but could also send 5,000€ to our supported charitable organizations.

Should our campaign exceed its funding goal, the donated amount would of course increase.

 In addition to our bilingual photo book with more than 160 pages and 80 photographs, we want to offer you a range of other perks that will give you the chance to support our campaign in a way that suits your wallet.

In addition to 5€ and 10€ perks and a calendar including a PDF-version of the photo book, we also offer higher-priced perks that will allow you (or your company) to become a partner of our project.

As Supporter+ or Partner we will feature you or your company in our book and on all of our channels and websites, thereby connecting your brand with our artistic & charitable project.

If our campaign does not reach its funding goal, we will bear all additional costs incurred by the smaller print runs, so that all supporters can obtain their ordered perk and the aid organizations receive their promised share.

We think this is fair, since we are not looking to make a financial gain with “A World in Distress”. Getting the chance to do good with our work is a reward in itself - and at the same time we will certainly benefit professionally from this project in the future. In combination with the experiences we made during the production process, this is already more than we could ever ask for.

In addition to the PayPal feature on Indiegogo, we would like to give you a second option to pay for your perks: wire transfer. For banking information, please contact us at:

sales@weinertbrothers.com

In case of a wire transfer payment, we will transfer the money from our bank account to the Indiegogo campaign in your name, so that your support will contribute to the campaign counter.

Once your payment has arrived, we will send you an "A World in Distress" postcard to your physical address. A detailed receipt will be shipped to you together with your perk. Unfortunately we can not issue legally valid 503(c) receipts, since we, as photographers, are not organized in the framework of a non-profit organization.

 

The supported organizations

Maiti Nepal - Nepal | www.maitinepal.org

Maiti Nepal provides victims of human trafficking and forced prostitution with a place of refuge and helps them through education and vocational training to develop a perspective for the future. Human trafficking is a massive problem in Nepal, affecting tens of thousands of young girls, especially from the poorest rural regions of the country. They are often lured to the cities with job promises and from there they are smuggled into the underground brothels of Kathmandu and India. Maiti Nepal helps these women to escape from their situation and start a new life.


Restavek Freedom - Haiti | www.restavekfreedom.org

The Restavek Freedom Foundation works to abolish child slavery in Haiti. Every year, thousands of children are sent to wealthier Haitians by their impoverished parents, where they are supposed to receive adequate nutrition and education in return for domestic work. Many of these so-called "Restaveks" are not only exposed to long hours of physical labor, but have to endure violence and sexual assaults. Frequently, the promised education and nutrition are withheld from these domestic servants. Restavek Freedom works to prevent these abuses by providing transition homes for the children and raising awareness about this issue in Haiti's rural areas.


Katrin Rohde-Stiftung - Burkina Faso | www.katrin-rohde-stiftung.de

The Katrin Rohde Foundation maintains a variety of facilities for the accommodation of vulnerable children and teenagers and provides them with social and medical assistance. Burkina Faso's population not only has to suffer from extreme economic and climatic conditions, but is also affected by the conflict in the neighboring country of Mali. The increasing threat of terrorism and the rampant Ebola epidemic in West Africa further deepen the economic crisis. The Katrin Rohde Foundation is fighting on many fronts to alleviate the plight of the people of Burkina Faso and to offer them a perspective. Disability projects, the operation of an agriculture school and a multi-generational farm are also part of the foundation's activities.


The “Marginal Notes” Gallery Prints

In cooperation with the German online-startup arrangio GmbH we are also offering fine art prints of our portfolio “Marginal Notes”. “Marginal Notes” deals with the ambivalence in our creative process. Where normally poverty and misery, illness and death, violence and crime are the main focus of our work, in this series we want to honor the beauty we encounter on our travels. The works in this portfolio are visually appealing and at the same time socially relevant. We see “Marginal Notes” as an extension of "A World in Distress", which is why all profits from fine art print sales will also go to Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom and the Katrin Rohde Foundation.

Please note that the sale of the "Marginal Notes" fine art prints is handled by arrangio.de and the revenues generated are not displayed as part of the crowdfunding campaign. However, a share of 20% of the sales price is also donated to our selected charitable projects.


Other ways you can help us

Even if you cannot support us financially, you'll be able to help us enormously if you tell your friends and relatives about this campaign and if you share it in the social networks.

Indiegogo provides you with the right tools to do this. Please consider to promote this project, so that we can get the chance to realize our book and charity project "A World in Distress"!
story_txt:
Unsere Indiegogo-Kampagne ist vorüber - jetzt geht es auf http://worldindistress.com weiter!Liebe
Unterstützer,

unsere "A World in Distress“ Crowdfunding Kampagne auf Indiegogo ist nun vorüber.

Alle
Unterstützer sollten zu diesem Zeitpunkt bereits eine
Dankeschön-Postkarte erhalten haben und auch unser Fotokalender
wurde bereits ausgeliefert.* Der Bildband wird weiterhin, wie
versprochen, pünktlich zum Mai 2015 verschickt, obwohl wir unser
Wunsch-Ziel von 25.000€ nicht erreicht haben. Um dies zu
ermöglichen, werden wir weitere eigene finanzielle Mittel einbringen
und unsere Kampagne ab dem 25. Dezember auf
http://worldindistress.com
fortführen.

Die letzten
zwei Monate des Fundraisings haben uns gezeigt, dass durchaus reges
Interesse an unserem Projekt besteht, wir aber mehr Zeit benötigen,
um eine größere Zahl an Unterstützern zu finden und mehr
Medienpräsenz zu akquirieren. 


Dank
eurer Hilfe haben wir es bisher geschafft, mehr als 8.000€ zu
sammeln und somit einen guten Anfang zu machen, um den Druck und
Vertrieb unseres Buches zu finanzieren und drei ausgewählte
Hilfsorganisationen zu unterstützen. Wir wollen euch für euer
Vertrauen danken und uns erkenntlich zeigen, indem wir euch
Unterstützer der ersten Stunde namentlich in unserem Buch und auf
unserer Website aufführen wollen.** Zusätzlich werden alle
„Unterstützer+“
natürlich ein signiertes Exemplar unseres Bildbandes erhalten.

Damit
wir möglichst viele Menschen mit unserer Arbeit erreichen können,
führen wir unsere Kampagne ab dem 25. Dezember auf
http://worldindistress.com
fort. Dort wird es möglich sein, unser Projekt weiterhin zu
unterstützen und unseren Bildband als Print- oder als
Digital-PDF-Version bis zum Erscheinen im Mai 2015 vorzubestellen.
Dabei wollen wir ein neues Gesamt-Fundingziel von 15.000€ anpeilen,
um somit auf eine Auflage von mindestens 300 gedruckten Exemplaren zu
kommen.

Wie
versprochen werden wir alle Bestellungen ausliefern und auch den
Hilfsorganisationen ihren  Anteil von 20% der Erlöse zukommen
lassen. Die Auszahlungen werden wir so transparent wie möglich
gestalten und in unserem Netzwerk, beispielsweise auch auf Facebook,
entsprechende Beweise liefern, dass die Gelder auch tatsächlich bei
den Organisationen angekommen sind. Zusätzlich wird sich in den
nächsten Wochen auch entscheiden, ob wir die Spenden sogar
persönlich bei den Hilfsprojekten abliefern können.

Wir danken
euch herzlichst für eure Unterstützung und wünschen euch ein
frohes Fest und einen guten Rutsch ins neue Jahr.

Beste Grüße

Dennis und
Patrick Weinert



*Deine
Postkarte oder dein Kalender ist nicht angekommen? Melde dich kurz
unter sales@weinertbrothers.com
um das Problem zu melden.

**Falls
ihr nicht namentlich in unserem Buch und/oder der Website aufgeführt
werden wollt, so lasst uns bitte eine Email unter
sales@weinertbrothers.com
zukommen. Falls eure Unterstützung auf Indiegogo als „anonym“
angezeigt wird, werden wir auf unserer Website aus Datenschutzgründen
lediglich eure Initialen verwenden.Don't speak German? In addition to the pre-sale launch of our photo book, the German startup company arrangio.de will commence distributing our fine art print portfolio „Marginal Notes“ on 25th October 2014.
All profits generated by book and art print sales will be donated to the aid organizations Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom and the Katrin Rohde Foundation.

What we need & what you get
We want to collect 25,000€ in order to be able to fund the print and distribution of the photo book, to cover a fraction of our production costs and to simultaneously support three sustainable aid projects.
All profits that will be earned with our photo book, now or after the campaign, will be donated. Our private expenses of 20,000€, which we have previously invested in the production of the content of this book, will not be recovered by this campaign. Our financial plan dictates that we can only regain a maximum of 50% of our expenses with this project.
Nevertheless, we want to support our selected organizations, even though we will lose a big portion of our investment. Therefore, we have decided to donate a share of 20% of the sales price of every book or perk sold, which  represents our profit margin.
In case our campaign is successful, we would not only get the chance to publish our first book, but could also send 5,000€ to our supported charitable organizations.
Should our campaign exceed its funding goal, the donated amount would of course increase.

 In addition to our bilingual photo book with more than 160 pages and 80 photographs, we want to offer you a range of other perks that will give you the chance to support our campaign in a way that suits your wallet.
In addition to 5€ and 10€ perks and a calendar including a PDF-version of the photo book, we also offer higher-priced perks that will allow you (or your company) to become a partner of our project.
As Supporter+ or Partner we will feature you or your company in our book and on all of our channels and websites, thereby connecting your brand with our artistic & charitable project.
If our campaign does not reach its funding goal, we will bear all additional costs incurred by the smaller print runs, so that all supporters can obtain their ordered perk and the aid organizations receive their promised share.
We think this is fair, since we are not looking to make a financial gain with “A World in Distress”. Getting the chance to do good with our work is a reward in itself - and at the same time we will certainly benefit professionally from this project in the future. In combination with the experiences we made during the production process, this is already more than we could ever ask for.

In addition to the PayPal feature on Indiegogo, we would like to give you a second option to pay for your perks: wire transfer. For banking information, please contact us at:
sales@weinertbrothers.com
In case of a wire transfer payment, we will transfer the money from our bank account to the Indiegogo campaign in your name, so that your support will contribute to the campaign counter.
Once your payment has arrived, we will send you an "A World in Distress" postcard to your physical address. A detailed receipt will be shipped to you together with your perk. Unfortunately we can not issue legally valid 503(c) receipts, since we, as photographers, are not organized in the framework of a non-profit organization.
 
The supported organizations

Maiti Nepal - Nepal | www.maitinepal.org
Maiti Nepal provides victims of human trafficking and forced prostitution with a place of refuge and helps them through education and vocational training to develop a perspective for the future. Human trafficking is a massive problem in Nepal, affecting tens of thousands of young girls, especially from the poorest rural regions of the country. They are often lured to the cities with job promises and from there they are smuggled into the underground brothels of Kathmandu and India. Maiti Nepal helps these women to escape from their situation and start a new life.


Restavek Freedom - Haiti | www.restavekfreedom.org
The Restavek Freedom Foundation works to abolish child slavery in Haiti. Every year, thousands of children are sent to wealthier Haitians by their impoverished parents, where they are supposed to receive adequate nutrition and education in return for domestic work. Many of these so-called "Restaveks" are not only exposed to long hours of physical labor, but have to endure violence and sexual assaults. Frequently, the promised education and nutrition are withheld from these domestic servants. Restavek Freedom works to prevent these abuses by providing transition homes for the children and raising awareness about this issue in Haiti's rural areas.


Katrin Rohde-Stiftung - Burkina Faso | www.katrin-rohde-stiftung.de
The Katrin Rohde Foundation maintains a variety of facilities for the accommodation of vulnerable children and teenagers and provides them with social and medical assistance. Burkina Faso's population not only has to suffer from extreme economic and climatic conditions, but is also affected by the conflict in the neighboring country of Mali. The increasing threat of terrorism and the rampant Ebola epidemic in West Africa further deepen the economic crisis. The Katrin Rohde Foundation is fighting on many fronts to alleviate the plight of the people of Burkina Faso and to offer them a perspective. Disability projects, the operation of an agriculture school and a multi-generational farm are also part of the foundation's activities.

The “Marginal Notes” Gallery Prints

In cooperation with the German online-startup arrangio GmbH we are also offering fine art prints of our portfolio “Marginal Notes”. “Marginal Notes” deals with the ambivalence in our creative process. Where normally poverty and misery, illness and death, violence and crime are the main focus of our work, in this series we want to honor the beauty we encounter on our travels. The works in this portfolio are visually appealing and at the same time socially relevant. We see “Marginal Notes” as an extension of "A World in Distress", which is why all profits from fine art print sales will also go to Maiti Nepal, Restavek Freedom and the Katrin Rohde Foundation.
Please note that the sale of the "Marginal Notes" fine art prints is handled by arrangio.de and the revenues generated are not displayed as part of the crowdfunding campaign. However, a share of 20% of the sales price is also donated to our selected charitable projects.

Other ways you can help us
Even if you cannot support us financially, you'll be able to help us enormously if you tell your friends and relatives about this campaign and if you share it in the social networks.
Indiegogo provides you with the right tools to do this. Please consider to promote this project, so that we can get the chance to realize our book and charity project "A World in Distress"!

story:
A great photo can bring joy to the worst situations, a happy memory in a moment of sadness, hope when all someone sees is despair.

 

My name is Beau and I love taking photos! I have been involved in photography for 10+ years. Having shot hundreds of portraits, weddings, and events, it has been my great pleasure to capture memories of so many. This past November, my home, New Jersey, was devastated by Hurricane Sandy. So many of my friends, myself, and family lost so much. To help contribute back, I started offering Free Portraits to those who lost their family portraits to the flooding, wind, rain, looting, and other storm damage. The response and outpour of joy it gave people was overwhelming. So much so, we were recognized by several media outlets, and had appointments into the following year. It really showed how a simple photo can bring joy and hope to the worst and most dire situations.

 

This got me thinking, how else can we bring joy with photography? Though we are still rebuilding, I have noticed that a number of weddings, schools, and families have cut photography from their budgets due to economic hardships caused both by the storm and general financial hardships.

 

My goal is to give those people the photos they deserve!

 

We plan on using all funds received to offer FREE and discounted services to those who otherwise couldn't afford them. We will be working with students and like-minded photographers, in hopes of teaching both better technique and the sense of humanitarian duty to the world around them. We will be purchasing equipment, renting space, and offering free training to those who want to help bring smiles to those who don't have much to smile about, one photo at a time!

 

Whether it be replacing a family portrait lost to a natural disaster, giving a less fortunate bride and groom a beautiful photo to put on their wall as they start a life together, or allowing a child who's family cannot afford school portraits the chance to have that photo to look back, years later, and smile, we believe that everyone deserves the chance to capture and relive the good times in life. With your help, we can bring this joy to others.

story:
Фотопечат

Съвместно с галерия "АРТУР" (http://www.artur-gallery.com) на 22 януари 2015 година ще бъде открита фотоизложба, в която ще участват мои снимки. И тъй като и този път нямам финансовата подкрепа на културна организация, реших да стартирам предварителна продажба на фото-паната, като събраните средства ще бъдат използвани за печат. Ако желаете да притежавате моя фотография, отпечатана на професионален широкоформатен фотопечат, можете да ме подкрепите. Моята работа можете да видите на http://iosifastrukov.eu. По ред причини не мога и не бива да излагам тук избраните да участват фотографии предварително, за което ще ви помоля да ми пишете лично, ако имате интерес към определена снимка. Независимо дали с предварителна продажба или просто малка подкрепа, всички ще получат лична покана за откриването на изложбата.

Фотографиите ще бъдат във формат 50/70 см., върху фотохартия или канава.


Photo-print

In cooperation with "ARTUR" gallery (http://www.artur-gallery.com) on 22 of January 2015 an opening of photo exhibition will be held, with the participation of my photographies. And because I don't have the support of any cultural organisation again, I decided to start selling the photographs in advance, so that I could make the prints with the collected funding. If you would like to poses a photography of mine, printed on a professional photo printer, you could help me. You could see my work at http://iosifastrukov.eu. It is impossible to put the list of the participating photographs here, so if you are interested in some particular photo please write me. Everyone will receive a personal invitation for the event. 

The format of the photographs will be 50/70 см., on photo paper or canvas.

story:
Hello, everyone! I'm Grant. I'm a photographer who flocked to the United States for the American Dream. Insanely, I got it. I'm just a couple of thousand short from securing the rest of my life here.


Hopes & Promises

I need to raise enough money to secure myself permanent residency here. Currently I am considered a 'non-resident alien' and no matter how much time I spend here on my current O-1B visa -- it will never count towards citizenship. Now I just got married to my beautiful wife, I have the option of staying here permanently. The money raised will go directly to my attorney and the US Government. 

My current visa comes with many restrictions. Employment and Time are the two biggest. I cannot work for any other employer than the one I'm currently tied to. If I leave, I break my visa terms and have 10 days to leave. The time restriction means I cannot apply for an extension and when this visa expires in April, I have no choice but to leave, unless I drop cold cash on my attorney and the filing fees.


The Severe Impact

You would literally be altering the rest of my life with your contribution. If I don't secure the funding and consequently the Green Card, I have to leave by April 2015. By being able to afford the attorney and filing fee's, I would not have the fears of having to leave in 6 months. It's a complicated structure of bureaucracy that I daren't go into detail here (I may run out of space). If anyone is interested about the nitty gritty details of the whole process, please e-mail me! Happy to explain in detail.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk I have right now is not securing the funding in time. I'm scarily close to this visa expiring and need to apply for permanent residency asap.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, or hire me :) But more importantly do your part to help others. I hope I have shown that people come to this country not to kick back and embrace the quaint notions of freedom, but to work hard, be proud and be able to call yourself a success. The US immigration system is broken. Despite following the rule book word for word,  I still found this to be the most daunting, stressful, expensive, debilitating processes I've ever gone through. You're helping me jump the last hurdle and you're allowing me the privilege of enjoying and pursuing a life here. It's the precise reason I love this country. Regardless of trials and tribulations, people are always there to help.


PERKS!


Shadow Appreciation

This is Shadow! He's my all black German Shepherd. He's my best friend and an absolute sweetheart. You know you want his love, too!


$100 Prints

Here's a sneak preview of what you'll be looking forward to. There'll be a series of 10. You'll be able to take your pick! If you're buying this as a gift for Christmas, let me know.

Hire Me!

If you're a Chicago based photographer, I'm discounting my typical Digital Tech rate to $350/ 10 hrs. 

Private Studio Shoot

Here's some examples of previous studio portraits. You'll get the whole range, and more. It's an absolute blast having a white canvas and a camera to have some fun. Bring your other half along, bring your kids, you'll get the whole gallery of images and some prints thrown in, too.

8x10 Colour Polaroid Shoot

I really cannot stress how fun and beautiful working with an 8x10 camera is. If you have any interest in photography, or the analog process, it doesn't get much more hands on than this. It's a dying form that is harder and harder to witness/be a part of. Get something you know your friends don't have.

Finish Him!

I can only show what i've done in the past. But everyone is a huge fan of this work and I'm happy to work on doing more. It's a labour intensive process so there's only two of these available. They're entirely unique.
