story:
Hi! Thanks for stopping by my fundraising page! Since I'm a photographer, and this is about a photo-jouney that we are going to take together, you're going to see lots of my pictures.

Call me DREAD. I'm the dude with the camera, fedora and gasmask on. I'm the dude who will be exploring the Odd, Quirky and Downright Bizarre Side of the Greater Cincinnati Area.

My Mission:

Starting in October I will spend one year exploring the various dark and gritty cities and towns of the Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana Tristate Area. Also known as Greater Cincinnati. I will photograph and journal my findings for you to explore. Trust me, there are some real oddities!!

My Goal:

I will record my findings into an independant magazine (or "zine") called Agoraphobic Dream, which will be dropping this coming November, giving you a monthly update on my progress as I seek out and extract those things you didn't even know were all around you...

Who Am I?

I'm DREAD. I'm a photographer, writer and artist. But the real twist is that I'm agoraphobic, which means it is very difficult to leave my own house. It gives me panic attacks (get it? DREAD?). If it were up to my own brain, I'd never leave the house. But what a boring life that'd be! So I am heading out to explore!! And I'm taking you with me!

Struggles

So not only will you be getting my photography and travelogue in the zine, but you'll also get a look into the internal workings of someone rising above a disability. And once the year is up and we've taken it as far as it can go, I will reveal myself so that we may have that human connection we deserve.

Many Forms of Photography

I enjoy taking part in many popular forms of photography. The fun faces found in Street Photography, those captured moments that are so precious. The stories within the objects of Urban Decay photos. And don't forget the pulse-pounding excitement and voyeurism of Urban Exploration. These are some of the styles of images I plan to take for you, and many more!

So What Do You Get?

Is it just about me?

No!

It's filtered through me, but it's about everything else!

We're going to meet weird people. Explore odd regions. Dream about the far-off future. Interview those who know the street better than I do. Find those stories! It will be a true multi-media adventure, focusing on the photography of course but also it will have fiction, nonfiction, anecdotes, interviews, Art, collages, poetry, and experiemental photography. It will display all of this with a counter-culture, street feel, because that's where we're going to be wondering most of the time.

Just a weird dude in a gas mask. Observing. Taking pictures. Having a panic attack.

What is the focus of my Fund Raising?

The main thing I'm trying to do is get everyone to sign up for a pre-ordered subscription of my zine.

The cost for a year subscription is $10

It's pretty simple. You get a year of unique and enlightening entertainment and art -- and I get the starting funds I need to begin my journey. This is a true WIN-WIN situation.

 

What Am I Using the Funds For: 

(1) Publishing and delivering digitally (bandwidth, storage etc)

(2) Publsihing and delivering the physical copies (paper, printing service, postal)

(3) Some Needed Computer Equipment For Zine Creation.

(4) Some Needed Software for Zine Development.

(5) Some needed Camera gear for the different shooting conditions I will experience on my journey.

(6) Traveling expenses for a year. I will live sparsely and travel cheap.

(7) An audio recorder with microphone for proper interviews.

(8) Backpacking equipment, and different hiking and protection gear as I will be spending a lot of my time on foot traveling the streets and I will need to have my equipment tied to me securely, but also descretely to avoid robbery.

THE IMPACT IT WILL HAVE ON ME PERSONALLY

Photography is the one thing that keeps me from freezing into an agoraphobic mess inside my own house. I love the excitement and discovery -- finding those things no one has seen and the connected warmth of sharing it with others.

I love to write, make people laugh, explore the world, and interview those who are most often passed up as not interviewable. I like to find that hidden gem in culture -- that local tale the rest of the world hasn't heard. All these things. I just want to get out there and grab it all up and share it with you.

I'm not asking for much in return. Just $10. The cost of a couple fast food dinners and you have yourself a year of magazine content.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can, I really want you to go for that first perk and join me on my journey. A year of weird entertainment for only $10. But I understand if you're not able to. Maybe you could share my story with someone who can get involved? Copy the link. Share the  trial issue, spread that around! Get the word out? You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!

No matter what you do, I appreciate you taking the time to read my story.

 

Thank you! :)

Thank you! :)

story:
UPDATED: My crowdfunding book project was successfully finished! Now I work on the book. It will be published during summer 2017. All contributors will receive the book not later than the end of September. You can still pre-order the book HERE.

I am a self-taught professional photographer, born on April 13 1984, based in Prague, Czech Republic. My distinctive vision of photography is etched as a unique space located in a balance and serenity, while my sophisticated and rewarding images exist in that narrow window of a few seconds between dreaming and awakening. I am grateful I have won over 50 major international photography awards from different competitions, including Professional Photographer of the Year, Nikon International Photo Contest, Prix de la Photographie Paris, Sony World Photography Awards and International Photography Awards eleven times in a row. 

My solo and group exhibitions have been seen from South and North America, through Europe, all the way to Asia. My photographs have been exhibited in places such as New York, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Tokyo, Milan, London, Miami, Paris, Prague, Hong Kong, Kiev and many more. I feel flattered my work stood proudly alongside the likes of Andy Warhol, Annie Leibovitz, Banksy, Damien Hirst or Helmut Newton. I love the smell of autumn and the sparkling grains of dust floating in the sunset.

Here are some photographs from the book "10 YEARS":

Until You Wake Up

Somebody Told Me This Is Real

It Is You

Everytime You Go

We Missed You

I Wish I Was Special

I Found The Silence

Far From The Rivers 

Ten years. Ten years since I first fell passionately in love with photography: a love affair that completely consumed and overwhelmed me. It’s impossible now to imagine my former life without it. Photography for me began as a kind of therapy, but ironically it became a powerful, addictive compulsion. This love affair, this deep love and passion, has brought me many worldwide exhibitions, and I have won a great number of international photography awards. Nothing in our lives compels us or shapes our life decisions more powerfully than passion does. 



Throughout that decade, I encountered characters who shaped the narrative of my life; now those people are powerful memories. There were moments and events too that changed my perspective on life and on my own self. I began recording these events in order to capture my own perception of reality in photographic form, only to realise that in doing so, I was creating episodes chronologically like entries in a journal. Even though these moments were personal and very intimate, I decided to gather them together and publish them in book form. 

I traveled a lot  and visited many unique places. I took there many photos I can put together in one Book "10 YEARS" now. 

My goal is to publish the 800 copy limited edition book "10 YEARS" through fundraising platform. It will be a high quality art photobook containing my photos from the years 2007-2017, a hardcover gem that will really hold its own on bookshelves and coffee tables. Many details during printing and binding separate a good book from a great book and I want this to be a great book. I need your help to reach a goal of 15,000 USD to publish the book and ship all books and prints to you.

While the book itself will be the main goal I am also offering a Portfolio One (set of small signed prints) and beautiful museum archival prints up to 180x100cm (71x39in) of your own choice from my portfolio, personally signed and numbered (limited edition of 25). All prints will be immediately sent till the end of May. All books and Portfolio One sets will be sent immediately after publishing it during this September. Here are the perks you gain if you become a part of this journey:

 

THE BOOK "10 YEARS"

After ten years of work as a photographer and a hundred of exhibitions around the world, I would like to celebrate it by creating high quality art photography book called "10 YEARS", 800 copy limited edition book, a hardcover gem that will really hold its own on bookshelves and coffee tables. It will be really big 28x28cm (11x11in) 100-page hardcover book, silk-finish 200g premium paper, personally signed, features all of my favorite photos 2007-2017. And because I appreciate your support each book will contain 3 extra signed prints (only for books purchased during the crowdfunding campaign).

 

PRINTS

Everyone who gets a perk with any kind of print will be personally contacted via email with all details. All prints are printed on a archival 100% cotton fine art paper Museo Silver Rag with pigment ink of the highest museum quality and standards.  All prints are shipped rolled in a protective hard PVC tube to any country worldwide.

A3 PRINT

The personaly signed A3+ size print 48x33cm / 19x13in. It is printed on a archival 100% cotton fine art paper with pigment ink of the highest museum quality. If you get a perk with A3 print you can choose one from those two options "Until You Wake Up" or "I Can Hear You Call":

"Until You Wake Up" print

 

"I Can Hear You Call" print

 

SMALL SIZE PRINT

If you get a perk with "SMALL SIZE" PRINT, you will be personally contacted via email regarding your choice of any print from my portfolio HERE. Print size is 50x50cm/20x20in (square format) or cca 80x50cm/31x20in (rectangular format). It is printed on archival 100% cotton fine art paper Museo Silver Rag with pigment ink of the highest museum quality and standards. Each print contains certificate of authenticity, personal signature and it is limited edition of 25. All prints are shipped rolled in a protective hard PVC tube to any country worldwide. 

 

MEDIUM SIZE PRINT

If you get a perk with "MEDIUM SIZE" PRINT, you will be personally contacted via email regarding your choice of any print from my portfolio HERE. Print size is 70x70cm/28x28in (square format) or cca 110x70cm/43x28in (rectangular format). It is printed on archival 100% cotton fine art paper Museo Silver Rag with pigment ink of the highest museum quality and standards. Each print contains certificate of authenticity, personal signature and it is limited edition of 25. All prints are shipped rolled in a protective hard PVC tube to any country worldwide.

 

LARGE SIZE PRINT

If you get a perk with "LARGE SIZE" PRINT, you will be personally contacted via email regarding your choice of any print from my portfolio HERE. Print size is 100x100cm/40x40in (square format) or cca 143x90cm/56x35in (rectangular format). It is printed on archival 100% cotton fine art paper Museo Silver Rag with pigment ink of the highest museum quality and standards. Each print contains certificate of authenticity, personal signature and it is limited edition of 25. All prints are shipped rolled in a protective hard PVC tube to any country worldwide.

 

EXTRA LARGE SIZE PRINT

If you get a perk with "EXTRA LARGE" PRINT, you will be personally contacted via email regarding your choice of any print from my portfolio HERE. Print size is 130x130cm/51x51in (square format) or cca 180x100cm/71x39in (rectangular format). It is printed on archival 100% cotton fine art paper Museo Silver Rag with pigment ink of the highest museum quality and standards. Each print contains certificate of authenticity, personal signature and it is limited edition of 25. All prints are shipped rolled in a protective hard PVC tube to any country worldwide.

 

PORTFOLIO ONE SET

The set contains 24 photos 18x18cm (7x7in) each personally signed, the images in the set are listed on the website. They are printed on heavy weight paper and comes in a special black envelope. When the Portfolio One is sold out, it is no longer available.

You can pay exclusively by your credit card. If you would like to pay by your PayPal account, it is possible, please contact me through my email: stranka.martin@gmail.com

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me via my email: stranka.martin@gmail.com or leave a comment here on Indiegogo campaign page.

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. If you like the project I will be very grateful if you follow us and share our campaign with all your friends, family and loved ones. The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out! If you would like to write about the project and share it with your friends and readers, here is a media kit with all campaign photos and text to download:

I will be grateful if you join me on this journey.You can follow me on Facebook  and Instagram here:

story:
My Story

I started at KU in the Art & Design school from the beginning.  From my first day as a freshman 'til my last day as a senior, I'll be a part of KU's Design department.  I switched into the Photomedia major in the spring of my sophomore year after realizing how well a camera fit into my hands.  The major is practically still a newborn as it began in 2008.  There have been a lot of growing pains as a result of that, but I have learned so much from my teachers and fellow students.  Unfortunately, the major still does not offer a senior show, unlike the other majors in the Design department like Graphic Design and Illustration.  I have developed a really great body of work, however, as a result of the time and creativity that I have poured into school.  So I asked myself, "Why can't I have a show too?"  The answer is that... I can!


The Art

The work that will be shown is a series of photographs printed at 13x19".  The photographs are a commentary on heroes in American culture, and they question how we view and value them.  The series was shot digitally with a macro lens.


What I Need & What You Get

The costs for this project are derived completely from printing and promotional costs.  A senior show is a great way to lure in potential employers, and therefore everything must be well publicized and well planned.  Prints are the most expensive part of this project because gallery level prints are archival, beautiful works of art.  They require the best paper and the best printers.  Luckily, my status as a student allows me access to professional printers on campus, but the ink and the paper add up quickly.  Promotional materials are also a smaller percentage of the costs simply because Facebook doesn't always cut it.  I respond best to a physical item in my hand or purse when it comes to any advertising.  I will be sending out event postcards to potential employers, as well as placing them strategically around Lawrence and campus.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Repost this link on your wall, tell a friend, write me a knock-knock joke in the comments!

story:
I’m an adult learner, studying photography in my spare time, with a view to becoming a semi-professional photographer in the future. The fees for adult learners have more than doubled and I’m currently unable to afford the second year of my course.

This is a great opportunity to get a high quality portrait or piece of photographic art without paying professional prices. I’m looking for people that would like to buy my photographic services. I will sell you a fixed period of my time, where I will photograph anything (within reason…).

The final image will be made available to you and will also be used as my final piece for my collage course.

I hope I can make enough money to fund the rest of my studies. If I raise more I will exhibit the works somewhere in London and anyone who has contributed will be invited to a VIP private view.

If you don’t want to take part in a photoshoot but are interested in buying an image/piece of artwork, please check out http://www.photoboxgallery.com/laurababb.

Thanks!

story:
HELLO,
My name is (Rafael) fuchs, and I am a photographer.
Thank you for checking out my current BOOK project.
This will be my 11th. self published book.
(You can see a few at: http://www.blurb.com/user/store/rafaelfuchs
and there are others (for instance,the one that I am offering as one of my perks) which I printed in Holland or other places.)
 
To check out some of the images that will be published in this project's "Bushwick Forever" book, please visit this slide show: 
http://www.vimeo.com/20396695
 
Bushwick has been the main canvas for my camera in the past 7 years.
Being a resident here, I have been witnessing as well as affected by the transformation that have happened here.
I would like to show you images I've been taking, that moved me while living here.
In my intimate social portrait  book that I am preparing now I would like to depict the different aspects of this process, and highlight the people from all spectrum of life that make this neighborhood so unique in my opinion.
I'd like to bring to print the images from the art scene here, starting in 2005 and up to current. I'd like to show the urban landscape changing, the different stores and venues that popped here, and especially the locals that live and work here, as well the curious visitors.
I am not historian per-say. I shoot from the hip, for this project, and some portraits are created in my studio.
Still, some of the pictures I have been selecting and will select do bear a thread of the anxiety of gentrification as well as the politics of real estate and conflicts here, woven in between the colorful images.
I see this project as a mutual effort, and I do need your help to fulfill it if you feel that you are a part of Bushwick, or if you are interested in this part of the world, to any degree.
Please, choose the level of your contribution and enjoy its reward, and post the link on your wall or in your blog. Anything would be helpful.
Thanks so much in advance,
Devotedly,
Your personal documentarian,
Rafi.
 
For more information and visuals:
Watch a 4 minutes slide show presentation with audio by The Roots (this link is mentioned above):  http://www.vimeo.com/20396695

Watch the video that was "liked" by thousands of folks: http://www.vimeo.com/27315329 This is the video that explains my project, although when it was made (Summer of 2011) I was thinking that the book will be ready sooner that it will be.

Watch a short documentary about me : http://www.vimeo.com/17243381
Also, another project that I have been doing in the area, please visit: http://www.bushwickyearbook.com
Visit my main website: http://www.rafaelfuchs.com
Also, check out the gallery and updates on this website, since I am adding pictures and videos all the time,and share the progress of the book in the making as well as  what's happening here.
 
THANKS SO MUCH IN ADVANCE,
Rafi.

story:
Background:

From a very young age I have had a deep love for all things wildlife, especially some of the stunning animals that call Africa home. That love and passion eventually turned into to a fairly successful hobby in nature and wildlife photography which has taken me to many beautiful places in the Western United States. Naturally, an African Photography Safari has long been at the top of my list for places to visit if I were ever able to travel outside of the country. I have recently been given an opportunity with the company that I work for to travel to our office in South Africa. So my dream of one day visiting Africa is going to come true! Safari's aren't cheap though, and not something I'd easily be able to get away with adding to my expense report to my employer ;) So I've creating this campaign in hopes that I can raise the funds necessary to make this happen.

What I Need & What You Get

Looking into the cost of Safari's, guides, local transfers and travel within South Africa I've come up with a goal of $2500 to make this happen. I leave for Cape Town on May 10th so I'll only be running this campaign for 2 weeks. Asking for money is not something I'm very comfortable with at all, especially when there are so many other campaigns and charities and causes that are far more worthy of people's resources than mine, which is why I've decided to set up some perks for donations made. 

As mentioned above, I have been blessed with the opportunity to see and photograph some beautiful places and animals in the Western United States. So I will offer perks of signed prints in various sizes depending on how much you donate of any of my existing photographs from my online portfolio at www.ericreeder.net. Alternatively, I will also offer a "placeholder" option where you can purchase a print of one of the many photos I return home from Africa with.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone is in a position to help financially. There are other ways to help by getting the word out, sharing this campaign on social media and telling your friends and family about this.

story:
WHO ARE WE :

We are two Professional Photographers with a deep passion for the circus community, its culture and the unseen and unheard lifestyles that are passed down from generation to generation.This is part of our American History.

For decades the Circus has influenced our country with innovative business applications, just as our technological developments have changed the traditional Circuses popularity, so they must adapt to a different conditions in order to survive.

 

A COMMUNITY OF CHOICE

We were born into this. Our appreciation for the circus and its non-traditional family oriented community was instilled in us by our family. At the age of 19, Candace, and her now husband, Bill, traveled with the circus, joining Bill's father, a manager of Circus Vargas, and a now well known circus historian. While traveling with Circus Vargas , Bill Sr. married Jan, a single trapeze acrobat and a featured artist, while raising two son's on the road.

          

      

 

 

WITH YOUR HELP

 

We aim to show the importance of family owned and operated circuses, a tradition that first began in America at the end of the 18th century. The Circus has had a great historical influence in America for the last 125 years.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Please share us on your Facebook, twitter, anywhere!

story:
Oil Country Portraits

A collaborative writing and photography project by Nika Knight and Alex Nelson

Places like Fort McMurray, Fort Chipewyan, or Fort McKay might not ring many bells. But whether you know it or not, you’re intimately connected to these Canadian communities: every time you turn on a light or press your foot to the gas pedal, there’s a good chance you’re using energy extracted from the soil of Northern Alberta.

There is a layer of black, sticky earth spread out in a deposit with a surface area greater than that of England, where a dense form of petroleum called “bitumen” is mixed in with sand and clay. Many people in the U.S. know these sands as “tar sands.” But most members of the communities at the heart of the industry in Alberta, whether they are for or against the mining operations, almost uniformly refer to them as “oil sands.” We’re going to refer to them here as “oil sands” because this is what the almost everyone in Northern Alberta -- whether they are for or against the industry -- call them.

The oil sands are controversial, to put it delicately. Bitumen trapped in the oil sands can only be turned into usable crude oil through a complicated process that involves removing the earth and steaming the molasses-like bitumen out of the sandy soil. While settlers have dreamed of striking black gold in Canada’s north for over a hundred years, it wasn’t until high oil prices and improved technology combined to make oil sands minding highly profitable: over 21 billion dollars was invested in the oil sands in 2011.

An entry-level, on-site worker at an oil sands plant will make around $100,000 per year to start, no college degree required. With so much money at stake, it’s likely no surprise that once relatively quiet, isolated communities in Canada’s far north have been inundated with industrial activity, transient laborers, and, even in the midst of a global recession, millions and millions of dollars.

What is it like to live in Canada’s oil country?

I want to tell you the stories of people like Flora Grandjambe, who, as the oldest member of the Fort McKay First Nation, remembers hunting for furs and living off the land in the boreal forest until she was 17; or Melissa Blake, the mayor of Fort McMurray, who hopes to transform Fort McMurray’s image into that of a beacon of sustainability in Canada’s North; or T.J, an engineer and refugee from Durundi’s civil war, who calls the oil sands “the world’s dirtiest oil” but also plans to work on-site as a truck driver for as long as he can, because, as he told me, the money is so good.

The politics and climate impact of the oil sands have been covered extensively in media around the world. But what I think is missing from this coverage is a deep, penetrating look at individual’s lives in the place where the mining is happening. I want to give these people’s voices a platform. With that goal, I am traveling to Fort McMurray for the third time with my friend Alex Nelson, a talented photographer, to conduct further interviews with those living under the shadow of the oil industry.

 

Who we are

·      Nika Knight is pursuing an MFA in creative non-fiction at Columbia, where she’s also studying literary translation. In the past, she’s profiled the founder of the largest independent animal rescue in New York , written about the personal politics of protest , and explored Germany’s oldest organic farm. She writes and edits interviews for Full Stop, an online literary magazine.

 

·      Alex Nelson received her BFA in Photography from the Fashion Institute of Technology in May 2011, and since graduating works for photographer Nan Goldin and continues to pursue her own photographic projects. Her work has been exhibited in New York and featured and published internationally. alexnelsonphoto.com

 

What we need and what you get

·      Unfortunately, due to how far away Northern Alberta is from New York, it is extremely expensive to travel to Fort McMurray, and from there to go to the indigenous communities of Fort McKay and Fort Chipewyan (Fort Chipewyan is so remote that it is only accessible by helicopter in the summertime). By donating to this campaign, you’ll be helping us to:

-Take care of transportation costs, rental car, gas, and helicopter transport

-Purchase film, develop and print Alex’s photographs, and publish her images along with stories and interviews from oil sands country in a sleek, limited edition zine

 

Perks description

·      We have lots of exciting perks to share with you as our thank you to donating to this project. They include:

  • A postcard from Fort McMurray with a story about our trip
  • A copy of the limited edition zine we will create upon our return filled with photographs, stories and interviews
  • Your name listed in the acknowledgments section of our zine
  • 8x10 and 11x14 prints of photographs from our trip, with handwritten text on the back describing the subject or a quote
  • Field notes from our trip including polaroids, small prints, research notes, and more
  • An invitation to come over for dinner (we'll cook!) and have us tell you all about our trip! (Limited to those living in or able to travel to us in New York.)

The impact

·      These communities are full of conflict, heart, lives both average and unusual, and rich, worthy stories that need telling. We want to help you hear what it’s like to live in the heart of the oil sands – so that perhaps the next time you fill up your tank or read about Keystone XL, you’ll realize how intricately linked you are to these communities.

·      Besides the zine, we’re also hoping to gather enough material to pitch our words and photographs to publications with wider reach, so that these stories might find the audience they deserve.

story:
We are the spring 2014 Dawson College Commercial Photography graduating class. For the last two years we’ve been working very hard towards this one very special evening; our graduating vernissage.

As we leave school and enter the highly competitive world of commercial photography we will be using this final evening to showcase our best work for friends, family as well as industry professionals and hopefully, potential clients.

Our goal here is to raise the funds necessary to cover the costs of the vernissage. We aim to raise five thousand dollars total, one thousand eight hundred of which we hope to raise through Indiegogo. Five thousand dollars is a lot of money but when one considers the cost of printing, matting, framing and promotional material the costs add up very quickly. And what’s a vernissage without food and drink? We’ll have you covered!

Please help us reach our $5 000 goal and come celebrate this very special event with us.

story:
Why This Book and Campaign?

Photographs of the difficult-to-find ringtails, baby cliff chipmunks, pronghorns, coyotes and so much more sat on his computer screen. Renowned wildlife photographer, Bruce D. Taubert, thought, “What I can do with these images to help other photographers enjoy Arizona’s wildlife as much as I do?”

Then, a thought crossed his mind, “What if I shared my abundant knowledge and inspiring photographs of the most spectacular Arizona wildlife in a guidebook?" That was his life's dream...but how?


Bruce’s friend, Stan Bormann, encouraged him, "Why don't you contact Colleen [Miniuk-Sperry] to publish it?"

Karma struck and world’s collided!

Colleen and Paul Gill had originally hoped to expand the “Wild in Arizona” book series.  So when Bruce called Colleen, it made perfect sense to expand our “Wild in Arizona” series to include wildlife. Let’s go for it!

After almost three years of laboring and collaborating with a very talented wildlife photographer, Bruce's life dream is about to come true...

COMING SOON! The new guidebook:

"Wild in Arizona: Photographing Arizona's WILDLIFE!"


But, We Won’t Be Able To Do It Without YOU!

You can make it happen.  With your support, you will:

  • First and foremost, help make Bruce's dream come true!
  • Help you and other photographers, nature lovers, and students learn about, find, and photograph Arizona’s most spectacular animals.
  • Educate wildlife lovers about the important rules, regulations and etiquette required by Arizona Game and Fish, BLM and other agencies at various wildlife locations.
  • And finally, help pay for publishing.

How?  As valued supporters, you will received discounted books, eBooks, and exciting workshops by pre-ordering today!  With printing costs increasing, the cost for printing the book will be expensive—about $15,000.  We are turning towards our remarkably generous friends who enjoy photography and Arizona’s wildlife to help us cover $5,000 of the printing costs (a mere 1/3rd of the actual costs) so we can publish Bruce's book.

THANK YOU sincerely for pitching in!  We will say it again: we won’t be able to do this without you!


What's This Book About?

Birds, butterflies, bison, and more, oh my!

Our beautiful wildlife book features:

  • 50 spectacular locations to find a broad diversity of animals to photograph across Arizona
  • Over 220 inspiring color photographs with technical information
  • 14 instructional wildlife photography tips
  • 12 "Making the Photo" stories
  • A comprehensive Photography Basics and Gear Checklist section
  • A Shoot Calendar to find the best wildlife photography opportunities year-round

and much more!

Here's a sample of a two-page spread for location #9: Hassyampa River Preserve from the new book:

And here's a sample two-page spread of one of the 12 "Making the Photo" stories:



What's In It For You?

Pick your perk by clicking the PERK listing on the right side of this website to order (NOTE: clicking on "Contribute Now" will enable you to make a financial donation, but it does not associate it with a specific perk...):

  • Get discounts on the new book and eBook!  Estimated delivery is July 2016.
  • See your name in the book forever! 
  • Enjoy a private half-day workshop with Bruce
  • Join a one-day workshop with Bruce!
  • Polish your photography on a 3-day workshop extravaganza with Bruce!

We will not offer these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so if you have interest in our guidebook, eBook, and workshops, now's the time to buy!


Where Your Money Will Go:

All monies raised in this campaign will go towards the following:

  • The actual printing costs for 5,000 copies of the Arizona wildlife book
  • The cost of fulfilling perks (e.g. shipping, workshop logistics)
  • Indiegogo & credit card processing fees (~8%)


Ways You Can Help:

  • Buy an autographed copy of the book and/or eBook today!
  • Grab some great discounted perks like your name in the book forever and your own private workshops!
  • Share, share, share this campaign with your friends and family - please help us spread the word with photographers and wildlife enthusiasts!

We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
Short Summary

Napier Photo Collective involves fourth year photography students who, every year, come together to plan out an ambitious exhibition as part of the Free Range festival in London.

We are final year BA (Hons) Photography students, currently developing our degree show projects. These individual undertakings will encapsulate the last four years of our study at Edinburgh Napier University, incorporating the technical practice as well as critical skills acquired throughout our course. 
At the end of this academic year, we intend to take our graduate work to exhibit in London at The Free Range Graduate Art and Design exhibition, the largest of its kind, where universities from all across the United Kingdom will showcase their work. Throughout June and July, this space is host to graduates from creative degrees and, from the 21st to the 25th June 2018, we intend to display our work alongside other photography graduates from across the country. Free Range holds invaluable networking and exposure opportunities for both ourselves as individuals, as well as a group collectively representing Edinburgh Napier University.
The work that will be exhibited at Free Range will offer a variety of stylistic approaches that represent the members of the collective, as well as the university as a whole, at the highest possible standard.

The funds raised during this campaign will be used to finance the production and transportation of our exhibition.

The Photographers;

Cirstyn Brown - https://cirstynbrown.com/

Hannah Burt - https://www.hburtphotography.com/

Lara Cappelli - http://www.laracappelli.com/

Oliver Forde - https://oliverforde.com/

Egle Kisieliute - http://www.eglekisieliute.com/

Agata Kozlowska - https://akozlowska.com/

Katariina Leinonen - http://katariinaleinonen.com/

Cameron MacDonald - https://cameronmacdonaldimaging.com/

Sandi Beth Macdonald-Haig - http://ruadhimages.format.com/

Stewart Main - http://stewartmainphotography.com/

Laura Prieto - https://www.lauraprietophotography.com/

Calum Rafferty - https://www.calumrafferty.com/

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise £2000 for production and transportation costs related to the exhibition. This includes:

  • Hiring the space within the venue
  • Building materials (incl. extra walls)
  • Promotional materials (e.g posters, leaflets, flyers, catalogues)
  • Transportation costs for ourselves and our work
  • Accomodation
  • Print production (incl. mounting and framing)
  • Refreshments

We realise we are asking for a lot of help and so we have created a number of different 'perks' you can choose from so that while you are helping us achieve our goal, we can give something back to you in return. Please note that you do not have to choose one of our perks if you do not wish and any amount of help given is greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to any financial support, you can also help support our campaign by spreading the word. Talk to the people around you, follow us on Facebook and Instagram, share our posts and Indiegogo page!

https://www.facebook.com/napiercollective/

https://www.instagram.com/napiercollective/

story:
Betty Begins at TFF!

You guys helped make the suit possible. Now is your chance to help us produce the content of your dreams. At TFF Betty will:

  • Make appearances at the convention nightly for pics and autographs
  • Host a panel alongside animator FoxPawMcFly (creator of Five Nights at Betty's)
  • Most importantly, collaborate with the hottest fursuit characters for photo/video shoots

We can only produce this high-quality fursuit cheesecake with your help.

Our Goals Levels

No matter how much we raise, you will be rewarded. But in order for us to get to TFF, we need to reach a certain minumum goal. All goals are laid out below:

  • LEVEL ZERO - $1 - Even if we only raise $1, everyone will still get ALL non-TFF-related rewards.
  • LEVEL ONE - $850 MINIMUM - This is the bare minimum we need for TFF to happen,
    covering admission, hotel room share, food, fuel, tolls, and indiegogo/paypal/card fees. 
  • LEVEL TWO - $1,100 - We can rent a car for the trip. This will make it easier on us, and far safer if something unforeseen happens on the 6-hour road trip.
  • LEVEL THREE - $1,300 or higher - We buy a lighting kit for future photo/video shoots.
  • LEVEL FOUR - $2,000 or higher - Upgrade slow laptop to a better video rendering PC.
  • LEVEL FIVE - $2,700 - Upgrade camera to a Canon Rebel DSLR.
  • LEVEL ??? - $??? - Put additional in savings for a rainy day or future projects like more fursuits, wardrobe, or equipment.

Perks For Donating

By helping us meet our goals, you get awesome rewards:

  • $1 - One digital signed wallpaper pinup of Betty at TFF*
  • $5 - The above, plus exclusive access to an exclusive video featuring Lamasi Mouse.
  • $10 - The above, plus exclusive access to a "thank you" photo shoot of Betty at TFF*
  • $20 - The above, plus exclusive access to a "thank you" video of Betty at TFF*
  • $50 - The above, plus a limited edition, hand-signed glossy print of Betty at TFF* (ships to continental US only).
  • $100 - Everything from the $20 Level, plus a one-of-a-kind, hand-drawn pinup sketch of Betty, created and signed by FoxPawMcfly himself just for you! (ships to continental US only.)
  • $150 - All $20 level perks, plus Betty personally thanks you in a short thank you video made just for you.
  • $200 -  All $20 level perks, plus you get Betty's personal TFF 2017 Convention book, with a hand-drawn inked pinup of Betty inside by FoxPawMcfly, and autographed by Betty and at least one other fursuit co-star or celebrity. Ships to continental US only. If we don't make it to TFF, we will send a similar book, also drawn in and signed. 
  • $250 - All $20 level perks, plus Betty will be in a custom photo shoot arranged entirely by you, you pick the poses/outfits. Or meet with her at TFF and direct the shoot in person!**
  • $300 - All $20 level perks, plus a the one-of-a-kind modified action figure used as a template to create the Betty fursuit, hand sculpted/painted by Foxpawmcfly to be a damaged Betty. Ships to continental US only.
  • $500 - Everything from the $20 level, plus Betty will do a full video shoot just for you. Or meet with her at TFF and direct the video shoot in person!**
  • $1,000 - Everything from the $500 level, plus a one-hour meet up** with Betty and FoxPawMcfly at TFF 2017 or a future convention appearances, or on a LIVE Skype call.
  • $5,000 - Everything from the $500 level, and Betty will fly out to the convention of your choice! Includes a one-hour meet up with Betty and optionally shooting her video for you LIVE. (Limited to indoor, air conditioned, US conventions/events, subject to our approval)**

*If we don't make it to TFF 2017, these photos/videos will be shot from our home studio.
**Any and all meet ups with Betty will be in a semi-public setting (i.e. a convention event room) and Betty will have her handler with her at all times.

 

Why We're Doing This

LinaPilchard has been the voice of Betty since the first FNAB flash game was going to be a mere one-off parody. Then FNAB grew to it's own little cult phenomenon, and Lina's work progressed as a voice actress. We funded the Betty fursuit with the idea of making her a regular staple of who we are as a team, not just as a game parody character, but as a mascot. We always had the idea that, if we built her, Lina could potentially make a career out of being her. Photos, videos, collaborations with other sexy fursuit celebrities, Audio dramas, live video panels, and more.
TFF is our starting boost, getting her out there in the fandom's public eye, meeting them, talking with them, and most importantly filming content for Lina's Patreon to keep them interested in her work long after the convention is over, and becoming a part of their lives in a positive way.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? You can still help!

  • Ask friends to get the word out on FA, InkBunny, Weasyl, and other furry community sites!
  • Be sure to give them the link to this indiegogo campaign!
     

Thank you all for your love and caring support.
We do what we do for you, and couldn't do it without you. ♥
story_txt:
Betty Begins at TFF!
You guys helped make the suit possible. Now is your chance to help us produce the content of your dreams. At TFF Betty will:

Make appearances at the convention nightly for pics and autographs
Host a panel alongside animator FoxPawMcFly (creator of Five Nights at Betty's)
Most importantly, collaborate with the hottest fursuit characters for photo/video shoots

We can only produce this high-quality fursuit cheesecake with your help.

Our Goals Levels
No matter how much we raise, you will be rewarded. But in order for us to get to TFF, we need to reach a certain minumum goal. All goals are laid out below:

LEVEL ZERO - $1 - Even if we only raise $1, everyone will still get ALL non-TFF-related rewards.

LEVEL ONE - $850 MINIMUM - This is the bare minimum we need for TFF to happen,covering admission, hotel room share, food, fuel, tolls, and indiegogo/paypal/card fees. 
LEVEL TWO - $1,100 - We can rent a car for the trip. This will make it easier on us, and far safer if something unforeseen happens on the 6-hour road trip.
LEVEL THREE - $1,300 or higher - We buy a lighting kit for future photo/video shoots.
LEVEL FOUR - $2,000 or higher - Upgrade slow laptop to a better video rendering PC.
LEVEL FIVE - $2,700 - Upgrade camera to a Canon Rebel DSLR.
LEVEL ??? - $??? - Put additional in savings for a rainy day or future projects like more fursuits, wardrobe, or equipment.

story:
Who The Heck Are You?

My name is Cam Evans and I am a concert photographer born and raised in Sacramento, California. I got my start into photography when I was in high school and going into college. I photograph many subjects in between those times, but in my heart, I still felt lost into what I really wanted to do with photography until early 2017 I decided to take my camera to a local punk show and photograph said show. This was the point in my life where I knew I wanted to photograph concerts. Since then, I have photographed many do-it-yourself bands within the Sacramento and Bay Area music scene and much bigger acts like KISS and Del The Funky Homosapien (just to name a few); my work being featured in music magazines and blogs like Sacramento News And Review, Maximum Rocknroll, and New Noise Magazine. 

What The Heck Are You Doing With This Indiegogo?

I am doing this Indiegogo to promote my new photo magazine Girls Burn Boys. It's a follow up to my last photo magazine Sacramento Is Burning, that focused on some the punk scene in Sacramento, California with bands and some of the crowd of the shows. Girls Burn Boys focuses on female musicians that I photographed within last year including both local and touring bands that come through Sacramento and the Bay Area.  The reason for the Indiegogo is to provide funding for the overhead cost of printing the magazine, the prints for those that pledge for it, and any Indiegogo fees. Like the last photo magazine, the printing of the magazine is going to be done through Blurb while the prints will be done through Mpix.

When Is Girls Burn Boys Coming Out?

For those that pledge Girls Burn Boys and all the rewards will be sent out around late November/ early December.  For everyone else, the link to order through Blurb's market place will be up early December. Stay updated for more details on my Instagram and Facebook. 

You're Having Dinner For People? Where At?

The destination will be announced within the coming days, but if by chance you do run a restaurant in Sacramento and you are willing to host people get in contact with me.  The dinner itself will take place on November 23. 

Why Are You Doing This?

This a way for me to promote and show off all these awesome female musicians with some of my favorite photos into one neat little magazine for everyone in the world to see. Also, women that are involved within making music are pretty cool. Don't ask so many questions bro.

story:
I need your help to make Larson's Gallery better.   My name is Larson.   I was trained as a Visual Artist several decades ago in Toronto and Kingston.   Since moving to Sudbury more than a decade ago, I have voluntarily promoted Sudbury through writing and Photography using my Larson's Gallery.com Blog and Social Media.    

Due to the popularity of Larson's Gallery, I would like to grow by hiring another writer for my Blog.   This would be a very part-time position, no more than one day a week or one article a week about Arts/Culture Sudbury.    I have advertised for a voluntary writer position before but seems that nobody is willing to work for free.   I can understand this.

I am asking you to donate for this reason.   My goal is $ 2,000.   Any money raised beyond this will go towards  he/she writing longer.   

For any donation above $ 50.00, I will take a 5'' x 7'' photograph of you and frame it.   Any donation above $ 100.00, I will take an 8'' x 10'' photograph of you and frame it.   And, of course, I will give you a receipt.   You can see what these Photographs look like by visiting the Forken&Spoon Restaurant or Korner Kaffee, both in our Downtown.

Thank you for helping,

Larson

story:
Summary

Analogue Luxury is a brand that produces fine art, home goods, and merchandise inspired by the practice of taking authentic Polaroids and shooting 35mm disposable film. Our goal is to produce goods and content that will keep you inspired, intrigued,  and motivated. 

My name is David Butler (DavehasWingz) - Over the past 7 years I have embarked on a journey in photography that has led me to this moment. Creating a brand and a space to bridge the gap between my past and present to create the future. I first began taking photos with a point and shoot digital camera in high school. Once in college I began to approach the craft as an art form and knew it would become a permanent part of my life. I graduated with a business degree in 2013 and returned home to Charlotte, NC and began working to positively contribute to the creative culture of the city. 

I am looking to open the Analogue Luxury studio as a space that will be used not only as a proper showroom and design office for the brand but a place that gives business tools to creatives. I will consistently be facilitating workshops and events  critical to helping set the framework and infrastructure for creatives in Charlotte, NC. 

1. Studio // Showroom

Home decor and fine art can be tricky to sell - Patrons like to experience these items in a way to help the envision pieces in their space. There will be a series of installations (i.e. mock living rooms, office layouts, etc.) to help potential customers interact and make purchasing decisions. 

2. Workspace // Design Studio

The future of Analogue Luxury is not limited to the production and distribution of tangible goods. There is an opportunity to provide creative services with a novel twist as we plan to apply the thought processes and aesthetic developed through working with analogue mediums. This space will serve as a headquarters for these operations. 

3.  Workshops // Gallery Space

Artists and creatives need the opportunity to grow. Currently, Charlotte has no space that fosters the education and experiences for emerging artists. Galleries, residencies, fellowships, etc. require a set of experiences and knowledge that are not readily available to all artists and creatives. Analogue Luxury's studio will be a place for solidified emerging artists to gain the formal knowledge and experience necessary to push them to the next level in theory and in practice.  

Photo Credit: Carey J. King

The Breakdown

The goal is to give the space an opportunity to breathe for up to a year. With the base expenses and rent covered the focus can remain on making an impact for creatives, providing an amazing experience through the brand, and scaling the e-commerce side of the business. There are four main categories where funds will be dispersed to achieve this goal. 

For your contribution to this amazing effort there are many perks available at different contribution levels. Many of the products will not be released to the general public and are only available to campaign contributors.  

The Impact

Charlotte is in a critical period of growth and is constantly fighting to define itself. Every contribution no matter how big or how small helps artists and creatives gain the resources to be successful business operators in this ever changing economic environment. Artist bring a cultural edge and drive important conversations through their work that help define the narrative and outlook of the city to the world at large. 

Risks & Challenges

Scaling will be challenging - The core of Analogue Luxury exists online and while the showroom will be a great place for people to interact with certain elements of the brand it is not the main vehicle of revenue. The brand will need to work considerably to stand out in the crowded and face pace digital space. I look forward to applying strategies and experience gained from working in the world of e-commerce for men's sneakers and fashion industry. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell any and everyone  you know who is into streetwear, sneakers, photography,  home decor, or even a mixture of those things about this project. Share this campaign and the story - Feel free to reach out with questions!

story:
Tanzania In-Focus 

The Tanzania In-Focus project is a collaborative photographic mission between United Planet, Photographers Without Borders and photographer Joshua Hobson.  All money raised will go towards the task of photographically documenting United Planets’ work in Tanzania.  

I have been selected and invited by Photographers Without Borders to participate in their Global Photography Service Program.  This specific program will take place for three weeks in Tanzania this fall. My task will be to travel to Tanzania, shadow an in-country volunteer for United Planet and document the important work they are doing there.  I will be documenting the development project of the volunteer, the interaction between the volunteer and their host family as well as the impact the project is making in the community of Dar es Salaam. In addition, I will complete a portraiture series of those who are benefitting from the work of United Planet.

The specific goals of the project are as follows:

  • To acquire high-quality photos and videos of various aspects of the program (host family stays, volunteer work, cultural activities, etc) to be used for program promotion and mission awareness campaigns.
  • To visually represent the values and mission of UP’s organization which are founded on the idea of Relational Diplomacy - recognizing that the relationship between people of diverse backgrounds is the basic building block for uniting the world.
  • To increase the amount of quality photos that UP Tanzania can use when applying for grants, other support or recruiting new partners.

United Planet is an international non-profit that strives to create a world in which all people understand, respect, and support one another.  They recognize that bringing together people of diverse backgrounds are the basic building block for uniting the world.  They work in over 40 countries worldwide in the areas of education, civic engagement, sustainable practices, and community relief and development.  You can learn more about the work of United Planet here.  

 

Photographers Without Borders is a non-profit organization based in Toronto, Canada.  Founded by a group of photographers, PWB recognizes the arts as an effective strategy for sustainable development, believing that images are a powerful form of communication and have the ability to foster education and understanding of the global community. To learn more about the projects of Photographers Without Borders, please visit their website.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised for the Tanzania In-focus project will go directly toward expenses of this project including, air travel to and from Tanzania, vise fees, vaccinations, post processing as well as a generous donation to the host family with whom I'll be living. **The cost breakdown looks something like this:

Roundtrip Airfare to Tanzania: avg. $1500

Vaccinations: avg $300

Visa Fees: avg. $200

Donation to host family: $500

Travel around Tanzania:avg. $300

Travel Insurance: avg. $150

 

By helping to fund the Tanzania In-Focus Project, you are not only helping me to complete this specific project on behalf of United Planet and Photographers Without Borders, but you will receive a gift as an expression of my gratitude.

What You Get:

$25- A personalized postcard from Tanzania

$50- An 8x10 print of your chioce from this project.

$100- A signed 11X14 print of your choice from this project or any of my previous works.

$200- An 8x10 print of your choice plus a Kanga (traditional Tanzanian textile garment)

$400- A 16x20 print of your choice framed and shipped to you! (USA Only)

 

 

The Impact

A donation to the Tanzania In-Focus Project is more than a donation to this specific project.  Your money will be going toward a much larger purpose.

  • You will be contributing to sustainable development not only in Tanzania, but throughout the world.                                                                         
  • You will be contributing to fostering cross-cultural understanding and shared perspectives.                                                                                   
  • You will be impacting the livelihoods of people world-wide.                          
  • You will be supporting a grassroots photography initaitive dedicated to fostering education and understanding of the global community.

 

Please consider a donation of any amount. Thank you in advance for your time and consideration.

 

About the Photographer

I am a fine art and documentary photographer currently residing in Portland Oregon. My work has been exhibited and published nationally, includng the Colorado Center for Photographic Art, Carte Blance Gallery, Candela Books, SoHo Photo Gallery, Detroit Center for Contemporary Photography, and Newspace Center for Photography.  I received a BFA in photography from the University of Florida in 2007 and since then have been wandering the globe, teaching, exploring and photographing.  My work can be seen at:

jhobsonphoto.com (fine art)

or

goinginfocus.com (travel/documentary)

I am a fine art and documentary photographer currently residing in Portland Oregon. My work has been exhibited and published nationally, includng the Colorado Center for Photographic Art, Carte Blance Gallery, Candela Books, SoHo Photo Gallery, Detroit Center for Contemporary Photography, and Newspace Center for Photography.  I received a BFA in photography from the University of Florida in 2007 and since then have been wandering the globe, teaching, exploring and photographing.  My work can be seen at:
jhobsonphoto.com (fine art)
or
goinginfocus.com (travel/documentary)

story:
Want to make a real difference while expressing your furry-ness?

Today you can! Introducing:

The #FursuitFriday Charity Calendar

Every donation supports the life-saving work of Last Chance Corral, a rescue for abandoned and abused horses.  Help a wonderful cause, and get an awesome furry calendar in return.

  • 20+ amazing fursuiters - one of the largest furry collabs ever!
  • 18 month calendar (July 2019 to December 2020)
  • 40 pages of beautiful photography
  • 12 x 12 in size (30 x 30 cm)

This stunning piece of art is a must-have for every furry. There will only be one printing - don't miss it!  Consider supporting Last Chance Corral with a donation today.

 

About the Charity

One of the largest foal rescue facilities in the US, Last Chance Corral (LCC) has been rescuing mistreated, unwanted, and misunderstood horses and foals for over 30 years.  Their work is absolutely critical for the 150+ foals that come into their care every year. As Victoria, the founder of LCC, puts it herself, “We wanted to put our efforts into something that people don’t want to work with, which is newborns. We needed to at least give them a chance.” 

LCC does amazing work and we are honored that they chose to partner with us at ArtworkTee.com to create this campaign. They were the official partner of Anthrohio last year, and so they have experience working with furries, and jumped at the chance to do so again.

Your donation makes a real difference - The foaling season (lasting through June) is the most important time of year and the time of greatest need for the organization.  Your donation at this critical time means that they can rescue more foals and find them homes with loving caregivers. You can learn more about the charity by visiting their website: http://lastchancecorral.org

Edit: The Last Chance Corral website is experiencing some server overload - We recommend that you take a look at their Facebook page while their server gets back online: https://www.facebook.com/LastChanceCorral/

The Fursuiters

With over 6 months of work in preparation for this fundraising campaign, and over 20 fursuiters participating, the #FursuitFriday Charity Calendar is one of the biggest furry collaborations ever. Here are all the furries you will see for each calendar page:

The Rewards

Our team at ArtworkTee.com has created several rewards to encourage you to give generously to this great cause. The available rewards are:

  • The #FursuitFriday Charity Calendar ($35 plus shipping)
  • An exclusive Tshirt - Featuring artwork by Paco Panda ($25 plus shipping, larger sizes extra)
  • LIMITED EDITION Signed Calendar - signed by Telephone, Majira Strawberry, Vixndwnq, Kiwi Fox, and Pineapple Fox. Limited to only 100 copies! ($95 plus shipping)

Fundraising Goals

Our initial goal is to raise $30,000 USD for Last Chance Corral. This enables them to hire additional staff, buy much-needed supplies, and save even more horses in need. 

With this campaign, we are donating all profits to the charity, i.e. the amount raised minus the costs. These costs include things like card processing, fees which go to Indiegogo, and the costs to produce the rewards. We are keeping these costs as low as possible so that the maximum amount can be donated to LCC.

The estimates in our graph are based on a quantity sold of approximately 1000 calendars.  The exact percentage will depend on a number of factors, such as number of units sold, the amount of stretch goals reached, and the number of calendars sold vs number of shirts. The percentage could vary up or down by about 10% depending on these factors. The graph above does not include shipping, because of the large variation in shipping costs to different regions. Regardless, we will work tirelessly to keep costs as low as possible so that LCC gets all the help we can give. Whenever there is an opportunity, we will reduce costs without compromising quality.

    Stretch Goals

    As we raise more money for Last Chance Corral, each calendar purchase will include even more great merch sponsored by several furry businesses (please note, this is for calendar purchases, not tshirt purchases). The more we raise, the more rewards you get, so make sure to share the campaign with your friends!

    For the stretch goals, depending on how many goals are reached, a number of small, fun items will be added to each calendar order. For each milestone, an additional item is added, like a sticker or postcard. The more we raise, the more you get!

    Important: Please note that because the tshirts are fulfilled from a different location, the tshirt orders will not be affected by stretch goal rewards.

    Sponsors

    The campaign is being coordinated by ArtworkTee, a furry tshirt company.

    ArtworkTee.com

    This campaign would not be possible without our other amazing sponsors, including:

    AwooNews.com

    Paco Panda

    Torben Goldmund's Art N' Prints

    Crunchy Crowe Art

      Risks & Challenges

      To help keep problems to a minimum, we have completed the design work and made sure that all potential rewards are ready even before starting the campaign. The team of 5+ people who work for ArtworkTee.com are ready and willing to meet challenges that happen during the production or shipping process.  One of the most important considerations is keeping costs as low as possible - our goal is to keep the total costs of rewards to approximately 21% of the total donation amount or less. If unforeseen circumstances arise, such as a much higher price than quoted for the printing by our third party supplier, it is possible that the cost of rewards may be higher. If that is the case, we will do everything we can to lower the costs.  

      We have made our estimates based on approximately 1000 calendars sold, and one risk/challenge is if a significantly lower or higher amount is sold. If a significantly lower amount (for example, 50-100 donations), then the cost per piece will be, unfortunately, higher than expected. If a significantly higher amount is sold, then even though it will result in much more money for LCC, it may take longer to fulfill the rewards, because of the small size of our team. If that is the case, we will bring on temporary workers and volunteers who can help package and ship the rewards to the donators.  Our team is highly skilled and experienced, having experience in inventory management and packaging from many years working at conventions. Whatever challenges arise, we will be able to overcome them.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Even if you can't afford to make a donation, don't worry - you can still help by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign! Please share our link on Twitter, Facebook and other social media platforms, and encourage your friends to donate.  Here is the shortlink to share: https://igg.me/at/furrycalendar

      If you have Twitter, please retweet our announcement tweet to help spread the word! https://twitter.com/artworktee/status/112074960...

      Thank you so much for reading, and thank you especially for your support! You can make a huge difference - Consider donating to support Last Chance Corral today!

      Unboxing Video:

story:
This project is 100% MADE IN ITALY.

The chickens in this book are the protagonists and are photographed as Top models because they had natural born talent.

The Photographers Moreno Monti and Matteo Tranchellini brought these chicks to life. You won’t believe it but all they used was just a simple light set, nothing else was needed: these guys & gals took center stage. See for yourself or even better scratch on over to the pledges and get your chicken paraphernalia now. Soon their agents will be asking us big dollar amounts to get them out of the coop. Some of them are now official divas and on Instagram with hundreds of likes. Follow them @chicken_ph

 WHO SAID BIRD BRAINS WEREN'T BEAUTIFUL?!

THE CHICken SERIES

Matteo has always been fascinated by the beauty of birds and since boyhood has had a dream of flying. In 2013 he decided to go in search of a Cochin as a pet for his studio garden in Milan. He met a farmer who invited him to an aviary exhibition...

That very same day, the Cochin hen Jessicah (cue Unchained Melody) stole his heart.

Thanks to her, Matteo and Moreno surprisingly found themselves on this journey. That’s when the CHICken project was born.

The CHICken series was photographed in Italy at the Milano aviary exhibition. Many of the breeders were worried that the birds were not posed according to the breed standard. Instead, what they didn’t understand was just how well the birds had done their homework, they were natural born posers.

The photographers wanted to capture them in their natural state of being with all its elegance.

They were just themselves and had a natural ability to move in front of the camera. Some of them were photographed from the side, from behind or with only a glance over the shoulder. A NATURAL TALENT.

OPTIONS & REWARDS 

Is the book or the photo prints too fancy for your pants?! Or let me guess... You just can’t get enough of our hens and roosters with the book?! Don’t freak out! We have created a collection of funny, affordable and collectable accessories that can be given as unique gifts or simply kept for yourself. There is such a variety of items available that you can even take your favorite chickens to work with you.

Irresistible things to choose from:

• Beautiful COFFEE TABLE BOOK
• Limited edition prints (signed), this is serious! 
• Collectable Journals (4 prints randomly chosen)
• Collection of 8 model composites in postcard format
• Sexy calendar for adults only :-)

 

MODEL COMPOSITE POSTCARDS 

Want to book one of our hot chicks / roosters for your next photoshoot?! Look at our board of super models and choose your favorite one.

DON’T WORRY THEY COME IN ALL DIFFERENT SHAPES AND SIZES

You will get:
• 8 Composite in postcard format 100x160 mm printed on a thick card stock
• 8 Different chicks

COLLECTABLE JOURNALS 

The journals feature a few of our top models on their recent cover shoots. Use it as a notebook, they have blank pages inside.

YOU CAN SCRATCH ’TIL YOU HEART’S CONTENT

• 2 Men’s Fashion inspired Journals
• 2 Woman’s Fashion inspired Journals
• Dimensions 277x190 mm 
• Covers will be randomly chosen by our team from the following: 

► CHICKENFAIR
► MARIE CHICKEN
► CQ - CHICKEN QUARTERLY
► ROOSTER'S HEALTH

SEXY CALENDAR

For adults only CHICken offers you a sexy calendar for 2019. BECAUSE OUR CHICKS ARE SEXY! :-)

The calendar is made of 12 sexy shots of the most exemplary hens & roosters that Matteo and Moreno discovered during their photoshoots. Every month features a rooster or a chick from around the world that were photographed wearing their feathers only.

You will get:

• 1 calendar, 12 months - format 210x420 mm / 8.3x16.6"
• 1 cover page 12 different sexy shots

 FUN FACT: a "chick" refers to both male and female chickens :-)

CHICken THE BOOK 

Not to flaunt our feathers or anything, but the CHICken book was designed to blow your mind with the highest quality printing techniques. We want to give you the WOW factor when you open the package and look at these sexy feathered chickens! That is why we hand-picked the best materials and print processes available and chose the best certified photographic quality print out there.

The book will be produced 100% in Italy.

SOME INTERESTING SPECS:

  • Portrait Format - Dimension 300x270 mm - 11.9x10.7"
  • 190 pages
  • 85 high res photos
  • 3 gatefold spreads
  • Hard cover + foil stamping & embossing
  • Flat-opening sewn binding

HARD COVER

The beautiful plumage of a feather is embossed on the cover and the title is printed in silver hot foil.

The hard cover is 2.4 mm - 1 in thick and is made of Curious Matter Black Truffle paper that weighs 125g. The high quality paper has a silky texture similar to fine sand and is very pleasant to the touch.
 

PRINT (and DEEP BLACK)

Thanks to the offset print technique used you’ll be able to have high quality photos that are clear and precise, not dot-based like digital printing.

The black pages and the dark background allow the subject to emerge dramatically like models on the runway.
Every image is paired with an inspiring phrase that pays tribute to beauty. Each quote is printed in fine silver Pantone.
We wanted to give you the best quality book available and that's why we chose to print and produce it 100% in Italy. 

BINDING 

When we spoke with our supplier about the variety of binding selections, we opted for a quality flat-opening sewn binding to emphasize the high definition photographs. This special binding makes it possible to lay the book flat when it is opened, flush with the surface it is on, creating a pleasant coffee table book appearance.
 

REWARDS MAP

Just to be generous we spent hours bartering with the supplier to lower those prices! As a result these are the best damn prices around for a book of this caliber. Go on a pretty woman shopping spree and you’ll never have to go back and say “BIG MISTAKE! BIG MISTAKE!”.

AN EXCLUSIVE CHANCE to meet the Photographers!

Meet Matteo & Moreno and have your own photoshoot and custom portrait of you together with your own chicken (Or other favorite pet, we might be divas but we’re no snobs, we’re pretty down to earth). Above you can see an example of Matteo with Rocky. Shot by Moreno, December 2017. They are absolutely gorgeous, aren’t they!? This is the chance to work with two of the best photographers in Italy (They work with chickens, but also with very important brands).

CHICken COLLECTION IS ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE & FRIENDLY

We chose certified paper, produced exclusively with cellulose fibers from sustainably managed forests. Our suppliers guarantee the usage of 100% FSC® wood. The book will be printed, bound and packaged here in Italy for optimum quality and constant control of the final product. One of the many reasons we chose an Italian supplier, rather than a cheaper one abroad, was the ability to verify the quality of the product itself.

 

 

MORE ABOUT THE AUTHORS

It is exactly this symbiosis of the two visions that creates the final result.
It’s a team effort, the CHICken series wouldn’t be possible without this shared complicity.

Bird Brains behind CHIC!ken

Follow these beauties on Instagram chicken_ph

GOLDEN EGG BOOK EDITION NOW AVAILABLE!

THE NEW CHICKEN GOLDEN EGG EDITION includes: The CHICken BOOK signed by the authors as special thanks + The New DELUXE EDITION CASE.
 

Golden Egg Deluxe Edition Case

 
CHICKEN DELUXE CASE
The premium case will have a beautiful embossed feather on the cover and the title will be printed in silver hot foil to match the hard cover of the book. The inner sleeve of the case features a stunning feathered black print. A magnet flap provides a secure and pleasant closure and the black satin ribbon helps you remove the book from the cover with care. This exclusive case will be produced in small quantities only. 100% Made in Italy.

 

 

CHIC!ken featured on The Guardian

 
 
REWARDS MAP
Just to be generous we spent hours bartering with the supplier to lower those prices! As a result these are the best damn prices around for a book of this caliber. Go on a pretty woman shopping spree and you’ll never have to go back and say “BIG MISTAKE! BIG MISTAKE!”.

AN EXCLUSIVE CHANCE to meet the Photographers!

One of the many reasons we chose an Italian supplier, rather than a cheaper one abroad, was the ability to verify the quality of the product itself.

 


 

 

 
MORE ABOUT THE AUTHORS

Moreno Monti & Matteo Tranchellini both live in Milano and have worked together for years on countless projects. They have produced and collaborated together on many advertising campaigns with international acclaim and have also collaborated with major international artists. The two talents have been passionate about photography since a young age and found that by working together over the years as a team, they were able to produce visual images with a creative synergy that otherwise, on their own, would not be possible. Each one of them individually has his own specific talent and personal approach to photography and each contribute diverse aspects of their own personal taste to every project.
It is exactly this symbiosis of the two visions that creates the final result.It’s a team effort, the CHICken series wouldn’t be possible without this shared complicity.

Atellani Team at work

story:
What We Need & What You Get

We want to fund a catalogue to showcase work by a brilliantly talented group of students.. We will have a show, of course, but the catalogue can be taken away by our visitors – and that is important. Having good work shown in a good University catalogue has opened up so many doors for previous students — we hope ours will do the same. 

Money raised will help also help to make the show look professional and reach the standard we want to reach.

The Impact

Final year show. It’s the time to show the outside world what we have done and what we can do. We need to spend the money to get it right; because there’s no second chance.

Risks & Challenges

We are actively trying to fundraise through a number of different channels, ranging form the purely local like bake sales and club nights, through others like this with a wider reach

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate all the help and support, as little or as much as you can give would be great, even a share of our page would go such a long way.

And that's all there is to it.
