What We Need & What You Get
We want to fund a catalogue to showcase work by a brilliantly talented group of students.. We will have a show, of course, but the catalogue can be taken away by our visitors – and that is important. Having good work shown in a good University catalogue has opened up so many doors for previous students — we hope ours will do the same. 
Money raised will help also help to make the show look professional and reach the standard we want to reach.

The Impact
Final year show. It’s the time to show the outside world what we have done and what we can do. We need to spend the money to get it right; because there’s no second chance.

Risks & Challenges
We are actively trying to fundraise through a number of different channels, ranging form the purely local like bake sales and club nights, through others like this with a wider reach

Other Ways You Can Help
We would appreciate all the help and support, as little or as much as you can give would be great, even a share of our page would go such a long way.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary:

Photography and travel is a gateway to learning about the world around you. “New Mexico Gods” (NMG) is a geocaching, photo-safari adventure exploring New Mexico 's spiritual places – from ancient Native American Indian sites, to old Christian Churches , to outdoor ceremonies that connect past and present.

The materials collected and developed from our travels throughout New Mexico will culminate in a limited edition, high quality, hardcover photo book with digital supplementary materials containing even more photos, videos, and historical information.

For the adventurous, and curious . . . along the way, we will  leave a geocaching trail ; to better share the journey with those that may wish to follow and explore the wide open spaces, the ancient ruins, the buildings, the churches, the cities and towns, and last but not least connect with the past and the people of the present to better share in the wonder of all that is.


About the Team:

As you can see from the names below, with the exception of the pilot (though he is a close friend too), this is a family endeavor, with the associated personal devotion to excellence that such projects entail; with graphic design assistance (book design and layout) by my wife, and pottery assistance (production of handmade ceramic geocaching tokens) by my mother. For more information on the team members, see below:

Parker Bradley (Photographer and Project Director): A Physicist & Engineer with over 25 years experience in photography ranging from clinical project documentation, to stock, to artistic and aerial work.
A small, but growing sample of my work can be found at:
http://parker-bradley.artistwebsites.com
For more info on me see: http://www.linkedin.com/in/parkerbradley

Joanna Bradley (Graphic Designer): A graphic designer for over 20 years, serving various companies and organizations ranging from the Syracuse Papers in New York , to the New Mexico Museum of Space History. She currently is the Graphic Designer for the New Mexico School for the Blind & Visually Impaired, as well as also having a freelance graphic design business on the side. http://www.FishFoot.com

Renné Bradley (Potter): Over 35 years in banking, she retired a few years ago to follow what has been her passion & hobby for about as long – pottery. She now has a studio and workshop (Gazebo Potters) in Ruidoso , NM and teaches pottery classes for the local community college.
https://www.facebook.com/renne.bradley
http://vesselsofadventure.weebly.com/

Kevin Dunshee (Pilot): Retired Fighter Pilot for the U.S. Air Force, and is currently a GPS Test Manager for the U.S. Air Force, an FAA Certified Flight Instructor, and a Designated Pilot Examiner for the FAA. He's just about flown it all – in short, he'd rather be flying!
http://www.linkedin.com/pub/kevin-dunshee/21/107/36a

 

What We Need & What You Get

Impact of Your Support

By purchasing a copy of the book through this campaign, or otherwise supporting this project, you will help in the book's creation (and in the creation of the Geocaching Trail) for yourself and for others to enjoy too.

Funds will primarily cover:

  • the cost of printing the book
  • the cost of aerial and ground photo missions
  • the costs of conducting historical research
  • as well as covering the expense associated with setting up the geocaching trail for others to follow.

About the Limited Edition Signed Books

The photo books will be 200 to 300 full color pages, large format 12”H x 14”W, hardcover (with full-color dust jackets) with foil-stamped covers and spine. As of this writing, we plan to have the books produced by “EditionOneBooks.com”. They not only produce a high quality product, but were the only book publishers we could find that would let us produce a limited run book this large at a cost that allows us to provide a reasonably priced product to sponsors, and to keep both of our arms and legs. ;-)

If we get 1 to 749 orders for physical books, they will be printed on digital presses. If we get over 749 orders for physical books, they will be printed on a traditional offset press – which further enhances the quality.

About the Signed Photo Prints

You will get to choose your favorite museum quality image for printing from a selected set of project images. The photo print will be about 20”x14” (exact size will vary a little bit in either or both dimensions, depending on image).

All of our prints are produced on state-of-the-art, professional-grade printers. Current print company, as of this writing, is Fine Art America (subject to change without notice). Acid-free papers and archival inks are used to guarantee that your prints last a lifetime without fading or loss of color.   Paper prints include a 1" white border around the image to allow for future framing and matting and will be shipped in durable cardboard tubes.

About the T-shirts

T-shirts will be white, short sleeves, made of 100% cotton pre-shrunk with the image on the front. Size of your choice.

See below for image example:

This T-shirt Pic is for illustrative purposes only. Final Design(s) for the "perk shirts" will most likely differ from the above.

Sponsor Recognition

Campaign Sponsors, at all levels, will be recognized by a "sponsor listing" (with the exception of those that wish to remain anonymous) in the digital book and on the project website. "Arts Patrons Sponsors", will receive additional recognition in the printed book as well.


About the Geocaching Trail

As we explore New Mexico 's sacred sites, churches, ceremonies, and the like we will leave a geocaching trail (all appropriate etiquette for establishing geocaches will be followed) with coordinates and hints provided in the digital materials. Geocaching coordinates will also be provided in the hard copy book too. Aside from being contained in the digital materials, coordinates and hints will be part of the regular email updates for paid-up customers, so you can start your adventures right away if you wish.

The caches will contain hand-made, glazed, clay tokens, and other things, and will be of varying levels of difficulty to get to, and to find – some will be very easy, some a little challenging, and some very hard.

Just as gold was a motivating factor for the Spaniards in their travels, so too will it be for our geocaching trail. Hidden amongst the geocaches will be 5 viles of placer gold dust . Each vile will contain about 1/10 of a gram of placer gold dust (worth about $5 each, as of this writing). Some of the caches will also contain physical Bitcoin cards of varying denominations as well.

There will also be an online database & blog that paid-up participants can log into to log their discoveries and share their stories – even if you aren't on the trail, you can log in an see what adventures are being had by other participants.

For those not familiar with geocaching, check out www.geocaching.com to learn more about this fabulous sport/hobby.

 



Project Time Line

Collecting Information, Imagery, & Laying the Geocaches

Though some work has already been done, there is still much to do. We estimate 7 to 11 months will be needed (depending on weather, and in some cases getting permissions) to complete our travels, finish the photography, and lay the geocaches.

Book Production

After the photo-expeditions are finished, and the geocaches are laid, it should take about 6 to 9 weeks to finish up the book and get a proof copy back from the printer. If all goes well with the proof, then it should take about 3 to 9 weeks after the proof is approved (depending on # of copies) to get delivery of the print run. After which I will sign and mail out books as quickly as possible for those that purchased the hard cover photo book.

Signed Prints

After the travels are finished, participants that paid for the Signed prints will receive an email with a link to a selection of photos to choose from. Orders for prints will be placed as responses are received. Photo Print orders are generally received from the printer within 5 to 10 business days. We will sign the backs of print orders as they come in and mail them back out as quickly as possible, generally in a “first in first out” basis.

You will Receive Stuff throughout the Duration of the Project!

There will be regular online updates throughout the life project, ranging from geocaching coordinates and hints, to photos & videos, as well as the option to purchase neat little project related products like mugs, T-shirts, cards, stamps, etc…

What if the Desired Funding Goal is not Reached? Every bit helps!

If the desired funding goal is not met, it will simply limit the scope and coverage of the project. So, there will still be an adventure to be had, a geocaching trail laid, digital materials produced, as well as a book, it will simply be at a different scale of coverage if the desired funding level goal is not reached. We also have a "Plan-B" -- i.e. we will also be seeking some commercial advertising sponsors along the way, so that should also help move the project along as well if the desired funding goal is not reached.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, but you just can't contribute at the moment, spread the word! Tell you friends about us via email, Facebook, Twitter, etc… Use the Indiegogo share tools.

http://igg.me/at/New-Mexico-Gods

You can also support the project by purchasing cool products like posters, stamps, cards, mugs, and more from our store on Zazzle (which will be updated on a regular basis during the project) or by donating bitcoin. See the links below.

http://www.zazzle.com/newmexicogods*

 

Donate Bitcoins


1KBqNLgsJSrQavRh2ArymFpXcFq5hprc5F

If you would like to use BitCoin to purchase one of the above mentioned support tiers, use one of the links below.

"Copper Level Bitcoin"  "Bronze Level Bitcoin "  "Silver Level Bitcoin"

"Gold Level Bitcoin"  "Platinum Level Bitcoin"  "Diamond Level Bitcoin"

"Arts Patron Level Bitcoin"

We have also added the option of utilizing an installment plan for those that would prefer to spread their sponsorship payments over a few months. For more information, click the link below:
http://www.whereskokopelli.com/NewMexicoGods/NMGSponsorInstallments.html

story:
Photography By MacGregor : A dude reborn

 I'm Andrew MacGregor and this is my rags to riches and back to rags story. I didn't really have the best childhood. I was bullied, isolated, Didn't have many friends and thus kept to myself a great deal. I felt the call of the artist but had never really found the medium that best suited me.  I picked up my first camera simply to put photos of my paintings (which were terrible, btw) online. After that it went back into the box where the dust started to gather. Took it back out to document a pretty spectacular winter we were having and a few weeks later I was getting money for my first commissioned gig. Shortly after that I was living in my car setting out on one hell of an adventure to rebuild my life. My camera and small bag of gadgets were all i had. After two years i was moving into my first apartment.  Photography was paying my bills and keeping a roof over my head.  What else it did was give me a reason to exist. Finally i found my medium. I could express myself artistically in a way that truly benefited others.  Let me share a little story.  When I was younger, maybe 13 years old, all i wanted was to be a writer. That didn't change for nearly 15 years.  Sure I came up with few story ideas, but i never got further than a few chapters into any project. I was an aspiring writer that could never find the time or energy to actually.... write.  Then I found photography. And for 8 years not a day went by where I didn't actively partake in something photo related. Whether it was going out on a shoot, reading a book/magazine, or watching a video tutorial on how to better my craft. Going to workshops, galleries, following others in the field to both learn from and appreciate.  I saturated myself with it. Any chance i could, I'd drink up more and more knowledge. It became the most important thing in my life.

  • This campaign came about because everything above did not have a happy ending. 2-3 years ago I left the entirety of my gear unattended and it was stolen. I loved working for myself but I was no businessman. I focused on the clients and the photos. It never dawned on me to get insurance on my equipment.  That is a mistake i've lived with all this time.  To struggle your entire life being told you're not good enough. Being treated as inferior. Having a story to tell but no one that would listen. Then to finally find the thing you were meant to do. The thing that made you feel validated and confident. The thing that gave you a voice to express yourself with. To suddenly have that taken...Kinda sucks. Suffice it to say i feel in to a dark depression and have been barely getting by since.  The reason for this campaign is twofold. One, to get back my successful business and do the work i was put here to do. Two, to get back the confidence, happiness, and sense of purpose that was taken.
  • I think its important to emphasize that people donating  aren't just helping a guy get back his picture gadgets, You're helping to restore his church, his spirit, his creativity , his mental health. Photography wasn't just a job. it was my religion, my zen, my art, and my therapy.

What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to explain what I'm asking for, i feel its important to explain what was stolen.
    In my Photog crate was about $13,000 worth of gear. Nikon D4 ($6k) a couple 2.8 Lenses ($2k each) Lighting set ($2k) and another 1,000+ in random accessories.
  • What I'm asking for is not $13,000. I'm asking for $6,000. Flexible Funded which i'll explain in a moment.
  • The Perks are going to be a work in progress. 
    Its difficult to assess perks when your campaign isn't about producing a finished product. BUT,  i got some good news on that front. I've enlisted the help of some of my best friends who happen to be incredible tattoo artists to design some super cool merch (a first for Photography by MacGregor) We're talkin T-shirts, Buttons, Stickers,  Posters.
    Speaking of posters, Contributors will be able to select images from a catalog and have posters made and sent right to there door.  That takes care of the people in the nose bleed sections. Maybe i can go a little further for my locals , im thinking  discounted or even FREE photo shoots based on amount donated.  Like I said, lots of details to hash out. This is a start.
  • As i mentioned earlier, I'm doing Flexible Funding on this campaign. I chose this because my goals can be broken up into intervals. While i am setting my sights on that $6000.00 mark. A lot can be done for less.  
    Full disclosure, It took me 3 years but I've saved up $2k. If i can hit $1800.00, I get a Nikon D850,
  • not as high end as my D4 (well techincally today it would be a D5 ) but a stellar piece to get me up and running.  With just the Camera a fair amount of jobs open to me. 
  • If I hit another $1800.00 then I can get my main work horse lens, Nikon 24-70 f2.8  (if i don't quite hit the second 1800 tier, i'd go for a third party equivalent. Tamron or Sigma) 
  • Camera + Lens opens up even more job opportunities.
    And if i can reach the goal then I'd also purchase a lighting set up and I'd be back to where i was 2-3 years ago just using less expensive versions of everything.  
  • Trying to keep things in perspective, Its daunting to think I'm trying to raise 2k or 4k or 6k. But I can rap my head around 240 people with $25 of disposable money to help a guy reclaim his dream.

The Impact

  • I made my career and reputation around giving high quality work for an affordable price. I undercut most locals.  And aloud people that couldn't typically afford the services of a professional photographer a break. I lile to think I improved the quality of life of most if not all of my clients by showing them how beautiful they were. I worked hard to make a band feel like rock stars no matter if they'd been together 20 years or 20 days. I brought my unique brand of magic to a couple of newly weds while saving them some money in the process.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm a broke dude. I typically live hand to mouth. I know a lot of people are in the same boat. If you can't spare the cash, do me a solid and spread this campaign far and wide.

::Among the items stolen was my external hard drives which stored the bulk of my portfolio. These are the few I kept on Facebook.

For full folders check out facebook.com/photographybymacgregor

not as high end as my D4 (well techincally today it would be a D5 ) but a stellar piece to get me up and running.  With just the Camera a fair amount of jobs open to me. 
If I hit another $1800.00 then I can get my main work horse lens, Nikon 24-70 f2.8  (if i don't quite hit the second 1800 tier, i'd go for a third party equivalent. Tamron or Sigma) 

Camera + Lens opens up even more job opportunities.And if i can reach the goal then I'd also purchase a lighting set up and I'd be back to where i was 2-3 years ago just using less expensive versions of everything.  
Trying to keep things in perspective, Its daunting to think I'm trying to raise 2k or 4k or 6k. But I can rap my head around 240 people with $25 of disposable money to help a guy reclaim his dream.


The Impact
I made my career and reputation around giving high quality work for an affordable price. I undercut most locals.  And aloud people that couldn't typically afford the services of a professional photographer a break. I lile to think I improved the quality of life of most if not all of my clients by showing them how beautiful they were. I worked hard to make a band feel like rock stars no matter if they'd been together 20 years or 20 days. I brought my unique brand of magic to a couple of newly weds while saving them some money in the process.
Other Ways You Can Help
I'm a broke dude. I typically live hand to mouth. I know a lot of people are in the same boat. If you can't spare the cash, do me a solid and spread this campaign far and wide.
::Among the items stolen was my external hard drives which stored the bulk of my portfolio. These are the few I kept on Facebook.













For full folders check out facebook.com/photographybymacgregor

story:
Hello!  My name is Dellana, also known as Rainwolf.  I am a self-taught, Seattle-based photographer whose passion is capturing in my photographs the amazing people, wildlife, and cultures I encounter during my extensive travels. 

I am creating this web site to raise funds to help me with my trip to Africa. I am really excited about this opportunity to go to Africa.  I will have three weeks in the rainy season to explore.  I'm so fortunate that my job, working for an airline, allows me to access very low airfares; however, Africa is a surprisingly expensive place to travel once you get there. 

Due to my diminished vision (explained further below), I can only travel when I have someone to travel with me. In order to be able to explore the animal preserves in Africa, I will need to

  • hire a guide
  • pay park fees (minimum $200 per vehicle per day plus gas)
  • pay for park lodging.

The average low end (off-season) trip runs about $500 a day. My goal is to raise $5000 to help me fully realize the possibilities of this African adventure.

Reaching beyond my goal will also allow me to purchase a new lens for my Pentax K5 camera  and help me create a  photography book of my travels in Africa.

Your donation can really make a difference and will help cover travel costs, accommodation and translation in the parks. As well as possible photography equipment upgrades and future photography books!

Why Africa?  Why now?  

This trip is planned because a friend, Maya, is currently in Tanzania Africa, working to help protect the elephants from the local farmers as well as protecting the local farms from the elephants. I have a rare, unique opportunity to visit Maya to share her intimate perspective of Africa, some of its problems, and many of its joys. We may be able to explore some of the surrounding countries as well.

What is my style of photography?

Cultures, architecture, history, and nature are all of interest to me. Every place has a special beauty and meaning in our world that we all need to learn about in order to expand our world vision and protect our environment.

  

As an insatiable traveler who is also legally blind, I began using photography to collect bits of architecture, geography, culture and the natural world, so I could examine them in detail and share my unique perspective when I got home. Over time I found my limited vision to be an asset. Often it allows me to view the common place from an uncommon perspective. I am thankful for an art that allows me to share my view of our world.

 

 

Due to my severe tunnel vision, I am able to see things around me just one small section at a time. I find this helps me as a photographer, though, because my field of vision is the same or smaller than the field of vision in a camera lens. I have a unique ability to focus on details in everyday life that many people don’t notice. 


  

What is the cause of my unique view of the world? 

I have a genetic condition called Usher Syndrome. Usher Syndrome is a condition characterized by hearing loss or deafness and progressive vision loss. The loss of vision is caused by an eye disease called retinitis pigmentosa which affects the layer of light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye (the retina). Vision loss occurs as the light-sensing cells of the retina gradually deteriorate. Night vision loss begins first, followed by blind spots that develop in the side (peripheral) vision. Over time, these blind spots enlarge and merge to produce tunnel vision. In some cases of Usher Syndrome, vision is further impaired by clouding of the lens of the eye (cataracts). Usher Syndrome is thought to be responsible for 3 percent to 6 percent of all childhood deafness and about 50 percent of deaf-blindness in adults. 


What are my lifetime goals?  

Before I lose all my vision, I plan to see every country in the world at least once in all its beauty. I want to share the world’s beauty, complexity, uniformity, diversity and wonders. I intend one day to create an entire book of my travels and photography to show the world that everyone can achieve their dreams if they are willing to try, work hard, and continue even when everyone says it is not possible. 

… dreams like being a blind photographer …

I have received a lot of encouraging feedback and moral support. I just need a bit of financial backing to keep going.

I’d like to offer you something in return for your support!!  

I am offering a professional print of your choice from either my current collection of photographs or from the photographs I bring back from Africa.  All prints will be mailed after I come back from Africa and have had time to post a collection for you to choose from. 

  • $25 will receive one 8 x 12 print 
  • $50 will receive one 12 x 18 print 
  • $100 will receive one 20 x 30 print 
  • $500 will receive one 20 x 30 canvas print and one 20 x 30 print 
  • $1000 will receive two  20 x 30 canvas prints and two 20 x 30 prints


Thank you very much for your time, help and donations! I am always grateful for everyone who helps me along my journey. May your dreams burn bright in the night and you succeed in your journey!


Not able to fund this project at the moment but want to help anyway? Please share this campaign widely. The more this is shared the better the chances of reaching my goals!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Joseph Richardson and I work with Triple J Revealed Imagery when this Idea just came to my mind.
  • Cosplay4Cancer is a calendar which is ment to help with finding a cure for cancer, which effects almost everyone. My wife's dad is battling with hodgkin's lymphoma and thus my idea to combine 2 things in my life to help others.
  • You will be helping make this calendar a reality and helping find a cure at the same time!

A little back story:

Okay rewind back to 2005 I was 19 and doing my own thing, my wife had just moved to Canada from China and was with her mother and father. Once they got to Canada they took her mother straight to the hospital as she wasn't feeling good just before they left China and that is when they found out she had ovarian cancer, after about 3 weeks her mom started getting extremely sick so her dad flew her back to China figuring that it would be the best solution, about 2 years later her mom passed away in hospital. 

Fast forward 2010 my wife and I had just gotten married and were planning on making a trip out to China, so I could finally meet her dad and the rest of the family. It was in October during the world fair and golden week (big nation holiday in China that lasts 2 weeks....a lot of people have time off during that time) when we got there to do a traditional Chinese reception (for the grooms that means you get very drunk and very fast) anyways back to the story, that is when we found out her dad had just gone through leukemia treatment for having hodgkin lymphoma type B (yes that is a type of cancer for those of you who don't know). Now her dad is still alive but the cancer has come back which is a big concern for us and this is what type of dilemma I deal with on my own personal basis everyday.

I hope that helps clarify my cause and may it let more people come together to help others that may need treatments or hopefully a cure for future generations.

What We Need & What You Get

The Break Down

  • The main cost is getting the calendars made which is about $10 per calendar, the other $5.00 will be going to the Canadian Cancer Society and Alberta ride to conquer cancer. 
  • The biggest perk is your helping a great cause and you get a calendar full of very talented cosplayers. 
  • The funds will still be going to the same place, naturally as we get more of these calendars sold the cheaper the calendars become for manufacturing. The rest of the money will go into upgrading photography equipment and funding more projects in the future that will benefit the community.

The Impact

  • It gets the word cosplay out there more and it's going to help a great cause!

Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest challenge that I have faced so far is getting the cosplay models to work around their schedules to help out.
  • There really is no risks unless my camera randomly breaks then that could pose a slight problem......
  • Making the Deadline seems like a tough task with organizing all the photo shoots with these cosplayers!

Other ways you can help!

  • Don't sweat it if you can't buy a calendar just spread the news and make this become a sensation.
  • Remember use the share tools on the site to make it easier to get the word out!

story: Due settimane fa, nell'attesa del coraggio e della voglia di comporre un nuovo sito web, avevo deciso di creare una pagina facebook riguardante i miei lavori di fotografo. Chi mi conosce sa quanto mi sia difficile espormi e mettermi in gioco: ebbene quel giorno, dopo tre anni di esitazioni, ero riuscito a uscire dal mio guscio. Tuttavia, nell'euforia e nel nervosismo dell'impresa, ho tirato un cavo USB di troppo e ho fatto cadere l'hard disk che conteneva 15 anni di lavoro, di passione e soprattutto di fotografie. Dentro c'erano tantissime immagini dal valore soprattutto personale e molte altre invece, specialmente quelle di musica, che avendo smosso l'emotività di molti praticamente non mi appartenevano più. La società di recupero dati cui ho affidato il mio hard disk, dopo tutta una manfrina dai toni tecnicoapocalittici che preludeva all'estorsione perfetta, mi ha chiesto 1171.2€. Io questi soldi al momento non li ho, quindi ho pensato di girarvi il ricatto che mi ha fatto Recovery Farm srl: se non raccolgo 1171€ (+ il 4% per la società di crowdfunding) entro 15 gg. lavorativi tutte le preziose foto dei Baustelle, di Tony Dallara e di tanti altri verranno cancellate per sempre; e insieme a loro anche tutte quelle che avrei voluto fare per tediarvi con la mia struggente opera visiva per tanti anni a venire (visto che non potrei mai reggere al colpo basso della cancellazione della mia storia e sarei costretto a dedicarmi a tempo pieno al balconing estremo o al no-bungee jumping).

story:
During one week in March of 2017, I was having problems with my sleep schedule and kept waking up at 4 A.M.. Each morning I would wake to this incredible stillness, seeming like all life and activity had been halted or something. This reoccurrence caused me to think about 4 A.M.. After pondering, asking a few friends, and looking up information about it, it is the hour of day in which the most people are asleep. It is the hour in which both the night owls (who typically fall asleep by 3) and the early birds (who wake at 5) are asleep. Even if one is awake at 4, like I was during that week of insomnia, they are usually inside or in bed. The only people who are awake at this hour, are the individuals who have to be (farmers, postal workers, etc.), so most of us probably do not know what is happening at this time of day.

I have been developing my skills as a photographer for about 8 months now, and I am at the point in which I am ready to make my first body of work. I want to show people what they may not normally see. I am planning to create multiple 4 A.M. series, in which I go out between the times of 4 and 5 a.m. and shoot photos of what is going on in different places. For my first, I want to make it in the town of Sharon Springs, NY. Sharon is a unique town that I grew up going to, so it is sentimental to me. It is a place that has the combination of small town kitschiness and beautiful scenery, and I think it is the perfect first place to capture what is happening at this unique time of day.

My timeline for this series goes as follows:

-Shoot photos between the times of 4 A.M. and 5 A.M. in Sharon Springs during June of 2017.

-Design the book that compiles this first photo series during July and the first few weeks of August of 2017.

-Manufacture copies of the book by the end of September of 2017.

Funds

As far as funding goes, I am putting everything that I can into making this project happen. 

I am looking for funds to:

-Purchase necessary equipment to create quality photographs for this series and for future series and prints to come. 

-Create high quality prints of these photographs to display,

-Provide a well-designed and well-printed book of my first formal photo series (Hopefully Hard-cover)

If you are curious and/or interested in seeing what I find is happening during the time in which we are normally asleep, you can help me create it. Thank you for your support.

Best,

Gabe

story:
Short Summary

  • I am a photographer and videographer. I have been shooting for about 15 years.
  • I am going to open a studio for Photography and Videography. I will have some freelancers working for me while they learn the business and go off on their own. 
  • I need to get more camera equipment and some pro-printing equipment. I need to purchase 2-4 Mac Computers that will handle the job of Photo and Video editing and rendering. Office equipment will be necessary as will licenses and fees need to be paid to start up the business. There will also be other costs that I am not able to foresee at this point.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am going to need $25,000.00 at a minimum to get everything off the ground. I shoot portraits, landscapes, weddings, and groups. 
  • I have a mentor who has been shooting for over 50 years who has been guiding me for the last 8 years.
  • Because of the type of funding I have chosen I will recieve all but 9% if I don't make my goal amount. So I will have some money to start but not all of it if I don't make my goal. If I do make my goal then the fee they charge is only 4%. I will get 5% of the initial take back upon getting full funding.
The Impact
  • I am a very good photographer. I hear that from people all the time. I also get asked why I am not in business for myself. I have a passion for photography and this is what I am going to do for the rest of my life as I know it. I expect to get no less than 20 years out of this business.
  • I have experience working in companies and in my own businesses. I spent 20 years in Telecommunications in Southern California. I will be using the knowledge I gained there to make this business thrive.
  • I am 52 years old. I have been around the block. The best way for me to make my mark on humanity is to do this the best way I know how. I am a member of Adobe and Kelby Live as well as member of the National Association of Photoshop Professionals: http://members.photoshopuser.com/. I also have membership in the Professional Photographers of America. I use Adobe products exclusively. I also use Canon Camera equipment and Epson Printers.

Risks & Challenges

  • I know as a new business there are large risks to be aware of. I am looking at those risks all the time. I am working with Score here in Portland, OR in order to learn some business acumen to make me ever more aware of just what I am putting my feet into now.
  • I am a member of some of the organizations I am so that I can get the experience and knowledge of others who are in business now and still others who have gone before me. 
  • Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please folks to get the word out and make some noise about my needs to make this happen. I will do what I can to facilitate whatever it is you need to make that happen
  • Indiegogo is full of tools and can help you raise the funding you need as well. I wish that you enjoy my photos and give generously to my cause. Chrissy Michelle Strawn

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Please folks to get the word out and make some noise about my needs to make this happen. I will do what I can to facilitate whatever it is you need to make that happen

Indiegogo is full of tools and can help you raise the funding you need as well. I wish that you enjoy my photos and give generously to my cause. Chrissy Michelle Strawn

story:
Short Summary

With Rebellion festival being the world’s largest punk rock music festival I feel it would make an excellent subject for a “coffee table” style book combining my photographic output with a history of Rebellion and interviews with the artists and fans that make this such an important event on the Punk Rock calendar. Also, with the world climate the way it is at the moment, punk rock is making a huge comeback which warrants such a publication for the punk community to have their say!

Having always wantied to attend this festival, I’ve found it next to impossible to fund from my Antipodes home in New Zealand. But I am determined to make it for 2013 through a crowd-funding effort and with the anticipated support of the festival organisers. And, if I’m going to do it, why not do it in style and produce a book about it?

I’m blessed with the fact that, having been on the local Punk scene for many years, I’ve already met many of the artists as they toured New Zealand and we’ve always got on famously. I feel they would be highly supportive of a documentary book on the festival.

I am currently researching an independent publishing house to provide the physical publication and anticipate it could be distributed world-wide through  various independent DIY distros such asProfane Existence in the US, Sudden Death in Canada (I’m sure Joey Shithead will throw his weight behind it) and maybe someone like Shellshock or Rough Trade in the UK/Europe. If the project comes to fruition, 50% of the proceeds from sales would go to Rebellion Festivals or their nominated charity in the punk community.

Thanks to phase I of this campaign I've essentially covered most of my airfares so this phase I'm looking for funds to offset publishing costs!

What We Need & What You Get

Essentially, I need travel expenses and publication costs covered and, depending on your contribution, you'll get a credit in the book minimum. See the perk list.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you can't contribute financially there are other ways you can help, especcially in the UK, whwere I'll be in need of transport and accommodation (I love couches). I'm also on the hunt for independent distributors around the world so if you can help in any of these areas please e-mail me directly (roger@Rokpx.com)

story:
I am the founder of the facebook page Fort Tryon Flower Power

  • For 2 years I have been taking photos of the flowers and birdlife in Fort Tryon park and have amassed thousands of images that have given countless joy to people around the world.
  • Over the past few years I have invested thousands of hours in the hopes of building a community to share in the beauty of Fort Tryon park. I currently have 830 followers from around the world.
  • The campaign is to help me upgrade my camera. If you contribute you will be helping me document with even greater clarity a the flowers and wildlife of northern Manhattan 

 

What We Need 

 

  • I need to upgrade to a Nikon D500 camera which I am buying used for 1400$ from Ebay.
  • This is one of the best wildlife cameras on the market.
  • If I don't reach my goal I will sell some of my possessions to make up the difference.

The Impact

 

  • During the Pandemic we all need a little joy. Your contribution will help me capture even better images to share with the world.
  • I successfully had a campaign last year that allowed me to upgrade my lens

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't help I hope you can share my campaign on social media.
  • You can share using the share function directly from the indiegogo campaign page.

story:
About the book:

‘From the Riser: A Drummer’s Perspective II’ is a stunning collection of over two hundred live action drumming photos brought together in a large format coffee table book. The foreword is written by the drumming legend Neil Peart of Rush.

This project has been five years in the making and features around hundred twenty drumming legends.  The book aims to celebrate the world of drumming by taking you behind the scenes and showing you drummers doing what they do best. You’ll be able to see the view from behind the kit on stage in front of tens of thousands of people, get up close to the action at sound checks and checkout backstage. The behind the scenes photos will give you an Access All Areas Pass to a side of the live music industry few people have seen.

Following on from ‘A Drummer’s Perspective’, David Phillips’ first book, ‘From The Riser’ features more drummers, more pages and even better pictures. The powerful images and text aims to give a fascinating insight to the drummers, their playing and their world.

Target shipping date October 2016

For further information please visit:

http://www.music-images.co.uk/

https://www.facebook.com/ADrummersPerspective

About the Author:

David Phillips pictures have been published worldwide in books, on-line and in magazines. He specialises in live concert photography, and working with some of the biggest bands in the world. David has rare access to take photos behind the scenes, on-stage and back-stage.


Drummers to be in the book:

The author plans to feature approximately one hundred and twenty drummers each with a least one full page in the book with details of venue, date and tour memorabilia such as back stage and photo passes. All the photos in the book are taken by David Phillips. Eighty percent of the drummers in ‘From The Riser’ were not featured in ‘A Drummer’s Perspective’ and the other twenty percent are new unseen images of the drummers that were.

Deen Castronovo with Journey

List of drummers to be in the book:

Aaron Spears (Usher)

Airto Moreira (Weather Report/ Miles Davis)

AJ Pero (Twisted Sister)

Aquiles Priester (Hangar)

Zoro (Independent - Lenny Kravitz, Sean Lennon, Philip Bailey)

People that make it happen

Behind the scenes

Photo is of Adele's drummer Derrick Wright

Where will the pledge money be spent?

Much hard work and love has already gone into the making of this book. The project is near completion with all the photos already taken and approved. The money raised from this project will take the ‘From The Riser’ to its conclusion by covering the majority of the printing, production and design costs of the book. Plus additional costs for re-designing the book website, shipping and storage. This is a self-published book.

‘From The Riser’ will be a quality coffee table book printed to a very high standard on superior 150 gsm gloss paper with heavy weight gloss laminated cover. The book dimensions will be:

Width 12” (30 cm)

Height 9.5” (24.5cm)

“ A Drummers Perspective’ weighs 2.8 lbs. (1.27 Kilos). It is expected “From The Riser’ will come in at approximately 180 pages making it heavier than book one.

The only way the book will come to market is through your pledges. I would like to say a big thank you in advance to anyone that pledges support for my project. I know from the huge amount of warm feedback and comments on my first book that this second book will not disappoint. I feel that the more I photograph drummers the better I get and I am very excited to show the world this new collection of photos which captures that magic of drumming.

Risks and challenges:

I have all the photos and most of the copy is done. Only funding will affect the timing of the completion and delivery of the finished book. The target delivery date of late October 2016 is very achievable. I’m confidant any delay, should it occur, would be minor. Should any delays happen all pledgers will be kept informed.

Many thanks to Christian Aisbett for putting together video.

story:
***English will follow***

Le projet « État Brut : Corps sexués » ?

Ce projet vise à créer une banque d’images complète de photographies en haute définition afin d’illustrer sans censure les corps humains sexués. La représentation de la diversité est au coeur de ce projet.

Pourquoi faire un don?

Actuellement, l’éducation à la sexualité utilise principalement des schémas fictifs et limités afin de représenter le corps humain sexué. Le vide laissé par cette éducation  incomplète nuit à la construction d'une saine identité sexuelle en restreignant les représentations du corps sexué à celles véhiculées par la pornographie. Votre don au projet « État brut : Corps sexué » permettra de créer une banque d’images de qualité pour assurer une éducation à la sexualité adaptée et complète. Il permettra aussi une représentation plus inclusive de la diversité corporelle, favorisant ainsi l’acceptation de l’apparence du corps sexué.

Vos dons serviront à payer les frais associés à la création de la banque d'image.

Qui aura accès à la banque d'image?

La banque d'image sera disponible gratuitement pour les organismes à but non lucratif et les intervenant-e-s lors d'une utilisation à des fins non commerciales.

Les OBNL souhaitant utiliser la banque d'image à des fins commerciales ainsi que les entreprises privées devront, quant à elles, faire l'achat des droits des photos. Cet argent sera réinjecté dans le développement des projets futurs de la revue sexologique Les 3 sex*. 

Quel organisme j'encourage par mon don?

Vous fournirez une aide précieuse à Les 3 sex*, un organisme à but non lucratif qui lutte pour la santé sexuelle en mobilisant la communauté professionnelle et universitaire autour d’enjeux sexologiques.

**************************************

About the project

We aim to create a complete high quality image bank of sexual bodies without censorship. Diversity is at the center of this project.

About my donation

Nowadays, sexual education uses primarily schematic and limited imagery to represent the sexual body. This void - created by a deficient sexual education - harms the construction of a healthy sexual identity by restricting body representations to the ones conveyed by pornography.

By financially supporting this project, you participate in the construction of an appropriate and complete sexual education. Furthermore,  you will participate in spreading  an educative tool promoting an inclusive representation of body diversity.

About the image bank

The image bank will be free for non-profit organizations and agents aiming to use the photos in a non-commercial way.

Private companies and non-profit organizations looking to use the photos in a commercial way will have to buy the proper rights to use the image bank. This money will be used on future projects of Les 3 sex*

About the organization Les 3 sex*

By supporting this project, you support Les 3 sex, a non-profit organization that fights for sexual health by mobilizing the professional and academic communities around sexual issues.

Le vide laissé par cette éducation  incomplète nuit à la construction d'une saine identité sexuelle en restreignant les représentations du corps sexué à celles véhiculées par la pornographie. Votre don au projet « État brut : Corps sexué » permettra de créer une banque d’images de qualité pour assurer une éducation à la sexualité adaptée et complète. Il permettra aussi une représentation plus inclusive de la diversité corporelle, favorisant ainsi l’acceptation de l’apparence du corps sexué.Vos dons serviront à payer les frais associés à la création de la banque d'image.Qui aura accès à la banque d'image?La banque d'image sera disponible gratuitement pour les organismes à but non lucratif et les intervenant-e-s lors d'une utilisation à des fins non commerciales.Les OBNL souhaitant utiliser la banque d'image à des fins commerciales ainsi que les entreprises privées devront, quant à elles, faire l'achat des droits des photos. Cet argent sera réinjecté dans le développement des projets futurs de la revue sexologique Les 3 sex*. Quel organisme j'encourage par mon don?Vous fournirez une aide précieuse à Les 3 sex*, un organisme à but non lucratif qui lutte pour la santé sexuelle en mobilisant la communauté professionnelle et universitaire autour d’enjeux sexologiques.**************************************About the projectWe aim to create a complete high quality image bank of sexual bodies without censorship. Diversity is at the center of this project.About my donationNowadays, sexual education uses primarily schematic and limited imagery to represent the sexual body. This void - created by a deficient sexual education - harms the construction of a healthy sexual identity by restricting body representations to the ones conveyed by pornography.By financially supporting this project, you participate in the construction of an appropriate and complete sexual education. Furthermore,  you will participate in spreading  an educative tool promoting an inclusive representation of body diversity.About the image bankThe image bank will be free for non-profit organizations and agents aiming to use the photos in a non-commercial way.Private companies and non-profit organizations looking to use the photos in a commercial way will have to buy the proper rights to use the image bank. This money will be used on future projects of Les 3 sex*About the organization Les 3 sex*By supporting this project, you support Les 3 sex, a non-profit organization that fights for sexual health by mobilizing the professional and academic communities around sexual issues.

story:
Influence Marketing & Native Advertising

Monetize Your Influence

on PicsRox.com


Hi, as many of you, I love photography and explore great pictures on Tumblr, Facebook, Flikr, Instagram, Pinterest and other photo sharing networks. But, does photographers make money there when we look at their awesome shots? No, no one is paying them for viewing their photos! 

I want change this by launching Photo Monetization Network PicsRox.com - a photo sharing and influence marketing platform allowing photographers and influencers monetize photos from native advertising sharing posts via their followers and using hashtags to reach worldwide audience. 

Proof of Concept is available now at PicsRox.com!

What is the concept of #PicsRox startup?

  • Let photographers tell stories to engage people to action: 
    - go for offers, like, share, discuss or see more related photos
  • Let photos work for money 
    - get paid each time photo has been viewed and engaged people to action
  • Let photos engage people on different social networks who
    - follow photographers and influencers
    - follow or browse hashtags

How it will work?

  • Advertiser set budget, register hashtag and offers
  • Photographers take and share photos with personal messages and hashtags to influence engagement of followers
  • Influencers share posts made by photographers to influence engagement of followers
  • Followers and their friends discover offers in shared photos and messages
  • Explorers search points and topics of interest by hashtags and discover offers in amazing pictures and engaging discussions

For example?

  • Photo I taken at Lido restaurant with my personal message to friends and followers on Tumblr

  • post shared by me for my friends on Facebook

  • Pin on Pinterest

Why native advertising?

Interest to native advertising is growing and I believe that advertisers in partnership with photographers and influencers who have many followers could easily benefit from this. 

What I did so far?

  • I created proof of concept website and filling it now with photos. The website is blog on Tumblr.com so you can access posts from Tumblr's apps for Android and iOS mobile devices as well. Please visit PicsRox.com and PicsRox blog using Tumblr's mobile apps to learn more.

What I will do with collected funds even don’t reach my entire goal?

  • spend on development of platform for counting hits and billing (major part of funds) and also native mobile apps for Android and iOS to interface directly with created blog on Tumblr.com.

How much time development may take?

  • about 4 months if I reach entire goal, but may take longer if not

I would appreciate you for sharing PicsRox.com campaign that help spreading the word about new PicsRox's way of monetizing photos.

I believe your contribution and spreading the word to your friends will help me introduce to the world the new, fair and helpful way of native advertising.

Thank you for your help.

Your Germans Ribakovs and PicsRox.com

#PicsRox

#LetYourPhotosWorkForYou

#NativeAdvertising

#RevenueSharing

story:
what's the deal:

my name is aaron and i'm a photographer. i'm about to embark on a pretty epic trip to some pretty epic places. this has been a dream of mine for a while, and in essence, i've been training for it for years. 

me and 4 of my closest friends are starting our journey in atlanta, ga on june 25th with our first destination being the badlands. we'll camp there a night to get a sunset and a sunrise, then head out the next day for devil's tower and then on to beartooth highway where we'll stay for a few days. when the time is right, we'll move on to yellowstone where we'll stay for a 3-4 days and hit the hot spots as well as do some exploring of our own. the last stop will be the grand tetons and we'll be there a few days as well to really take it all in.  

i'm not asking you to pay for my trip, i'm simply offering you an opportunity to get some really great art to either hang on your walls or put on your coffee table. whatever you purchase through this campaign will be at a discounted rate compared to my normal prices. this is an opportunity to get in on the front end.  

perks:

1. for $250 you'll get a hardcover book. printed by artifact uprising, this 11x8.25 book will be a perfect addition to your coffee table. filled with my favorite 100 images from the whole trip. 

2. for $125 you'll get a large print. at the end of the trip, i'll edit my 100 favorite shots and you'll be able to access a private gallery where you'll be able to choose what print you would like. all prints will be 24x36 and printed on the beautiful Epson Portfolio Lustre paper and shipped to your door. 

3. for $75 you'll get a softcover book. same description as the hardcover book...only softer.

4. for $35 you'll get 5 4.5x6.25 postcards with random selected images from the trip. 

5. what else would you like to see? contact me and request another option.  

    why support this trip?

    simple. in our digital age, we've easily lost sight of what it feels like to hold a beautiful print of an awe-some place or a perfect moment in our hands. we buy cheap prints from ikea that everyone else has hanging in their house. things don't move us like they used to. i had this idea to offer opportunities on the front end of my trip rather than the tail end for a couple reasons:

    1. it will fuel my passion for capturing beauty even more. if i know you're excited to get a print, my eyes will be open even more. i will commit to capture the moments and the beauty with an even greater zeal than i normally would. because i'm not just shooting for me anymore, i'm shooting for you. 

    2. i believe that if you invest your money into something it means even more. you'll have a story to tell about that print that hangs above your couch or bed when someone asks, not just the name of a store. 

    i'm titling this trip "sojourn: yellowstone" in hopes that there are other "sojourn:" trips in the near future. as always, i'm available to you for questions/comments/suggestions. i'd love to hear from you and can't wait to make beautiful art for you.  

    Thank you for stopping by.  aaroncoury@me.com

story:
Upgraded Equipment: A Necessity

The time has come - if I want to progress further into the world of professional photography, I need to go bigger and better. The only problem is: photo equipment is prohibitively expensive.

As many of you may know, I often donate my professional photography services to our local community as a way to make professional photography available for everyone. So now I turn to you, my community, to donate whatever you can to help me get the photo equipment that I need to continue to improve myself and my business, as well as continuing to provide you with great services!

If You've Never Heard of Me

My name is Julia O Test and I'm a freelance photographer in the San Francisco Bay Area. I founded Julia O Test Photography in 2004, and have since been providing our community with stellar boudoir, portrait, events, conceptual, and fine art photography.

I'm trying to raise $5,000, as that is the minimum it will cost me to buy the gear I need at this point to be competitive in the field.

Anything you can donate is hugely appreciated! Don't forget to check out the awesome gifts you get with larger donations. If you can't donate money, please help by sharing this campaign with your community!

You can browse my portfolio at www.juliaotestphotography.com.

Is Photography Equipment Really That Expensive?

Unfortunately, yes! Even the equipment on the less expensive side is expensive. Let me break it down for you with some less expensive (but still high quality) equipment:

  • Canon 6D with kit lens : $2,400
  • 50mm lens: $300
  • 85mm lens: $360
  • Battery grip: $250
  • External flashes: $550
  • Radio flash triggers: $230
  • Flash stand and umbrella kit, flash cord: $100
  • Backdrop kit: $100
  • Tripod: $200
  • Memory cards, batteries for camera and flash, camera bag, hand strap, etc.: $450

Plus taxes and shipping for online orders.

All of the funds that I receive from this fundraiser will go towards photography equipment - every last cent!

Please donate and help me reach my goal of purchasing high quality equipment so that I can continue documenting your beautiful selves!

story:
About the project

We are two people from different backgrounds: Oxalis from Indonesia and Maarten from the Netherlands. In our project “Supper Snapshots”, we both took a photo of our food every day and posted them on our blog. The project was started as an experiment: to see how our backgrounds influenced our eating patterns. Inevitably, our backgrounds did not only influence our culinary preferences, but also our photographic styles.

In the beginning we merely documented our meals, but as time went on we explored both more gastronomic and photographic possibilities. Some photos are staged, others highly improvised, and most of them have a playful and spontaneous character. Have a look at suppersnapshots.blogspot.com!

This project ran for two full years, and resulted in a collection of 1,468 photos. Among them are some gems that deserve better presentations than merely being 400x300-pixel images on the blog... After a small and successful photo exhibition in Bandung’s Common Room last year we will exhibit our finest selection of Supper Snapshots in the near future: in That’s Life Coffee cafe in Jakarta and the C2O library in Surabaya.

Two centrepieces of the exhibition are cooperations with Studiomili, a design studio from Jakarta, who will enrich the photos with their drawings - creating two mixed-media artworks where photography and illustration meet.

We need you to realise those exhibitions, but we’re not simply asking for money: by contributing, you can receive all kinds of rewards. Depending on the donation amount you can buy postcards, quality photo prints to hang on your wall, photobooks and more -- all of them are carefully selected from the best photos in our collection. Additionally, the names of all contributors will be mentioned in the best-of photobooks.

We will start sending rewards to all contributors after the opening of the first exhibition early February.

Don't have a paypal account? You can donate with your credit card via paypal without requiring a paypal account. Take the following steps:

> When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
> Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
> Complete the form
> When you get to the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account...", **uncheck** the box.
> Click "review and continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card.
> Click on the "continue without logging in" link

Need help, or not able to donate through indiegogo for any reason? Just send us an e-mail at mail.suppersnapshots@gmail.com and we'll tell you how you can easily make your donation! 

Further details

Your donations will be used for making high quality prints of the exhibition photos, buying good-looking photo frames, doing promotion for both events, publishing a set of best-of photobooks (also available as donation rewards!), and for travel expenses and other organizational costs.

For the first exhibition we will collaborate with two illustrators from Studiomili, and to celebrate this unique fusion we will open on 2/2 (2nd of February). It will be held at the atmospheric That’s Life Coffee in southern Jakarta which combines the joy of good coffee with the display of visual arts. The same selection will be exhibited in the C2O library in Surabaya, a nice independent library which also hosts art exhibitions. We will keep all our contributors updated on the progress of both exhibitions.

Links

www.studiomili.com

www.thatslifecoffee.wordpress.com

http://c2o-library.net/?lang=en

story:
Hello I’m Fábio Inácio!

I was born in 1985 and grew up at a seashore village named Maceira (Torres Vedras). My interest on Photography got bigger and bigger as years gone by and so I felt the need to develop on the subject:

•Black & White Photography Workshop, Nanã Sousa Dias (2007)

•Fashion Workshop, Mário Principe (2008)

•Fashion Workshop, Bernardo Coelho & Paulo Costa (2009)

•Photography Professional Course, Restart School (2010/2011)

Sitting at a desk or being at home all day is impossible since I was a child. I practice several sports and bodyboard is one of them, I’ve always been a very dynamic person. Seven years ago I started to invest my time in Photography and it got serious this past few years. My photo topics are often People, Nature, Sports and in a broad sense, cultural and social diversity.


Walking Around - The Journey 

The main goal from this campaign will be traveling around the world during a year minimum and cross North America, Central and South America, Oceania, Asia, Africa and at last Europe, starting from February, 2014.

To accomplish this plan I must reach the 16000€ goal. If i get 100% funded or more I will be able to make this trip last longer, until 2 years. If not, the journey will be made in less time and cross less countries/continents but I'LL ALWAYS BE MADE!

Preferential Countries: Canada, United States (hawaii, February 2014 World Bodyboard), Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia, Peru, Chile, Argentina, Brazil (World Cup 2014), New Zealand, Tahiti (World Surfing in Teahupoo, August 2014) Australia, Indonesia, Timor, Papua New Guinea, Philippines (Easter 2015) India, China, Japan, Mongolia, Russia, Ukraine, Turkey, Israel.


With this journey I intend to improve my professional career as a Photographer, gathering the greatest inspirations of my life: Photography and Travelling. 

I already have travelling-photography experience since I already travelled to Europe, Asia and Africa.


Budget and LifeStyle

If on one hand I'm self funded to part of this journey (it will always happen) on the other hand your contribution would be perfect to meet these goals since this way I would be able to make a bigger and more diverse travel. 

I plan to spend approximately 45€ a day to sleep, eat and travel.

I won't be living in luxury but close to local people. I will use couchsurfing and in last case Hostels. To travel, I'll fly to cross continents but always prefer train, bus and hitchhiking.

APA – For a good cause

Since I started this Project, I knew that I would benefit 5% from this campaign to an Association. I’m now involved with one that helps PALOPs’ Poor Children so this time I will add APA, a locally based Animal Association that protects and look after unsheltered animals.


Get Involved, I have something for you too

Besides the following perks, I will put you updated through weekly Site/Blog, Facebook with photos, videos and meaningful things that will happen along the way.

Book: “Walking Around - Photography throughout the World”

This cross-the-world journey will be turned into a book where I will publish the best photos and to be edited in the end of 2016. 

Features:

  • A4 Size
  • Hard cover
  • 100 photos minimum
  • Preface by a Guest Photographer

The perk includes shipping to Portugal, the other countries will have to pay shipping costs.


Souvenir:

Will be sent during the journey from a country of my choice but you can notify to me your interests (handcrafted  bijou for example).

The perk includes souvenir and shipping costs for all countries. 


Photo-Postcard/Photography:

The photo-postal or 20x30 photo will be on your choice: you can choose between the previously existent on my site www.fabioinacio.com world section or wait for the end of the journey and choose one from it.

Perk includes your item plus print and shipping worldwide.


Bodyboard / Surf / Skimming Photographic Session 

To be done between Ericeira and Peniche.

Perk includes all the photos on CD and my travel to the meeting point between Ericeira and Peniche.


Contacts

My e-mail: finaciofotografia@gmail.com

My website: www.fabioinacio.com

My facebook: www.facebook.com/fabioinaciofotografia

My Blog: http://fabioinaciofotografia.blogspot.pt

This cross-the-world journey will be turned into a book where I will publish the best photos and to be edited in the end of 2016. 
Features:

A4 Size
Hard cover
100 photos minimum
Preface by a Guest Photographer

The perk includes shipping to Portugal, the other countries will have to pay shipping costs.

Souvenir:


Will be sent during the journey from a country of my choice but you can notify to me your interests (handcrafted  bijou for example).
The perk includes souvenir and shipping costs for all countries. 


Photo-Postcard/Photography:
The photo-postal or 20x30 photo will be on your choice: you can choose between the previously existent on my site www.fabioinacio.com world section or wait for the end of the journey and choose one from it.
Perk includes your item plus print and shipping worldwide.

Bodyboard / Surf / Skimming Photographic Session 
To be done between Ericeira and Peniche.
Perk includes all the photos on CD and my travel to the meeting point between Ericeira and Peniche.

Contacts
My e-mail: finaciofotografia@gmail.com
My website: www.fabioinacio.com
My facebook: www.facebook.com/fabioinaciofotografia
My Blog: http://fabioinaciofotografia.blogspot.pt

story: 1

Lets start from the beginning.

Roughly 9 years ago I was diagnosed with Cystic Fibrosis. I was considered, to put it mildly, a very unique case since I was quite older and never really presented any major symptoms.

Since CF is a fatal disease with NO KNOWN CURE, I was a bit of a medical anomaly. It’s only until VERY recently that half of all CF patients are now over the age of 18.

As a few years went by, I became increasing frustrated that the dialogue of CF was very juvenile, focusing more on parents and children. I realized I’m probably not alone in felling this way, so I embarked on my first photography project: JUST BREATHE. This focused on adults living with CF, and their particular issues, problems, emotions, etc. Book #1.

It was during the making of this first book I started hearing about other issues among adults, specifically among WOMEN with Cystic Fibrosis. It was after hearing enough of these stories that I decided to work on the second book: SALTYGIRLS. Well now… at first this caused quite a stir, because a small few just didn’t quite get the concept yet. But as the project grew, it became

a snowball that turned into a massive avalanche. By the summer of 2015 - even before the book was out - the SaltyGirls Idea went viral around the world (just see the list of media outlets below that covered it). We are all extremely proud of what we accomplished. Book #2.

Like a good movie trilogy, it’s now time to move on to the 3rd book. Officially, its called FAMILIES: THE SALTYKIDS PROJECT FOR CYSTIC FIBROSIS.

But we’ll just refer it as SALTYKIDS from here on in.

http://www.saltykidsproject.com

(fyi - new video coming soon)

___________________

AND HOW MUCH PRESS DID WE GET IN 2015???? Check out just some of the media outlets that covered SaltyGirls. I think SaltyKids can be even bigger!!! We got over 1 million hits on Buzzfeed!!!!




What We Need & What You Get

The fundraising will be divided into 2 parts. The first will be THIS initial campaign to raise a bit of funds to get on the road to get some families photographed. Like the SaltyGirls, there is a critical mass of photos that have to be attained before people REALLY pay attention. Thats what this initial push will be for.

Cystic Fibrosis is usually diagnosed right at birth. It is a lifelong disease. In the US, the median age of someone with CF is their early 40s. But with the advancement of current treatments and the promise of genetic cures coming, we are literally on the cusp of an actual cure. Those diagnosed with CF today have a bright future ahead. But that future is still filled with bumps along the way… bumps that the entire Family has to endure. And taking a large brunt of this - emotionally, financially - are the parents raising a child with CF. 

That is what this project will be focused on. The daily trials and tribulations - as well as hopes and dreams - of those Families.

And now of course the hard sell. Once again, like the other 2 books, i’m completely, utterly dependent on your generosity. 



The Impact

Awareness will lead to a cure, and I think we are REALLY CLOSE. In my lifetime too.

This book will help that.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously this entire project is depends on the generosity and kindness of others. Of course there are risks, BUT I HAVE PROVEN I am a man of my word. I promised JUST BREATHE and I delivered. I promised SaltyGirls would be huge AND IT WAS. No i make that same promise for this project.

(sorry these videos are slightly our of date but its all I have at the moment) ;)

story:
Despues de caer, nos levantamos.

Después de esa oscura noche, Estamos buscando todas las maneras posibles para poder recuperarnos. Es aquí donde necesitamos su ayuda. 

  • Somos Josue Bonilla y Jacob Valencia, (@josuebonillaph y @jakes_tapes) dos jóvenes fotógrafos que perdieron todo excepto la esperanza de seguir adelante y cumplir nuestros sueños.
  • Buscamos la forma en la que nos puedan ayudar a seguir adelante y demostrarle al mundo que no nos vamos a rendir.
  • Cualquier contribución, por más pequeña que sea, nos impulsa a trabajar más duro por nuestra meta. Cada grano de arena se puede convertir en una inmensa playa.

 

 

En lo que nos pueden ayudar y lo que damos a cambio.

  • Las perdidas estan alrededor de los 15.000 dolares, nuestra meta es llegar a los 12.000
  • El 10% de todo lo que sea recaudado será donado.
  • Le ofreceremos a cada donante un retrato profesional en muestra de agradecimiento.
  • Así recaudemos 1 peso, el 10% se irá a una fundación y el resto se invertira en en la recuperacion de los equipos para poder seguir trabajando con la mejor calidad.

La historia.

Josué es un joven empresario que desde hace tres años decidió dejar un futuro seguro, la escuela, y se ha dedicado tiempo completo a su empresa Josue Bonilla, la cual le ha dado trabajo a otros jovenes interesados en el campo audiovisual. Jacob es uno de ellos, el estudiante de comunicación había apoyado a Josué con sus propios equipos, tambien comprometidos esa noche. Ambos han ganado cierta reputacion a través del tiempo. Sus trabajos en instagram han sido apreciado en los varios círculos de fotógrafos de la ciudad. Los pueden encontrar como @josuebonillaph y @jakes_tapes respectivamente.

La noche del domingo 10 de septiembre de 2017, a eso de las 7:30 pm, en el sector de Bulevar Niza, Bogotá, Colombia. Varias personas irrumpieron por la ventana trasera y sacaron todos los equipos de fotografía del baúl. Dejandonos solo las billeteras y telefonos celulares para poder contactar a alguien. Después de llamar a la policía y esperar alrededor de 30 minutos, nos informaron que no habían ningún tipo de cámaras de vigilancia para poder seguir a los sospechosos o siquiera investigar el caso.

 

En este momento buscan la forma de recaudar todo el dinero posible para recuperar la inversión que les fue hurtada. Es aquí donde tu puedes contribuir, cualquier dolar, contribución o donación que puedas hacer marcará la diferencia.  

  • Más allá de lograr nuestra meta, pensamos en ser inspiración para todos aquellos que se han rendido ante sus sueños, jamás es tarde y con la ayuda de todos y Dios, nada es imposible.
  • Cualquier pregunta que tengan nos pueden escribir a nuestros instagram personales y las responderemos.

Otros modos de ayudar.

Si no puedes donar, está bien! hay otros modos de ayudar!

  • Esparce la voz! ayudanos a que más personas conozcan la campaña y nos puedan ayudar!
  • Vamos a empezar a vender galletas y todo tipo de dulces en las universidades! buscanos y apoyanos!

Gracias! son lo máximo!

story:
Summary

I am raising funds to produce a book from my long term photographic project  with the working title "Selling and Making".
I am a photographer based in London, UK and from 2007 until 2013 I worked on this project photographing small scale, specialist businesses and their owners here in this city. It was a personal project to which I added slowly whenever I came across another person or business that made me curious and which I wanted to let people know about.

Why
In our mass consumption chain store culture individual craftsmanship and personal attention are rare. Nonetheless London’s specialist businesses survive persisting in a way of doing business which is in stark contrast to impersonal corporate culture. The long term dedication and often hard and mundane day to day of these businesses does not correspond to the life and career aspirations of many in our fast paced society. But here shop room, goods and shopkeeper, workshop, tools and artisan merge their characteristics in time and personal histories have a tangible connection with the physical spaces inhabited. This linking between identity, space and occupation is at the heart of this book I want to make. I believe this type of small, individualist commerce is necessary and valuable and want to draw attention to it's decline but also to it's survival despite the odds.

The project so far
I have photographed close to 30 businesses and am working on an edit of about 24 for the book. There are portraits and interior photographs as well as a short text about each person and business based on my conversations and observations gathered during my visits to the shops and workshops.

The Plan
The most important part of the work, the gathering of the content, is done but making a book is expensive and I need to raise money in order to pay for the production. I have great team of people involved who will help me make this a beautiful and relevant book that will resonate in this time when the places as well as the people I have photographed are becoming more and more of a rarity: Dawn Lyon will contribute an introduction which will put the images and stories into the wider context of the changing nature of work and commerce. Mel Duarte will do the design beautifully and elegantly. And the wonderful Karen McQuaid, curator at The Photographers' Gallery, will help with the final edit of the images. The book will be printed in an edition of 500 and will be published through my publishing platform Paper Tigers Books.


What We Need & What You Get

The dream scenario:
The money I am trying to raise here is initially only a small part of the money I need to produce this book the way I want to. I am applying for public funding through the Arts Council of England for the larger part of the costs. I will know about the outcome of that application around the beginning of October.
The costs I need to cover over all are mainly for printing. If possible I would like to print this book in the UK. I have received a few quotes and from these the estimated cost for the printing is £6000. I would also like to pay the people who will work on this project a fair fee for their work. This is the part I am hoping to cover with the funds raised here.

What happens if I raise less money?
There are of course ways to produce this book with much less money.
I am hoping I won't have to take them up on that offer but everybody involved in the project has said that if it isn't possible to raise the funds they would work for free.
The choice of paper, size, number of pages and edition could also be adjusted to significantly reduce the cost by adjusting the design to fit those constraints.
And last but not least, - I will scape together my own pennies to make it happen.

So, - all your support is most appreciated as I will make this book one way or another.

What you get:
The Book: The most important return you will get from me for supporting the production of this book is the book itself. It seems the most relevant thing to give you.
It isn't made yet so I can not describe it to you but I can assure you it will be made beautifully with simple but beautiful materials.
I hope it will be a book that allows you to dive into the small words contained within the places I have photographed and learn something about the people I have met.

A print: If you want to contribute a little more I will myself go into an old fashioned  darkroom and make you a print of the following image taken at Mr. Thomas, a tailor's workshop in Soho:

Both: If you want both a book and a print that's even better! You'll get both for a little less than they would be separately.


Spread the word 

Please spread the word about the book and about this campaign. Tell people you think might find this interesting and share this campaign on facebook.

Also have a look at

www.papertigersbooks.com and www.laurabraunblog.blogspot.com for updates
